translated: Therein, homage by the body is generally by the head, by palms joined, and by all five limbs.

original: ngag gis phyag bya ba ni dang bas phyag bya ba sngon du 'gro ba'i yon tan brjod pa ni ngag gis phyag bya ba'o //
analyzed: ngag gis phyag bya ba ni dang bas phyag bya ba sngon du 'gro ba'i yon tan brjod pa ni ngag gis phyag bya ba'o //
translated: Homage by speech is homage by speech preceded by faith, expressing good qualities.

original: yid kyis phyag bya ba ni de'i yon tan gyi ngo bo mngon du byed cing de la sems 'dun pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyis phyag bya ba ni de'i yon tan gyi ngo bo mngon du byed cing de la sems 'dun pa'o //
translated: Homage by mind is the manifestation of the nature of its good qualities and the mental orientation toward it.

original: phyag 'tshal ba yang res 'ga' gzhan gyi ngor yang byed pas de'i phyir dang bas zhes bya bas bye brag tu byas so //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal ba yang res 'ga' gzhan gyi ngor yang byed pas de'i phyir dang bas zhes bya bas bye brag tu byas so //
translated: Homage is sometimes done for the sake of others. Therefore, it is specified by “faith.”

original: dang ba yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dang ba yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of faith:

original: dad pa tsam gyis rjes su 'brang ba ni grub pa'i mtha'i de kho na nyid ma rig pa bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi yon tan yang dag par brjod pa tsam las byung ba gang yin pa ste 'di ni chung du'o //🔽chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i ni theg pa chen po'i don gyi de kho na nyid yongs su shes pa las byung ste de bas ches lhag pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa tsam gyis rjes su 'brang ba ni grub pa'i mtha'i de kho na nyid ma rig pa bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi yon tan yang dag par brjod pa tsam las byung ba gang yin pa ste 'di ni chung du'o // chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i ni theg pa chen po'i don gyi de kho na nyid yongs su shes pa las byung ste de bas ches lhag pa'o //
translated: faith that is mere faith, which arises from merely hearing the correct explanation of the qualities of the Buddha, like a child’s faith in a magical being. This is the lesser kind.🔽Faith that follows the teachings arises from understanding the reality of the Mahayana teachings. It is greater than the former.

original: rtogs pa rnyed pa ni chos kyi de kho na mngon sum du byed pa'i sgo nas rtogs nas dang ba rnyed pa ste de bas kyang ches lhag pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa rnyed pa ni chos kyi de kho na mngon sum du byed pa'i sgo nas rtogs nas dang ba rnyed pa ste de bas kyang ches lhag pa'o //
translated: Faith that has attained realization arises from realizing the reality of the teachings by making them directly evident. It is greater still.

original: dang bas zhes bya ba ni khyad par du ma byas pa'i phyir ci rigs par rnam pa gsum char yang smos pa yin no //
analyzed: dang bas zhes bya ba ni khyad par du ma byas pa'i phyir ci rigs par rnam pa gsum char yang smos pa yin no //
translated: Faith is mentioned in this verse without any specification, so all three kinds are referred to, as appropriate.

original: 'dis ni ngo bo nyid du phyag bya ba bstan nas /
analyzed: 'dis ni ngo bo nyid du phyag bya ba bstan nas /
translated: This verse shows the homage in essence.

original: da ni mos pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni mos pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to show devotion, the verse says:🔽The wise, who are skilled in the means of accomplishing the two goals,

original: bzang po spyod pa'i smon lam stobs dag gis //
analyzed: bzang po spyod pa'i smon lam stobs dag gis //
translated: By the power of the prayer for good conduct,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: and so on.

original: zhing zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad yongs su gzung ba'o //
analyzed: zhing zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad yongs su gzung ba'o //
translated: Here, “field” refers to the taking up of all buddha-fields.

original: rdul zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rdul phra rab thams cad bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: rdul zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rdul phra rab thams cad bsdus pa'o //
translated: The word “particle” includes all atoms.

original: rdul phra rab de dag snyed de mnyam pa'i lus gang yin pa de dag la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: rdul phra rab de dag snyed de mnyam pa'i lus gang yin pa de dag la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: Those bodies that are equal in number to those atoms are called “as many as there are atoms in the fields.”

original: zhing gi rdul snyed kyi lus de dag gis so //
analyzed: zhing gi rdul snyed kyi lus de dag gis so //
translated: With those bodies, as many as there are atoms in the fields,

original: 'di skad du sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi rdul phra rab kyi grangs snyed kyi lus de rnams kyis rgyal ba thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi rdul phra rab kyi grangs snyed kyi lus de rnams kyis rgyal ba thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: This means that with those bodies, as many as there are atoms in all buddha-fields, he pays homage to all the Victors.

original: 'dis ni dus dang yul yongs su ma chad pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa gang yin pa dang / 'og nas 'byung ba mos pa gang dag yin pa de dag re re la yang zhing gi rdul @205a * //
analyzed: 'dis ni dus dang yul yongs su ma chad pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa gang yin pa dang / 'og nas 'byung ba mos pa gang dag yin pa de dag re re la yang zhing gi rdul @205a * //
translated: This shows that he pays homage to the teachings of the Tathāgatas, which are not limited in time or place, and to the aspirations that will be mentioned below, each of which is equal in number to the atoms in all buddha-fields.

original: snyed kyi lus rnams kyis phyag bya ba yang ston to //
analyzed: snyed kyi lus rnams kyis phyag bya ba yang ston to //
translated: He also shows that he prostrates with as many bodies as there are atoms in the buddha-fields.

original: 'di thams cad ni sems kyi kha phyi rol du lta bas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di thams cad ni sems kyi kha phyi rol du lta bas ni ma yin no //
translated: All this is not done with a mind that looks outward.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa re re zhing mdun na bzhugs pa bzhin yid kyis bsams te gus pa dang bcas pa'i lus de snyed kyis shin tu gus pas phyag bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa re re zhing mdun na bzhugs pa bzhin yid kyis bsams te gus pa dang bcas pa'i lus de snyed kyis shin tu gus pas phyag bya'o //
translated: He prostrates with that many bodies, with that much respect, thinking with his mind of each Tathagata as if he were present before him.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /🔽rgyal ba thams cad yid kyi mngon sum du //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir / rgyal ba thams cad yid kyi mngon sum du //
translated: To show just that, he says:

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: All the Victors are directly perceived by the mind.

original: de yang ji lta bu yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: de yang ji lta bu yin snyam pa la /
translated: And how is that?

original: bzang po spyod pa'i smon lam stobs dag gis //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: bzang po spyod pa'i smon lam stobs dag gis // zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: By the power of the good conduct of vows.

original: bzang po zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' kun du bzang po ste /
analyzed: bzang po zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' kun du bzang po ste /
translated: Good means the Bodhisattva Samantabhadra.

original: nyon mongs pas byas pa gcig kyang mi dmigs par rnam pa thams cad du spyod pa yongs su sbyor bas rnam pa thams cad du mdzes pa'i phyir kun du bzang po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pas byas pa gcig kyang mi dmigs par rnam pa thams cad du spyod pa yongs su sbyor bas rnam pa thams cad du mdzes pa'i phyir kun du bzang po zhes bya ste /
translated: Since he is completely pure in all ways, since he is completely pure in all ways in the purification of his conduct, he is called Samantabhadra, Good in All Ways.

original: de'i spyod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi smon lam ni bzang po spyod pa'i smon lam mo //
analyzed: de'i spyod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi smon lam ni bzang po spyod pa'i smon lam mo //
translated: His vow of the characteristics of conduct is the vow of good conduct.

original: de'i stobs kyis te de'i man ngag gi mthus de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad la phyag bya'o zhes 'phags pa nor bzang la de skad ces bstan to //
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis te de'i man ngag gi mthus de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad la phyag bya'o zhes 'phags pa nor bzang la de skad ces bstan to //
translated: By the power of that, by the power of the instructions of that, one should pay homage to all those Tathagatas.

original: de ltar na dang po ni ngo bo nyid du phyag bya ba la sogs pa sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal ba la dmigs pa'i sems pa'i khyad par rnams kyis rgya che ba bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar na dang po ni ngo bo nyid du phyag bya ba la sogs pa sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal ba la dmigs pa'i sems pa'i khyad par rnams kyis rgya che ba bstan to //
translated: Thus, the first homage, etc., which are in essence the homage to the Buddha, are taught to be vast by the distinctions of the thought that focuses on them.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag ji snyed bar sems dpa'i khyad par yang de snyed do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag ji snyed bar sems dpa'i khyad par yang de snyed do //
translated: As many as are those Tathagatas, so many are the distinctions of the bodhisattva.

original: las 'di ni shes rab kyi byed pas byas pa'i phyir sems yongs su sbyang ba 'di ni bsod nams kyi tshogs zhes kyang bya la /
analyzed: las 'di ni shes rab kyi byed pas byas pa'i phyir sems yongs su sbyang ba 'di ni bsod nams kyi tshogs zhes kyang bya la /
translated: Since this action is done by the activity of wisdom, this purification of the mind is called the accumulation of merit.

original: ye shes kyi tshogs zhes kyang bya'o //🔽mos pas phyag bya ba ni rdul phra rab thams cad kyi grangs snyed kyi lus rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas thams cad mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir de bas kyang spyod pa shin tu yangs pa nyid dang / shin tu zab pa nyid dang /
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs zhes kyang bya'o // mos pas phyag bya ba ni rdul phra rab thams cad kyi grangs snyed kyi lus rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas thams cad mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir de bas kyang spyod pa shin tu yangs pa nyid dang / shin tu zab pa nyid dang /
translated: It is also called the accumulation of knowledge.

original: ches phra ba nyid du ston to //
analyzed: ches phra ba nyid du ston to //
translated: The homage through belief is shown to be even more expansive, even more profound, and even more subtle than the homage through action, because it is engaged in with bodies equal in number to all atoms, and because it is done in the presence of all Buddhas.

original: mos pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mos pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the Tathagatas of belief,

original: rdul gcig steng na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rdul gcig steng na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, “On one atom,” and so on.

original: rdul phra rab gcig gi steng du sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi rdul phra rab kyi rdul gyi grangs snyed kyi de bzhin gshegs par mos pa'i shes pas mngon par dgod do //
analyzed: rdul phra rab gcig gi steng du sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi rdul phra rab kyi rdul gyi grangs snyed kyi de bzhin gshegs par mos pa'i shes pas mngon par dgod do //
translated: With the knowledge of belief, one should manifest as many Tathagatas as there are atoms in all Buddha-fields on one atom.

original: de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa nyag gcig ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa nyag gcig ni ma yin no //
translated: And these are not just the Tathāgatas alone.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor dang bcas pa dag go //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor dang bcas pa dag go //
translated: They are the bodhisattvas together with their retinues.

original: de dag kyang @205b spyod lam gzhan gyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang @205b spyod lam gzhan gyi ni ma yin no //
translated: And these are not in any other posture.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?🔽They are in the posture of sitting.

original: bzhugs pa'o // rdul phra rab kyi rdul gcig gi steng na ji lta ba de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi rdul phra rab kyi rdul re rer yang mngon par dgod do zhes de skad bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzhugs pa'o // rdul phra rab kyi rdul gcig gi steng na ji lta ba de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi rdul phra rab kyi rdul re rer yang mngon par dgod do zhes de skad bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to teach that just as on one atom, so on each atom of all buddha-fields, he says,

original: de ltar chos kyi dbyings rnams ma lus pa //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar chos kyi dbyings rnams ma lus pa // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus, in all the realms of the Dharma🔽.

original: 'dis kyang rdul phra rab re re smos pa ni snod rnams phra mor 'jug pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis kyang rdul phra rab re re smos pa ni snod rnams phra mor 'jug pa bstan to //
translated: This also shows that the mention of each atom indicates the entry of the receptacles into the subtle.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi bar smos pas ni ma lus par 'jug par bstan to //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi bar smos pas ni ma lus par 'jug par bstan to //
translated: The mention of the realm of the Dharma shows the entry into the entire.

original: thams cad smos pas ni bar med par 'jug pa bstan to //
analyzed: thams cad smos pas ni bar med par 'jug pa bstan to //
translated: The mention of all shows the entry without interval.

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas sras zhes smos pa dang ; bzhugs pa smos pa ni gnas pa po 'khor dang bcas pa gnas khyad par can dang bcas pa grangs med pa mngon sum du bya ba yang bstan te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas sras zhes smos pa dang ; bzhugs pa smos pa ni gnas pa po 'khor dang bcas pa gnas khyad par can dang bcas pa grangs med pa mngon sum du bya ba yang bstan te /
translated: Likewise, the mention of “Buddha’s sons” and the mention of “dwelling” indicate the manifestation of the immeasurable assemblies of the residents and their special abodes.

original: 'dis ni yongs su sbyangs pa'i khyad par snga ma las sems yongs su sbyangs pa'i khyad par lhag par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni yongs su sbyangs pa'i khyad par snga ma las sems yongs su sbyangs pa'i khyad par lhag par bstan to //
translated: This shows the superiority of the purification of mind over the previous special purification.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the Tathāgatas,

original: de'i yon tan brjod pas sems yongs su sbyangs pa'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i yon tan brjod pas sems yongs su sbyangs pa'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the special purification of mind by praising their virtues,🔽he says,🔽The oceans of inexhaustible praise of those

original: de dag bsngags pa mi zad rgya mtsho rnams //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de dag bsngags pa mi zad rgya mtsho rnams // zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Their praises are an inexhaustible ocean.🔽🔽

original: de dag ces bya ba ni ngo bo nyid dang / mos pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dag go //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni ngo bo nyid dang / mos pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dag go //
translated: “Those” refers to the essential and devoted Tathāgatas.

original: mi zad ces bya ba ni dus thams cad du rgyun mi 'chad pa ste /
analyzed: mi zad ces bya ba ni dus thams cad du rgyun mi 'chad pa ste /
translated: “Inexhaustible” means uninterrupted at all times.

original: 'dis ni dus la khyab pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni dus la khyab pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the pervasion of time.

original: bsngags pa rgya mtsho zhes bya ba ni yon tan gyi tshogs su thams cad du ldan pa nam mkha'i gtos khyab pa dag ste /
analyzed: bsngags pa rgya mtsho zhes bya ba ni yon tan gyi tshogs su thams cad du ldan pa nam mkha'i gtos khyab pa dag ste /
translated: The word “ocean” in the phrase “ocean of praise” refers to the totality of qualities that pervade the entire realm of space.

original: 'dis ni phyogs kyi tshogs la khyab pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni phyogs kyi tshogs la khyab pa bstan to //
translated: This verse shows that the bodhisattvas’ praise pervades the entire realm of space.

original: dbyangs kyi yan lag ni dbyangs 'grub pa'i rgyu ste lce dang rkan la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbyangs kyi yan lag ni dbyangs 'grub pa'i rgyu ste lce dang rkan la sogs pa'o //
translated: The “tones” are the causes of the production of sounds, namely, the palate, the tongue, etc.

original: rgya mtsho zhes smos pa ni sgra thams cad bsdus par bstan to //
analyzed: rgya mtsho zhes smos pa ni sgra thams cad bsdus par bstan to //
translated: The word “ocean” indicates that all sounds are included.

original: 'di skad du 'gro ba'i sgra 'grub pa rgyu re re la sgra thams cad sprul nas dngos po re re 'dod pa bstod pa brjod pa'i sgra ni phyogs dang dus dang dngos po thams cad la khyab pa dag gi zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du 'gro ba'i sgra 'grub pa rgyu re re la sgra thams cad sprul nas dngos po re re 'dod pa bstod pa brjod pa'i sgra ni phyogs dang dus dang dngos po thams cad la khyab pa dag gi zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: In other words, the sounds of all the languages of living beings are produced by each of the causes, and all things are praised by the emanations of all sounds.

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos las rnam par rgyal ba'i phyir rgyal ba'o //
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos las rnam par rgyal ba'i phyir rgyal ba'o //
translated: The word “victor” means that the bodhisattvas are victorious because they have conquered evil, nonvirtuous dharmas.

original: legs par 'dod pa dag gis 'dris par bya zhing yang dang yang gsom par bya ba yin pas yon tan te /
analyzed: legs par 'dod pa dag gis 'dris par bya zhing yang dang yang gsom par bya ba yin pas yon tan te /
translated: The word “good” means that the bodhisattvas are to be known and remembered again and again by those who seek what is good.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma 'dres pa la sogs pa thun mong ba dang / thun mong ma yin pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang @206a * //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma 'dres pa la sogs pa thun mong ba dang / thun mong ma yin pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang @206a * //
translated: The common and uncommon perfections and so forth, the mundane and supramundane perfections, the perfections of the three vehicles and the perfections of the Great Vehicle.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa dag go //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa dag go //
translated: The qualities of the victors are common and uncommon, mundane and supramundane, not mixed with the perfections, etc.

original: de'i phyir rgyal ba thams cad kyi so so'i yon tan thams cad kyang skad cig skad cig la brjod cing ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyal ba thams cad kyi so so'i yon tan thams cad kyang skad cig skad cig la brjod cing ngo //
translated: Therefore, in every moment, he praises all the individual qualities of all the victors.

original: mdzes pa dang phyir mi ldog pa dang yongs su rdzogs par shes pa'i phyir bde bar gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: mdzes pa dang phyir mi ldog pa dang yongs su rdzogs par shes pa'i phyir bde bar gshegs pa ste /
translated: He is a sugata because he has gone to bliss through beauty, irreversibility, and perfection.

original: bde bar gshegs pa de dag la so so re re la bdag gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad rdul phra rab kyi grangs snyed kyi lus rnams kyis phyag 'tshal zhing mngon du phyogs nas bstod do zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa de dag la so so re re la bdag gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad rdul phra rab kyi grangs snyed kyi lus rnams kyis phyag 'tshal zhing mngon du phyogs nas bstod do zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: To those sugatas, each one, I pay homage with bodies as numerous as the atoms in all buddha-fields, bowing down and praising.

original: de ltar rang 'khrungs pa dang / rang 'khrungs ma yin pa'i sangs rgyas la dmigs pa'i khyad par dpag tu med pa grangs med pa yang bstan la ;
analyzed: de ltar rang 'khrungs pa dang / rang 'khrungs ma yin pa'i sangs rgyas la dmigs pa'i khyad par dpag tu med pa grangs med pa yang bstan la ;
translated: Thus, he shows immeasurable, countless distinctions in observing the self-arisen and non-self-arisen buddhas.

original: de bzhin du ngo bo nyid dang / mos pa'i phyag bya ba dang / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan dang / bstod pa brjod pa'i sprin yang brjod nas da ni de dag nyid la mchod pa bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du ngo bo nyid dang / mos pa'i phyag bya ba dang / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan dang / bstod pa brjod pa'i sprin yang brjod nas da ni de dag nyid la mchod pa bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Likewise, having described the homage of intrinsic reality and the homage of devotion, and likewise the clouds of praise expressing the good qualities of the Tathagatas, now, in order to demonstrate the worship of those very [Tathagatas],

original: me tog dam pa phreng ba dam pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: me tog dam pa phreng ba dam pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: [the Bhagavat] declares, “With the best of flowers, the best of garlands,” and so forth.

original: me tog smos pas ni rin po che dang / gos dang / gser dang / dngul la sogs pa las byas ba dri dang / kha dog dang / dbyibs sna tshogs pa rnams dang / lha'i dang / mi'i rnams dang / dus thams cad dang /🔽yul thams cad na grags pa rnams bsdu'o //
analyzed: me tog smos pas ni rin po che dang / gos dang / gser dang / dngul la sogs pa las byas ba dri dang / kha dog dang / dbyibs sna tshogs pa rnams dang / lha'i dang / mi'i rnams dang / dus thams cad dang / yul thams cad na grags pa rnams bsdu'o //
translated: By mentioning “flowers,” all [flowers] made of jewels, cloth, gold, silver, and so forth, of various scents, colors, and shapes, divine and human, and all those renowned in all times and places are included.

original: dam pa zhes smos pas ni thams cad bas mchog dang / che ba rnams bsdu bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dam pa zhes smos pas ni thams cad bas mchog dang / che ba rnams bsdu bar rig par bya'o //
translated: By mentioning “the best,” it should be understood that all the most excellent and great [flowers] are included.

original: phreng ba smos pa ni phreng ba'i tshul du bkod pa dus thams cad pa dang / yul thams cad nas 'byung ba dang / lha'i dang / mi'i rnams bsdu'o //
analyzed: phreng ba smos pa ni phreng ba'i tshul du bkod pa dus thams cad pa dang / yul thams cad nas 'byung ba dang / lha'i dang / mi'i rnams bsdu'o //
translated: The mention of garlands includes all garlands, those that exist at all times, those that exist in all places, and those of gods and humans.

original: dam pa smos pas ni rgya che ba dang / gya nom pa bsdu bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dam pa smos pas ni rgya che ba dang / gya nom pa bsdu bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The mention of “excellent” should be understood to include extensive and sublime.

original: sil snyan smos pas ni dung dang / rnga bo che dang / rnga pa ta ha dang / rdza rnga la sogs pa lha'i dang / mi'i dang / dus thams cad ba dang / rnam pa thams cad dang / yul thams cad nas 'byung ba rnams bsdu'o //
analyzed: sil snyan smos pas ni dung dang / rnga bo che dang / rnga pa ta ha dang / rdza rnga la sogs pa lha'i dang / mi'i dang / dus thams cad ba dang / rnam pa thams cad dang / yul thams cad nas 'byung ba rnams bsdu'o //
translated: The mention of musical instruments includes all musical instruments, those of gods and humans, those that exist at all times, those of all types, and those that exist in all places.

original: dam pa smos pas ni thams cad kyi mchog bsdu bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dam pa smos pas ni thams cad kyi mchog bsdu bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The mention of “excellent” should be understood to include the best of all.

original: gar ni 'di nyid kyi nang du 'dus par rig par bya ste /🔽sil snyan dang lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gar ni 'di nyid kyi nang du 'dus par rig par bya ste / sil snyan dang lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Dancing should be understood to be included in this,🔽because it is performed together with musical instruments.

original: glu ni bstod pa brjod pa'i sgras 'phangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: glu ni bstod pa brjod pa'i sgras 'phangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Singing is included in the expression of praise.

original: byug pa smos pa ni tsan dan dang gur kum la sogs pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams byug pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: byug pa smos pa ni tsan dan dang gur kum la sogs pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams byug pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The mention of ointments should be understood as anointing the buddha-fields with sandalwood, saffron, and so on.

original: dri ni 'og nas 'chad pa'i phyir zhal @206b zhal dang bsku ba'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: dri ni 'og nas 'chad pa'i phyir zhal @206b zhal dang bsku ba'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: Since the fragrance is explained below, it is the nature of the anointment.

original: dam pa smos pas ni thams cad kyi mchog bsdu'o //
analyzed: dam pa smos pas ni thams cad kyi mchog bsdu'o //
translated: The mention of the best includes the best of all.

original: gdugs smos pas ni rin po che'i gdugs la sogs pa lha'i dang mi'i rnams yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gdugs smos pas ni rin po che'i gdugs la sogs pa lha'i dang mi'i rnams yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The mention of parasols should be understood as the divine and human parasols of jewels, and so on.

original: de'i phyir ji skad smos pa'i yo byad kyi khyad par rnams dang / dngos po dang / yul dang / dus dang / gnas skabs dang / bkod pa la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi mchog dang ldan pa gzhan dag gis kyang rgyal ba de dag la mchod par bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji skad smos pa'i yo byad kyi khyad par rnams dang / dngos po dang / yul dang / dus dang / gnas skabs dang / bkod pa la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi mchog dang ldan pa gzhan dag gis kyang rgyal ba de dag la mchod par bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, with the special articles mentioned, and with the best of special things, places, times, occasions, arrangements, and so on, one should make offerings to those Victors.

original: na bza' smos pas ni ras dang du gu la'i ras dang zar ma'i ras dang mon ras la sogs pa dus thams cad pa dang / yul thams cad nas 'byung ba dang / lha'i dang / mi'i shin tu khyad par zhugs pa'i mthar phyin pa'i na bza' rnams bsdu'o //
analyzed: na bza' smos pas ni ras dang du gu la'i ras dang zar ma'i ras dang mon ras la sogs pa dus thams cad pa dang / yul thams cad nas 'byung ba dang / lha'i dang / mi'i shin tu khyad par zhugs pa'i mthar phyin pa'i na bza' rnams bsdu'o //
translated: By mentioning “robes” it includes all robes that are made of cotton, flax, silk, wool, etc. , that are appropriate for all seasons, that are available everywhere, and that are the most excellent divine and human robes.

original: dam pa smos pas ni shin tu sba ba dang shin tu che ba dag gis mchod par bya'o zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: dam pa smos pas ni shin tu sba ba dang shin tu che ba dag gis mchod par bya'o zhes sbyar ro //
translated: By mentioning “excellent” it includes those that are very valuable and very precious.

original: dri smos pas ni tsan dan la sogs pa bcos ma dang / bcos ma ma yin pa lha dang klu dang gnod sbyin la sogs pa la grags pa rnams bsdu'o //
analyzed: dri smos pas ni tsan dan la sogs pa bcos ma dang / bcos ma ma yin pa lha dang klu dang gnod sbyin la sogs pa la grags pa rnams bsdu'o //
translated: By mentioning “perfumes” it includes all natural and manufactured perfumes such as sandalwood, etc. , that are well known to gods, nagas, yakshas, etc.

original: mchog smos pas ni shin tu phul du phyin pa 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa bkod pa thams cad kyi mchog ces bya bar ston to //
analyzed: mchog smos pas ni shin tu phul du phyin pa 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa bkod pa thams cad kyi mchog ces bya bar ston to //
translated: By mentioning “supreme” it shows that the best of all arrays, both mundane and supramundane, are included.

original: phye ma smos pas ni tshon rim par bkod pa kha dog spel ba sbra ba la sogs pa'i bye brag dang ldan par ston to //
analyzed: phye ma smos pas ni tshon rim par bkod pa kha dog spel ba sbra ba la sogs pa'i bye brag dang ldan par ston to //
translated: The mention of powder indicates that they are of various colors, with the distinctions of being arranged in layers, mixed, and so on.

original: ri rab ces smos pas ni grags pa'i tshad kyis rgya che bar ston to //
analyzed: ri rab ces smos pas ni grags pa'i tshad kyis rgya che bar ston to //
translated: The mention of Sumeru indicates that they are vast in size, being well known.

original: mar me smos pas ni rin po che'i sdong po'i mar me la sogs pa rgya chen po 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du rgyas par gsal bar dri sna tshogs kyis rgyas par 'gengs pa rnams bsdu'o //
analyzed: mar me smos pas ni rin po che'i sdong po'i mar me la sogs pa rgya chen po 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du rgyas par gsal bar dri sna tshogs kyis rgyas par 'gengs pa rnams bsdu'o //
translated: The mention of lamps indicates that they are vast, being the lamps of the jewel trees and so on, which fill all world systems with their vast radiance and with their various fragrances.

original: mchog ces smos pas ni gang dag sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'os kyi gzhan la ma yin pa ste thun mong ma yin pa zhes ston to //
analyzed: mchog ces smos pas ni gang dag sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'os kyi gzhan la ma yin pa ste thun mong ma yin pa zhes ston to //
translated: The mention of supreme indicates that they are not common, being suitable for Buddhas and bodhisattvas, not for others.

original: bdug pa smos pas ni bdug pa'i khyad par ga bur dang / aa ga ru dang / tsan dan la sogs pa bcos ma ma yin pa dang / bcos ma ste sbyar ba'i khyad par gyis bskyed pa lha'i dang mi'i las 'das pa gang dag yin pa dag bsdu'o //
analyzed: bdug pa smos pas ni bdug pa'i khyad par ga bur dang / aa ga ru dang / tsan dan la sogs pa bcos ma ma yin pa dang / bcos ma ste sbyar ba'i khyad par gyis bskyed pa lha'i dang mi'i las 'das pa gang dag yin pa dag bsdu'o //
translated: By mentioning incense, it includes those that are not artificial, such as camphor, agarwood, sandalwood, etc., and those that are artificial, i.e., compounded, which are beyond the divine and human realms.

original: dam pa smos pa ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i bsod nams kyi khyad par las skyes pa dag ces ston to //
analyzed: dam pa smos pa ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i bsod nams kyi khyad par las skyes pa dag ces ston to //
translated: By mentioning excellent, it shows those born from the special merit of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: bkod pa'i khang bzangs dang / yang @207a * //
analyzed: bkod pa'i khang bzangs dang / yang @207a * //
translated: The palace,

original: thog dang / lha khang dang / lha khang bum pa can dang / gtsang khang byur bu'i bye brag la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: thog dang / lha khang dang / lha khang bum pa can dang / gtsang khang byur bu'i bye brag la sogs pa ste /
translated: the upper story, the temple, the temple with a vase, the solid temple, etc.

original: tsan dan la sogs pa las byas pa nas so phag la sogs pa'i las byas pa'i bar gyi rnam pa de dag thams cad kyis so //
analyzed: tsan dan la sogs pa las byas pa nas so phag la sogs pa'i las byas pa'i bar gyi rnam pa de dag thams cad kyis so //
translated: All those forms, from those made of sandalwood, etc., to those made of brick, etc.

original: mchog ces smos pa ni rin po che thams cad las byas pa thams cad du khyab pa khyad par can gyi rnam pa thams cad dang ldan par rig par bya'o //🔽lha'i mchod pa'i yo byad kyi khyad par de lta bu de dag dang rab kyi mthar phyin pa gzhan dag gis kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing ngo bo nyid dang mos pa thams cad khyab par byas nas skad cig skad cig la de bzhin gshegs pa 'khor gyi dkyil
analyzed: mchog ces smos pa ni rin po che thams cad las byas pa thams cad du khyab pa khyad par can gyi rnam pa thams cad dang ldan par rig par bya'o // lha'i mchod pa'i yo byad kyi khyad par de lta bu de dag dang rab kyi mthar phyin pa gzhan dag gis kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing ngo bo nyid dang mos pa thams cad khyab par byas nas skad cig skad cig la de bzhin gshegs pa 'khor gyi dkyil
translated: The word “supreme” should be understood to mean that they are made of all jewels, that they pervade everywhere, and that they have all the special features.

original: 'khor dang bcas pa de dag thams cad la mchod par bya'o zhes bstan nas /🔽da ni / mchod pa gang rnams bla med rgya che ba //
analyzed: 'khor dang bcas pa de dag thams cad la mchod par bya'o zhes bstan nas / da ni / mchod pa gang rnams bla med rgya che ba //
translated: With those special articles of divine worship and with others that are most excellent, one should pervade all the buddha-fields with their inherent nature and with one’s imagination, and at every moment worship all those Tathagatas together with their retinues.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bla na med pa'i mchod pa ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bla na med pa'i mchod pa ston to //
translated: Having taught that, now, with the words “The worship that is supreme and vast,” he teaches the unsurpassed worship.

original: 'di'i gong na mchod pa khyad par du 'phags pa gzhan med pas bla na med pa dag ste /
analyzed: 'di'i gong na mchod pa khyad par du 'phags pa gzhan med pas bla na med pa dag ste /
translated: There is no other worship superior to this, so it is unsurpassed.

original: gang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thams cad kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod pa byas pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis kyang phan tshun mchod pa mdzad pa'i phyir mngon par sprul ba rab kyi mthar thug pa brnyes pa'i ye shes kyis bsgrubs pa /
analyzed: gang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thams cad kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod pa byas pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis kyang phan tshun mchod pa mdzad pa'i phyir mngon par sprul ba rab kyi mthar thug pa brnyes pa'i ye shes kyis bsgrubs pa /
translated: The bodhisattvas have attained the wisdom that has accomplished the ultimate perfection of emanation, in that all the bodhisattva great beings have made offerings to all the tathagatas and all the tathagatas have also made offerings to each other.

original: phyogs dang dus thams cad du khyab pa /
analyzed: phyogs dang dus thams cad du khyab pa /
translated: It pervades all directions and times.

original: mchod pa'i yo byad rgya che zhing bzang ba thams cad bsdus pa /
analyzed: mchod pa'i yo byad rgya che zhing bzang ba thams cad bsdus pa /
translated: It includes all the vast and excellent offering articles.🔽It is the ultimate perfection of all the aspects of array.🔽And the offering that is the unsurpassed offering of Dharma, which is the nature of the complete purification of the accumulation of all good qualities, is the offering that is included in great compassion and the mind of enlightenment.

original: bkod pa'i rnam pa thams cad kyi rab kyi mthar phyin pa dang / gang chos kyi mchod pa bla na med pa'i yon tan gyi tshogs thams cad yongs su sbyong ba'i rang bzhin snying rje chen po dang byang chub kyi sems kyis bsdus ba'i mchod pa de lta bu de dag gis rgyal ba de dag la mchod par bya'o zhes bya🔽bar sbyor ro //
analyzed: bkod pa'i rnam pa thams cad kyi rab kyi mthar phyin pa dang / gang chos kyi mchod pa bla na med pa'i yon tan gyi tshogs thams cad yongs su sbyong ba'i rang bzhin snying rje chen po dang byang chub kyi sems kyis bsdus ba'i mchod pa de lta bu de dag gis rgyal ba de dag la mchod par bya'o zhes bya🔽bar sbyor ro //
translated: It is with such offerings that they will make offerings to those conquerors.

original: rtogs pa thob pa ma yin pa yang 'on kyang sems can thams cad kyi gnas skabs de thob par bya ba'i phyir mos pa'i nges pas de bzhin gshegs pa sras dang bcas pa nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa thams cad la dbul bar bya'o zhes bstan🔽pa'i phyir / de dag rgyal ba thams cad la yang mos //
analyzed: rtogs pa thob pa ma yin pa yang 'on kyang sems can thams cad kyi gnas skabs de thob par bya ba'i phyir mos pa'i nges pas de bzhin gshegs pa sras dang bcas pa nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa thams cad la dbul bar bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir / de dag rgyal ba thams cad la yang mos //
translated: Although one has not attained realization, still, in order to attain the state of all sentient beings, one should offer to all the Tathagatas, together with their sons and the Sangha of disciples, with the certainty of imagination.🔽In order to demonstrate that, it says,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: One should imagine that to all the Victors.

original: de bas na bdag gis de ltar ji skad smos pa kun du bzang po spyod pa yongs su sbyang ba bya @207b pa bstan pa'i tshogs mchod pa'i yo byad kyi khyad par 'jig rten thams cad las shin tu 'das pa skye bo thams cad kyi yid 'phrog pas
analyzed: de bas na bdag gis de ltar ji skad smos pa kun du bzang po spyod pa yongs su sbyang ba bya @207b pa bstan pa'i tshogs mchod pa'i yo byad kyi khyad par 'jig rten thams cad las shin tu 'das pa skye bo thams cad kyi yid 'phrog pas
translated: Therefore, one should make offerings to all those Victors, with the special articles of worship of the assembly of teachings, which are beyond all worlds, and which captivate the minds of all beings, by means of the purification of the conduct of Samantabhadra as it has been described.

original: rgyal ba de dag thams cad la phyag 'tshal te mchod par bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rgyal ba de dag thams cad la phyag 'tshal te mchod par bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: One should make obeisance and offer worship to all those Victors.

original: de ltar na sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang / de la phyag 'tshal ba dang ; bstod pa bya ba dang / mchod pa'i mchog rnams kyis bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags nas /
analyzed: de ltar na sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang / de la phyag 'tshal ba dang ; bstod pa bya ba dang / mchod pa'i mchog rnams kyis bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags nas /
translated: Thus, having accumulated the collection of merit by recollecting the Buddha, by paying homage to him, by praising him, and by making the best offerings,

original: de'i 'og tu thog ma med pa can gyi 'khor ba na sdig pa mi dge ba'i las gang cung zad byas pa dang / byed du bcug pa dang / rjes su yi rang ba de ma lus par bkru ba'i don du so sor bshags par bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /🔽sdig pa bdag gis bgyis pa ci mchis pa //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu thog ma med pa can gyi 'khor ba na sdig pa mi dge ba'i las gang cung zad byas pa dang / byed du bcug pa dang / rjes su yi rang ba de ma lus par bkru ba'i don du so sor bshags par bya ba bstan pa'i phyir / sdig pa bdag gis bgyis pa ci mchis pa //
translated: then, in order to teach the confession of whatever sins, non-virtuous actions, have been committed, caused to be done, or rejoiced in, in beginningless cyclic existence, for the sake of completely washing them away,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said, “Whatever sins I have committed,” and so on.

original: 'khor ba na 'khor ba'i tshe bdag byis pas mi dge ba'i las cung zad byas pa dang / byed du bcug pa dang / rjes su yi rang ba de yang rgyu rnam pa gsum gyis 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba na 'khor ba'i tshe bdag byis pas mi dge ba'i las cung zad byas pa dang / byed du bcug pa dang / rjes su yi rang ba de yang rgyu rnam pa gsum gyis 'byung ste /
translated: When one is revolving in cyclic existence, one’s own childish commission of a little non-virtuous action, one’s causing others to do it, and one’s rejoicing in it, arise by means of three causes.

original: 'dod chags kyi dbang gis chags nas srog gcod ba la sogs pa gang cung zad byed pa dang / zhe sdang gi dbang dang / gti mug gi dbang yang de bzhin no //🔽de yang ji ste na lus sam ngag gam yid kyis byas pa de dag thams cad bdag gis sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' mngon sum du bzhugs pa thams cad la mngon du bshags so //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi dbang gis chags nas srog gcod ba la sogs pa gang cung zad byed pa dang / zhe sdang gi dbang dang / gti mug gi dbang yang de bzhin no // de yang ji ste na lus sam ngag gam yid kyis byas pa de dag thams cad bdag gis sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' mngon sum du bzhugs pa thams cad la mngon du bshags so //
translated: Whatever I have done through the power of desire, through attachment, through killing, and so on,🔽whatever I have done through the power of hatred, and likewise through the power of delusion,🔽whether by body, speech, or mind, all that I openly acknowledge in the presence of all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: mi dge ba'i sems kyi rgyu 'di las bsgrubs pa yid du mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bur nus pa bzlog par bya'o //🔽bkru bar bya'o //🔽dri ma med par bya'o //🔽bag chags kyang med par bya ste ;🔽theg pa chen po'i mdo las ji skad gsungs pa'i yon tan gyi dri rnams kyis sems kyi rgyun shin tu dri zhim par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽de ltar bsod nams kyi tshogs kyang bsags /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i sems kyi rgyu 'di las bsgrubs pa yid du mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bur nus pa bzlog par bya'o //🔽bkru bar bya'o //🔽dri ma med par bya'o //🔽bag chags kyang med par bya ste ;🔽theg pa chen po'i mdo las ji skad gsungs pa'i yon tan gyi dri rnams kyis sems kyi rgyun shin tu dri zhim par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽de ltar bsod nams kyi tshogs kyang bsags /

original: mi dge ba bsags pa yang so sor bshags nas /
analyzed: mi dge ba bsags pa yang so sor bshags nas /
translated: Having confessed the accumulation of non-virtue,

original: gzhan gyis byas pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs kyang yongs su gzung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs kyang yongs su gzung ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to take hold of the accumulation of merit done by others,

original: phyogs bcu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽gang phyogs bcu'i sems can 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi rnams kyis sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa bsod nams rnam pa du ma ste /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // gang phyogs bcu'i sems can 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi rnams kyis sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa bsod nams rnam pa du ma ste /
translated: he says, “The merit of all beings in the ten directions,” and so on.

original: bsod nams @208a * //
analyzed: bsod nams @208a * //
translated: The merit of all beings in the ten directions, past, future, and present, is of many kinds, such as giving, morality, and so on.

original: zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ma chags pa dang zhe sdang med pa gti mug med pas bsdus pa'i sems dang / sems las byung ba dang / des kun nas bslang ba'i lus dang ngag gi las yongs su gzung ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ma chags pa dang zhe sdang med pa gti mug med pas bsdus pa'i sems dang / sems las byung ba dang / des kun nas bslang ba'i lus dang ngag gi las yongs su gzung ngo //
translated: The word “merit” includes mind and mental factors, and the karma of body and speech motivated by non-attachment, non-hatred, and non-delusion.

original: de dag nyid thob par byed pa dang / bcad par byed pa'i don gyis bsod nams yin no //
analyzed: de dag nyid thob par byed pa dang / bcad par byed pa'i don gyis bsod nams yin no //
translated: They are merit in the sense of being that which is obtained and that which is cut off.

original: de'i phyir so so'i skye bo dang slob pa dang mi slob pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir so so'i skye bo dang slob pa dang mi slob pa /
translated: Therefore, the merit of all ordinary beings, those in training, and those beyond training,

original: de dag kun gyi bsod nams kun la yang //
analyzed: de dag kun gyi bsod nams kun la yang //
translated: and also the merit of all the Buddhas,

original: zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: This is so.🔽🔽

original: slob pa ni gang 'phags pa'i lam skyes la skyes bu'i don yongs su ma rdzogs pa dag ste de dag gis bslab par bya ba yod pa'i phyir slob pa dag go //
analyzed: slob pa ni gang 'phags pa'i lam skyes la skyes bu'i don yongs su ma rdzogs pa dag ste de dag gis bslab par bya ba yod pa'i phyir slob pa dag go //
translated: Those who are learners are noble ones who have generated the ārya path but have not fully accomplished their human goal, because they have training to do.

original: mi slob pa ni gzhan gyi man ngag gis 'phags pa'i lam bskyed nas khams gsum na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pas skyes bu'i don yongs su grub ba nyid kyis bslab bar bya ba med pas mi slob pa dag go //
analyzed: mi slob pa ni gzhan gyi man ngag gis 'phags pa'i lam bskyed nas khams gsum na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pas skyes bu'i don yongs su grub ba nyid kyis bslab bar bya ba med pas mi slob pa dag go //
translated: Those who are nonlearners are noble ones who have generated the ārya path through the instructions of others, have abandoned afflictions that occur in the three realms and have fully accomplished their human goal.

original: gang dag bskal pa gcig tu ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byas te /
analyzed: gang dag bskal pa gcig tu ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byas te /
translated: Those who complete the collection of wisdom in one eon,

original: gzhan gyis man ngag med par 'phags pa'i lam thob nas khams gsum dang bral bar zhugs ba de dag ni snying rje chen po med pas gzhan la lung 'bogs pa'i bya ba med par bdag gcig pu sangs rgyas par byed pa rang sangs rgyas rnams so ;
analyzed: gzhan gyis man ngag med par 'phags pa'i lam thob nas khams gsum dang bral bar zhugs ba de dag ni snying rje chen po med pas gzhan la lung 'bogs pa'i bya ba med par bdag gcig pu sangs rgyas par byed pa rang sangs rgyas rnams so ;
translated: who obtain the ārya path without the instructions of others, who enter the state of being free from the three realms, are pratyekabuddhas, who are self buddhas who do not have great compassion and who do not have the activity of teaching others.

original: / sangs rgyas sras zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' mos pas spyod pa'i sa nas bzung ste chos kyi sprin gyi sa'i bar la gnas pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: / sangs rgyas sras zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' mos pas spyod pa'i sa nas bzung ste chos kyi sprin gyi sa'i bar la gnas pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The sons of the Buddha are the bodhisattvas who abide on the stages, beginning with the stage of The Joyful One up to the stage of The Cloud of Dharma.

original: de dag ni sangs rgyas kyi gdung mi 'chad par bya ba'i phyir sras zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni sangs rgyas kyi gdung mi 'chad par bya ba'i phyir sras zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called sons because they perpetuate the lineage of the Buddhas.

original: rgyal ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bdud thams cad las rnam par rgyal ba rnams yin te /
analyzed: rgyal ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bdud thams cad las rnam par rgyal ba rnams yin te /
translated: The victorious ones are the Blessed Buddhas who have won all victories over the demons.🔽 I rejoice in all the merit of those who abide at all times, and in the infinite, inconceivable, incomparable merit of those explained above, which is like space, limitless, and the domain of all Buddhas.

original: dus thams cad du bzhugs pa de dag gi bsod nams gang yin pa dang / gong du bshad pa rnams kyi bsod nams mtha' yas pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa mtshungs pa med pa nam mkha' lta bur mu med pa sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yul du gyur pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad la bdag rjes su yi rang ngo //
analyzed: dus thams cad du bzhugs pa de dag gi bsod nams gang yin pa dang / gong du bshad pa rnams kyi bsod nams mtha' yas pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa mtshungs pa med pa nam mkha' lta bur mu med pa sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yul du gyur pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad la bdag rjes su yi rang ngo //
translated: The merit of rejoicing is the merit that arises from rejoicing in the merit of others.

original: bsod nams mdzad pa de dag gis rang gi bsod nams kyi tshogs mngon sum du mdzad nas bzhugs pa la yang shin tu yi rang ngo //
analyzed: bsod nams mdzad pa de dag gis rang gi bsod nams kyi tshogs mngon sum du mdzad nas bzhugs pa la yang shin tu yi rang ngo //
translated: And he rejoices greatly in the accumulation of merit that those who perform meritorious actions have actually achieved.

original: bdag kyang de'i rjes su phyin nas mos pa'i shes bas dge @208b ba'i rtsa ba de dag thams cad rang gi rgyud la brlan nas rjes su yi rang ba'am /
analyzed: bdag kyang de'i rjes su phyin nas mos pa'i shes bas dge @208b ba'i rtsa ba de dag thams cad rang gi rgyud la brlan nas rjes su yi rang ba'am /
translated: And we should follow his example, and with the understanding that comes from interest, we should moisten our own mind-streams with all those roots of virtue and rejoice in them.

original: de dag dang stod ba nyid du ro gcig pas gcig par mos nas rjes su yi rang bar bya /
analyzed: de dag dang stod ba nyid du ro gcig pas gcig par mos nas rjes su yi rang bar bya /
translated: Or else we should imagine that we are the same as they are, and that we are rejoicing in them, and so we should rejoice.

original: dga' ba bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: dga' ba bskyed par bya ste /
translated: We should feel joy.

original: thabs 'dis gzhan gyis byas pa'i dge ba'i tshogs mtha' yas pa de dag thams cad kyang sems kyis yongs su gzung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thabs 'dis gzhan gyis byas pa'i dge ba'i tshogs mtha' yas pa de dag thams cad kyang sems kyis yongs su gzung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of this method is that we should mentally take possession of all those infinite accumulations of virtue that others have created.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa la phyag bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa la phyag bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: Thus, by worshipping the Tathagatas and so on,

original: rang gi bsod nams kyi tshogs kyang rjes su yi rang bas yongs su gzung sdig pa bshags pas sems kyi rgyud kyang yongs su sbyang /
analyzed: rang gi bsod nams kyi tshogs kyang rjes su yi rang bas yongs su gzung sdig pa bshags pas sems kyi rgyud kyang yongs su sbyang /
translated: we should take possession of our own accumulation of merit by rejoicing in it, and we should purify our mind-streams by confessing our sins.

original: gzhan gyis byas pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs kyang rjes su yi rang bas yongs su gzung ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs kyang rjes su yi rang bas yongs su gzung ste /
translated: He also takes hold of the collection of merit made by others through rejoicing.

original: dge ba'i phung po dpag tu med pa kun du bsags pas sems can la phan pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su sbyang bar bzhed pas /
analyzed: dge ba'i phung po dpag tu med pa kun du bsags pas sems can la phan pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su sbyang bar bzhed pas /
translated: He is intent on purifying the superior intention to benefit sentient beings by accumulating the immeasurable heap of virtue.🔽Therefore, he says this:

original: gang rnams phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten sgron ma dag / ces bya ba 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: gang rnams phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten sgron ma dag / ces bya ba 'di gsungs so //
translated: “Those who are lamps for the worlds in the ten directions”

original: gang dag phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten na sangs rgyas kyi zhing shin tu yangs shing rgya che ba mar me'i snod lta bu dag la thugs rje chen po snum lta bu yongs su bkang ba /
analyzed: gang dag phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten na sangs rgyas kyi zhing shin tu yangs shing rgya che ba mar me'i snod lta bu dag la thugs rje chen po snum lta bu yongs su bkang ba /
translated: In the worlds of the ten directions, the lamps for the worlds are the buddhas who are like vessels of oil, filled with the great compassion that is like oil.

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus brgyan pa'i sku snying po lta bur gyur pa /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus brgyan pa'i sku snying po lta bur gyur pa /
translated: Their bodies are adorned with the thirty-two marks and the eighty signs of a great being, like a heart.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ye shes chen po'i me'i phung po rab tu 'bar ba /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ye shes chen po'i me'i phung po rab tu 'bar ba /
translated: The fire of the great wisdom of the perfection of wisdom blazes.

original: phyogs bcu mtha' yas par 'od zer gyi tshogs dge ba'i dkyil 'khor dpag tu med pa 'phros pas gti mug gi mun pa mun nag chen po ma lus par bcom pa dag ni 'jig rten na sgron ma lta bu yin par 'jig rten sgron ma ste de bzhin🔽gshegs pa rnams so //
analyzed: phyogs bcu mtha' yas par 'od zer gyi tshogs dge ba'i dkyil 'khor dpag tu med pa 'phros pas gti mug gi mun pa mun nag chen po ma lus par bcom pa dag ni 'jig rten na sgron ma lta bu yin par 'jig rten sgron ma ste de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so //
translated: The light of the world, the Tathagatas,🔽having attained supreme enlightenment,

original: byang chub mchog rim bar sangs rgyas nas mchog tu gyur pa'i sangs rgyas brnyes te /
analyzed: byang chub mchog rim bar sangs rgyas nas mchog tu gyur pa'i sangs rgyas brnyes te /
translated: having attained supreme buddhahood,

original: chags pa mi mnga' ba brnyes pa /
analyzed: chags pa mi mnga' ba brnyes pa /
translated: having attained the absence of attachment,🔽having realized the Dharma that is difficult for the whole world to understand,

original: 'jig rten thams cad kyis rtogs par dka' pa'i chos thugs su chud pas cang mi gsung bar bzhugs nas chos kyi 'khor lo mi bskor bar rang sangs rgyas ltar sems can gyi don la mi gzigs pa ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad kyis rtogs par dka' pa'i chos thugs su chud pas cang mi gsung bar bzhugs nas chos kyi 'khor lo mi bskor bar rang sangs rgyas ltar sems can gyi don la mi gzigs pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: they remain silent and do not turn the wheel of Dharma, just like the Pratyekabuddhas, not seeing the benefit of sentient beings.

original: 'on kyang chos zab par bstan pa dang / dam pa'i chos la gus ba bskyed pa'i phyir bskul pa la bzhes te /
analyzed: 'on kyang chos zab par bstan pa dang / dam pa'i chos la gus ba bskyed pa'i phyir bskul pa la bzhes te /
translated: However, in order to teach the profound Dharma and to generate respect for the holy Dharma, they accept the request.

original: der smon sems dang ldan pa rnams la dge ba'i tshogs @209a * //
analyzed: der smon sems dang ldan pa rnams la dge ba'i tshogs @209a * //
translated: For those who have the aspiration to enlightenment, the merit of this is🔽immeasurable.

original: bsags pa'i phyir bdag nyid 'khor lo mi bskor ro //
analyzed: bsags pa'i phyir bdag nyid 'khor lo mi bskor ro //
translated: There, for those who have the aspiration mind, in order to accumulate the equipment of virtue, I do not turn the wheel.

original: de bas na chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar bya ba'i phyir bdag gis phyag bya ba la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba'i bskul bas de dag la bskul bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar bya ba'i phyir bdag gis phyag bya ba la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba'i bskul bas de dag la bskul bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, in order to turn the wheel of the Dharma, I should exhort them with the preliminary exhortations of homage and so on.

original: bla na med pa ni 'jig rten thams cad 'dra ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa ni 'jig rten thams cad 'dra ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Unsurpassed means that all worlds are without equal.

original: de ltar ma byon pa'i sangs rgyas la bskul bas sems can la phan pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su sbyangs nas /
analyzed: de ltar ma byon pa'i sangs rgyas la bskul bas sems can la phan pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su sbyangs nas /
translated: Thus, having purified the superior intention to benefit sentient beings by exhorting the Buddhas who have not yet come,

original: yang gsol ba gdab pas kyang yongs su sbyang ba'i phyir /🔽mya ngan 'da' ston gang bzhed de dag la //
analyzed: yang gsol ba gdab pas kyang yongs su sbyang ba'i phyir / mya ngan 'da' ston gang bzhed de dag la //
translated: again, in order to purify by way of supplicating,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, “Those who wish to demonstrate nirvana,” and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gang dag sangs rgyas kyis 'dul ba'i sems can rnams kyi don ci rigs par mdzad nas sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa yongs su rdzogs pa 'dra bar mya ngan las 'das pa ston par bzhed pa phung po'i lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gang dag sangs rgyas kyis 'dul ba'i sems can rnams kyi don ci rigs par mdzad nas sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa yongs su rdzogs pa 'dra bar mya ngan las 'das pa ston par bzhed pa phung po'i lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las
translated: The tathāgatas, having done what is to be done for the sake of sentient beings who are to be trained by the Buddha, and having completed the deeds of a buddha, wish to demonstrate nirvāṇa.🔽Those who wish to abandon the aggregates in the realm of nirvāṇa without remainder,

original: 'das pa'i dbyings kyis phung po rnams yongs su 'dor bar bzhed pa de dag la skye bo lhag ma rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du mi 'jug tu gsol /
analyzed: 'das pa'i dbyings kyis phung po rnams yongs su 'dor bar bzhed pa de dag la skye bo lhag ma rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du mi 'jug tu gsol /
translated: I supplicate them not to enter the city of nirvāṇa for the sake of bringing the remaining beings to full maturity.

original: sems can mgon ma mchis par mi mdzad du gsol /
analyzed: sems can mgon ma mchis par mi mdzad du gsol /
translated: I supplicate them not to leave sentient beings without a protector.🔽I supplicate them to accomplish the benefit of the remaining beings in accordance with their previous aspirations.

original: 'gro ba lhag ma dag la sngon gyi smon lam ji lta ba bzhin du don mdzad par gsol zhes bdag rab tu bsgrims nas phyag 'tshal te thal mo sbyar ba la sogs pas gsol ba gdab bo //
analyzed: 'gro ba lhag ma dag la sngon gyi smon lam ji lta ba bzhin du don mdzad par gsol zhes bdag rab tu bsgrims nas phyag 'tshal te thal mo sbyar ba la sogs pas gsol ba gdab bo //
translated: Having made this supplication with great effort, prostrating with body, speech, and mind, and with palms joined, and so forth, one should make requests.

original: bskul ba ni bdag nyid byed par 'dod pa la bskul ba tsam du zad do //
analyzed: bskul ba ni bdag nyid byed par 'dod pa la bskul ba tsam du zad do //
translated: The request is merely a request to one who wishes to act.

original: des na gsol ba dang bskul ba dag ni bsgrims pa dang mi bsgrims pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir gsol ba dang bye brag yod do //
analyzed: des na gsol ba dang bskul ba dag ni bsgrims pa dang mi bsgrims pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir gsol ba dang bye brag yod do //
translated: Therefore, the request and the request are distinguished because they have the nature of being concentrated and not concentrated.

original: dus ji srid cig tu bzhugs par gsol ba gdab snyam pa la /
analyzed: dus ji srid cig tu bzhugs par gsol ba gdab snyam pa la /
translated: For how long should one request to remain?

original: zhing gi rdul snyed bskal par bzhugs pa yang //
analyzed: zhing gi rdul snyed bskal par bzhugs pa yang //
translated: For as many eons as there are atoms in the Buddha-fields,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and so on is stated.

original: sems can gyi don mtha' yas pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi rdul phra rab kyi rdul gyi grangs snyed kyi bskal par bzhugs su gsol lo //
analyzed: sems can gyi don mtha' yas pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi rdul phra rab kyi rdul gyi grangs snyed kyi bskal par bzhugs su gsol lo //
translated: For the sake of infinite sentient beings, one requests to remain for as many eons as there are atoms in all Buddha-fields.

original: des na 'di skad du sems can gyi khams ji tsam pa de tsam gyi don mdzad pa yongs su ma grub pa yin te //
analyzed: des na 'di skad du sems can gyi khams ji tsam pa de tsam gyi don mdzad pa yongs su ma grub pa yin te //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the realm of sentient beings is not fully accomplished in benefiting that much.

original: de bas na de don du gnyer ba rnams yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba nyid do zhes ston to //
analyzed: de bas na de don du gnyer ba rnams yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba nyid do zhes ston to //
translated: Therefore, those who strive for that very purpose do not attain complete nirvana.

original: ci'i phyir bzhugs par gsol snyam pa la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bzhugs par gsol snyam pa la /
translated: Why do you request them to remain?

original: 'gro ba kun la @209b phan zhing bde ba'i phyir //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: 'gro ba kun la @209b phan zhing bde ba'i phyir // zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: For the sake of benefit and happiness for all beings.

original: 'gro ba kun la zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi khams ma lus pa'o //🔽phan pa ni mi dge ba'i chos thams cad las zlog pa dang / dge ba'i chos thams cad la 'jug pa'am /
analyzed: 'gro ba kun la zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi khams ma lus pa'o // phan pa ni mi dge ba'i chos thams cad las zlog pa dang / dge ba'i chos thams cad la 'jug pa'am /
translated: All beings refers to the entire realm of sentient beings.

original: tshe 'di dang tshe 'di ma yin pa dang / gtan du bde ba thob pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di dang tshe 'di ma yin pa dang / gtan du bde ba thob pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Benefit is the cause for attaining happiness in this life, in future lives, and ultimately.

original: bde ba ni lha dang mi'o //
analyzed: bde ba ni lha dang mi'o //
translated: Happiness is the state of gods and humans.

original: yang na bde ba'i mchog ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: yang na bde ba'i mchog ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: Or, the highest happiness is nirvana.

original: de'i don du bzhugs su gsol lo //
analyzed: de'i don du bzhugs su gsol lo //
translated: For that purpose, request them to remain.

original: da ni bsod nams kyi phung po lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su sbyang ba byas pa'i khyad par las skyes pa bar 'tshams med par ji ltar bzung ba sdom pa de thams cad khyad par du 'phags pa'i 'bras bur yongs su bsngo ba thabs kyis bsdus nas /
analyzed: da ni bsod nams kyi phung po lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su sbyang ba byas pa'i khyad par las skyes pa bar 'tshams med par ji ltar bzung ba sdom pa de thams cad khyad par du 'phags pa'i 'bras bur yongs su bsngo ba thabs kyis bsdus nas /
translated: Now, all the vows that have been taken without a break from the special birth that comes from the purification of the superior intention of the mass of merit, he dedicates to the special result, gathering them with skillful means.

original: yang rgya chen por bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang rgya chen por bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Again, in order to expand,

original: phyag 'tshal ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, “Homage” and so on.

original: de la ngo bo nyid dang mos pa'i lus kyis sangs rgyas mtha' yas pa la phyag 'tshal bar dmigs pa'i sems pa'i khyad par gang yin pa de dag ni phyag 'tshal ba'i sgrar bstan to //
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid dang mos pa'i lus kyis sangs rgyas mtha' yas pa la phyag 'tshal bar dmigs pa'i sems pa'i khyad par gang yin pa de dag ni phyag 'tshal ba'i sgrar bstan to //
translated: Therein, the homage is taught by the word “homage” to the infinite buddhas, which is a special intention that takes as its object the infinite buddhas with the body of reality and the body of devoted interest.

original: mchod pa ni mchod pa'i yo byad mtha' yas pa sangs rgyas mtha' yas pa la phul bas bsdus pa'i sems pa'i bye brag rnams so //🔽bshags pa ni byas pa dang / byed du bcug pa dang / rjes su yi rang ba ;
analyzed: mchod pa ni mchod pa'i yo byad mtha' yas pa sangs rgyas mtha' yas pa la phul bas bsdus pa'i sems pa'i bye brag rnams so // bshags pa ni byas pa dang / byed du bcug pa dang / rjes su yi rang ba ;
translated: The offering is the various special intentions that consist in the offering of infinite offering articles to infinite buddhas.🔽The confession is the stream of special intentions that consist in confessing, in the presence of all the buddhas and bodhisattvas, the roots of nonvirtue that have been committed, caused to be done, or affirmed,

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug las byung ba lus dang / ngag dang / yid las byung ba'i mi dge ba'i rtsa ba sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi spyan sngar bshags pa'i rang bzhin gyi sems pa'i rgyun rnams so //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug las byung ba lus dang / ngag dang / yid las byung ba'i mi dge ba'i rtsa ba sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi spyan sngar bshags pa'i rang bzhin gyi sems pa'i rgyun rnams so //
translated: which have arisen from attachment, aversion, and ignorance, and which have issued from body, speech, and mind.

original: rjes su yi rang ba ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang so so'i skye bo thams cad kyis byas pa dang / byed du bcug pa dang / rjes su yi rang ba'i bsod nams kyi tshogs mtha' yas ba la rjes su yi rang bar bzhugs pa'i sems pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang so so'i skye bo thams cad kyis byas pa dang / byed du bcug pa dang / rjes su yi rang ba'i bsod nams kyi tshogs mtha' yas ba la rjes su yi rang bar bzhugs pa'i sems pa'i phung po'o //
translated: Rejoicing is the aggregate of volition that abides in rejoicing in the infinite collection of merit of all the buddhas, bodhisattvas, sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, and ordinary beings, in what they have done, what they are causing to be done, and what they have rejoiced in.🔽The request is the special volition of one who is intent on the service of the buddhas who have attained supreme enlightenment for the sake of the benefit of sentient beings, in order to generate respect for the Dharma.

original: bskal ba ni sems can gyi don mdzad par bya ba'i phyir mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas de chos la gus pa bskyed pa'i phyir bskul ba la zhes pa rnams la so sor bsti stang bya ba sngon du 'gro ba don du gnyer bas bsdus🔽pa'i sems pa'i khyad par rnams so //🔽gsol ba ni rang gi mdzad pa @210a * //
analyzed: bskal ba ni sems can gyi don mdzad par bya ba'i phyir mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas de chos la gus pa bskyed pa'i phyir bskul ba la zhes pa rnams la so sor bsti stang bya ba sngon du 'gro ba don du gnyer bas bsdus🔽pa'i sems pa'i khyad par rnams so //🔽gsol ba ni rang gi mdzad pa @210a * //
translated: The supplication is the special volition of one who is intent on the service of the buddhas who have attained supreme enlightenment for the sake of the benefit of sentient beings, in order to generate respect for the Dharma.

original: rnams yongs su rdzogs par mdzad nas phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du gshegs bar bzhed pa rnams la gsol ba 'debs pa ste /
analyzed: rnams yongs su rdzogs par mdzad nas phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du gshegs bar bzhed pa rnams la gsol ba 'debs pa ste /
translated: and those who wish to enter the city of nirvana without remainder.

original: phyag 'tshal ba sngon du 'gro ba'i 'gog pas bsdus pa'i sems pa mchog 'byung ba rnams so //🔽de ltar ji skad smos pa'i tshul du rang gi rgyud yongs su sbyang ba byas pa'i khyad par gyis dge ba'i tshogs mtha' yas pa bsags pa gang yin pa de dag sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dbang du gyur pa rnams spyan sngar bzhag nas dad pa
analyzed: phyag 'tshal ba sngon du 'gro ba'i 'gog pas bsdus pa'i sems pa mchog 'byung ba rnams so // de ltar ji skad smos pa'i tshul du rang gi rgyud yongs su sbyang ba byas pa'i khyad par gyis dge ba'i tshogs mtha' yas pa bsags pa gang yin pa de dag sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dbang du gyur pa rnams spyan sngar bzhag nas dad pa
translated: They are the superior intentions included in the cessation that is preceded by prostration.🔽In this way, having purified one's mindstream in the manner just described, one should place in the presence of the buddhas and bodhisattvas who have gained mastery over the mind the infinite accumulations of virtue that one has gathered through the special practice of the perfections and, with a mind that is terrified by the most sublime jewel of faith,

original: phul du byung ba'i nor bu rin po ches dngangs par byas pa'i sems kyis byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya /
analyzed: phul du byung ba'i nor bu rin po ches dngangs par byas pa'i sems kyis byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya /
translated: dedicate them to enlightenment.

original: 'bras bu'i khyad par bla na med pa la nges par bya ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i khyad par bla na med pa la nges par bya ste /
translated: One should be certain of the unsurpassed distinction of the result.

original: don de nye bar bsgrub bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don de nye bar bsgrub bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the phrase “I will accomplish that goal.”

original: de ltar na bsod nams kyi tshogs yongs su gzung ba'i phyir thabs kyi khyad par pha rol mi dpogs pa byang chub sems dpa' chen po kun du bzang po'i spyod pas 'thob par byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'di ni dad pas bskyed pa'i sems kyis thos pa'i tshe
analyzed: de ltar na bsod nams kyi tshogs yongs su gzung ba'i phyir thabs kyi khyad par pha rol mi dpogs pa byang chub sems dpa' chen po kun du bzang po'i spyod pas 'thob par byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'di ni dad pas bskyed pa'i sems kyis thos pa'i tshe
translated: Thus, in order to take up the accumulation of merit, the bodhisattva should practice the method of the great hero Samantabhadra, which is the characteristic of the generation of the thought of awakening through faith.

original: yang sems kyi rgyun rnam par dag par byed na rtag tu byed pas nyin gcig bzhin du dus gsum du bsgrub pas lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: yang sems kyi rgyun rnam par dag par byed na rtag tu byed pas nyin gcig bzhin du dus gsum du bsgrub pas lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: If he purifies the stream of his mind, what need is there to mention that he will accomplish it three times a day by constant practice?

original: de bas na 'di ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i don rnams thams cad la yang so sor sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'di ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i don rnams thams cad la yang so sor sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this should be applied to all the topics that will be presented below.

original: de ltar bsod nams kyi tshogs yongs su sdud pa'i thabs sgrub pas /
analyzed: de ltar bsod nams kyi tshogs yongs su sdud pa'i thabs sgrub pas /
translated: Thus, by the practice of the method of gathering the accumulation of merit,

original: rgyal ba kun gyi rjes su slob gyur te //
analyzed: rgyal ba kun gyi rjes su slob gyur te //
translated: he becomes a follower of all the victors.

original: thabs kyis yongs su zin pa'i 'phags pa kun du bzang po'i spyod pa rab tu ston par byed /
analyzed: thabs kyis yongs su zin pa'i 'phags pa kun du bzang po'i spyod pa rab tu ston par byed /
translated: He shows, he teaches the conduct of the noble Samantabhadra, which is fully embraced by means.

original: rab tu 'chad par byed ces bya ba 'dis ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa'i don bsdus par bstan to //
analyzed: rab tu 'chad par byed ces bya ba 'dis ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa'i don bsdus par bstan to //
translated: This shows the summary meaning of the level of practice through belief.

original: ye shes spyod pa rnam par dag byed cing //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ye shes spyod pa rnam par dag byed cing // zhes bya ba la /
translated: He purifies the conduct of wisdom,

original: ye shes ni zag pa med pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i theg pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes ni zag pa med pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i theg pa'o //
translated: Wisdom is the uncontaminated, nonconceptual vehicle.

original: de'i spyod pa ni sa bsgom pa'i go rims so //
analyzed: de'i spyod pa ni sa bsgom pa'i go rims so //
translated: Its conduct is the sequence of meditation on the levels.

original: de rnam par dag pa ni bsgom pa rab kyi mthar phyin par gyur pa'i ye shes kyis te /
analyzed: de rnam par dag pa ni bsgom pa rab kyi mthar phyin par gyur pa'i ye shes kyis te /
translated: Its purification is by means of the wisdom that has perfected the meditation.

original: 'dis ni sa bcu bsdus so //
analyzed: 'dis ni sa bcu bsdus so //
translated: This includes the ten levels.

original: byang chub spyod pa yongs su rdzogs byed cing //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byang chub spyod pa yongs su rdzogs byed cing // zhes bya ba la /
translated: He perfects the conduct of enlightenment,

original: byang chub ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes phul du byung ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes phul du byung ba'o //
translated: Enlightenment is the supreme wisdom of omniscience.

original: de'i spyod pa ni sangs rgyas kyis kun du 'od kyis bsdus pa bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: de'i spyod pa ni sangs rgyas kyis kun du 'od kyis bsdus pa bsgom pa'o //
translated: Its conduct is the meditation that is included in the universal illumination of the buddhas.

original: de yongs su rdzogs pa ni byang chub kyi snying por zhugs nas nyon mongs pa @210b dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa'i phyir mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du mdzad pa yin te /
analyzed: de yongs su rdzogs pa ni byang chub kyi snying por zhugs nas nyon mongs pa @210b dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa'i phyir mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du mdzad pa yin te /
translated: Its complete fulfillment is the direct realization of non-abiding nirvana, through the abandonment of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience, along with their propensities, upon entering into the site of enlightenment.

original: 'dis ni phan yon gyi lam bsdus so //
analyzed: 'dis ni phan yon gyi lam bsdus so //
translated: This concludes the path of benefit.

original: de ltar na tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni smon lam chen po 'di'i don thams cad bsdus par bstan pa yin no //🔽'di man chad /
analyzed: de ltar na tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni smon lam chen po 'di'i don thams cad bsdus par bstan pa yin no // 'di man chad /
translated: Thus, this verse shows that all the meanings of this great vow are included.

original: 'das pa'i sangs rgyas rnams dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa'i don gyi rim pa brjod de /
analyzed: 'das pa'i sangs rgyas rnams dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa'i don gyi rim pa brjod de /
translated: From here on, the meaning of the stages of the ground of practice through belief is stated by the words, “The buddhas of the past,” and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'das pa rnams ni mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la ltos nas yin gyis /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'das pa rnams ni mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la ltos nas yin gyis /
translated: The buddhas of the past are in terms of their manifest complete enlightenment,

original: phung po lhag ma mi lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings la ltos nas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: phung po lhag ma mi lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings la ltos nas ni ma yin te /
translated: but not in terms of the realm of nirvana in which no aggregates remain.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings la bzhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings la bzhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the Tathagatas abide in the realm of nirvana which is not a state of repose.

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten dag na gang bzhugs pa //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten dag na gang bzhugs pa //
translated: Those who dwell in the worlds of the ten directions

original: zhes bya ba ni sprul pa'i sku rnams kyis phyogs bcu dag na da ltar sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sprul pa'i sku rnams kyis phyogs bcu dag na da ltar sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: means those who are now bringing about the spiritual maturity of beings in the ten directions by means of their Transformation Bodies.

original: mchod par gyur zhes bya ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i mchod pa dang sgrub pa'i mchod pa bla na med pas de bzhin gshegs pa 'das pa la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag la mchod par gyur cig ces bya ba yin te /
analyzed: mchod par gyur zhes bya ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i mchod pa dang sgrub pa'i mchod pa bla na med pas de bzhin gshegs pa 'das pa la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag la mchod par gyur cig ces bya ba yin te /
translated: May they be worshipped means may they be worshipped by the worship and the worship through spiritual practice as described, by the highest worship, those who are the Tathagatas of the past, etc.

original: sgrub pa'i mchod pas ni byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ston to //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i mchod pas ni byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ston to //
translated: The worship through spiritual practice shows the generation of the Thought of enlightenment.

original: gang yang ma byon pa de dag rab tu myur ba kho nas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par ji ltar bzhed pa bzhin dgongs pa yongs su rdzogs par gyur cig ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang yang ma byon pa de dag rab tu myur ba kho nas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par ji ltar bzhed pa bzhin dgongs pa yongs su rdzogs par gyur cig ces bya ba ste /
translated: May those who have not yet come to perfect buddhahood do so in the very shortest time, and may they fulfill their intentions just as they wish.

original: 'dis ni sems can gyi don mdzad par bzhugs pa de dag skad cig kyang shol bar ma gyur cig ces de skad bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni sems can gyi don mdzad par bzhugs pa de dag skad cig kyang shol bar ma gyur cig ces de skad bstan to //
translated: This shows that may they remain to accomplish the welfare of living beings without delay for even a moment.

original: thugs la dgongs pa ni bsam pa ste /
analyzed: thugs la dgongs pa ni bsam pa ste /
translated: Intention is the thought.

original: yun ring po nas bzhed pa'i don 'bras bu'i khyad par rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya ba gang yin pa'o //
