analyzed: yun ring po nas bzhed pa'i don 'bras bu'i khyad par rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The special result of the thought that has been intended for a long time is the concentration like a vajra.

original: de yongs su rdzogs pa ni bsam pa rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: de yongs su rdzogs pa ni bsam pa rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The fulfillment of that is the fulfillment of the thought.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /🔽byang chub rim par sangs rgyas zhes bstan te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir / byang chub rim par sangs rgyas zhes bstan te /
translated: For that very reason,🔽it is taught that they attain enlightenment in stages.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub brnyes pa de yongs su rdzogs par gyur cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub brnyes pa de yongs su rdzogs par gyur cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: May they fulfill the attainment of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: de dag bdag nyid 'bras bu bsgrub pa la zhugs mod kyi /🔽'on kyang de dag gi don chen po 'grub pa dang / bgegs @211a * //
analyzed: de dag bdag nyid 'bras bu bsgrub pa la zhugs mod kyi / 'on kyang de dag gi don chen po 'grub pa dang / bgegs @211a * //
translated: Even though they are engaged in the practice of the result,

original: med bar smon pa rnams kyi bsam pa shin tu dag par 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
analyzed: med bar smon pa rnams kyi bsam pa shin tu dag par 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
translated: nevertheless, the great purpose of those who aspire to the absence of obstacles will be accomplished, and their thought will be completely purified.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi dgongs pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i bsam pa bstan to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi dgongs pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i bsam pa bstan to //
translated: This verse shows the thought of fulfilling the intention of all Buddhas.🔽Now, in order to show the thought of purifying all Buddha-fields, he says,

original: da ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad yongs su sbyang ba'i bsam pa bstan pa'i phyir phyogs bcu ga la'i zhing rnams ji snyed pa //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: da ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad yongs su sbyang ba'i bsam pa bstan pa'i phyir phyogs bcu ga la'i zhing rnams ji snyed pa // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In whatever fields in the ten directions, etc.

original: phyogs bcu na sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi khyad par ji snyed yod pa de dag rdo la sogs pa'i nyes pa med pa bde ba phul du phyin pa bde ba can dang 'dra bar yongs su dag par gyur cig ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: phyogs bcu na sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi khyad par ji snyed yod pa de dag rdo la sogs pa'i nyes pa med pa bde ba phul du phyin pa bde ba can dang 'dra bar yongs su dag par gyur cig ces bya ba yin no //
translated: Whatever special Buddha-fields there are in the ten directions, may they become purified, free from the faults of rocks, etc., and endowed with the highest bliss, like the Blissful Land.

original: yongs su dag pa 'ba' zhig ma yin gyis /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa 'ba' zhig ma yin gyis /
translated: It is not just completely pure.

original: de na yod ba'i dngos po thams cad rab kyi mthar phyin par gyur pa'i sgo nas rgya che bar yang gyur cig ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de na yod ba'i dngos po thams cad rab kyi mthar phyin par gyur pa'i sgo nas rgya che bar yang gyur cig ces bya ba yin no //
translated: May all the things that exist there be vast by way of reaching the furthest limit.

original: de ltar gnas yongs su dag pas yongs su dag par brjod nas /
analyzed: de ltar gnas yongs su dag pas yongs su dag par brjod nas /
translated: Having thus described complete purity by way of the complete purity of the realm,

original: gnas pa yongs su dag pa de yongs su dag pa bstan pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: gnas pa yongs su dag pa de yongs su dag pa bstan pa'i phyir ;
translated: in order to demonstrate the complete purity of that complete purity,

original: byang chub shing dbang drung gshegs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: byang chub shing dbang drung gshegs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, “approaching the lord of the tree of enlightenment,” and so on.

original: byang chub ni ye shes bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub ni ye shes bla na med pa'o //
translated: Enlightenment is unsurpassed intuition.

original: de shing gi rgyal po gang gi drung du bzhugs nas brnyes pa de ni sems can gyi mchog gis yongs su bzung ba'i khyad par gyi phyir byang chub kyi shing gi dbang po ste /
analyzed: de shing gi rgyal po gang gi drung du bzhugs nas brnyes pa de ni sems can gyi mchog gis yongs su bzung ba'i khyad par gyi phyir byang chub kyi shing gi dbang po ste /
translated: The lord of the tree is that king of trees in the presence of which he attained enlightenment. It is the lord of trees of enlightenment because it is the special support of the best of beings.

original: shing thams cad kyi nang na shin tu khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir dbang po'o //
analyzed: shing thams cad kyi nang na shin tu khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir dbang po'o //
translated: It is the lord because it is the most excellent of all trees.

original: bdud bzhi pham par mdzad pa'i phyir gang dag der bzhugs pa byang chub shing dbang drung gshegs so //
analyzed: bdud bzhi pham par mdzad pa'i phyir gang dag der bzhugs pa byang chub shing dbang drung gshegs so //
translated: In order to conquer the four demons, he went to the foot of the tree of enlightenment.

original: de dag gang yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: de dag gang yin snyam pa la /
translated: Who are they?

original: rgyal ba dang zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyal ba dang zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: He says, “the victors,”

original: bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyes pa thams cad las rgyal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyes pa thams cad las rgyal ba'i phyir te /
translated: because they are victorious over all faults, together with their instincts.

original: de dag gis yongs su gang bar gyur cig ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis yongs su gang bar gyur cig ces bya ba yin no //
translated: May they fill it.

original: ci de dag nyi tshes sam snyam pa la /
analyzed: ci de dag nyi tshes sam snyam pa la /
translated: Are they only the solitary Buddhas?

original: sangs rgyas sras kyis zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sras kyis zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: He says, “the Buddha’s sons,”

original: de kho na nyid rnam par sangs rgyas ba'i sangs rgyas de dag nyid kyi sras sku dag pa mnga' ba zab cing bzang po yon tan gyi tshogs dpag tu med pa dang ldan pa sa bcu la rab tu gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag yin no
analyzed: de kho na nyid rnam par sangs rgyas ba'i sangs rgyas de dag nyid kyi sras sku dag pa mnga' ba zab cing bzang po yon tan gyi tshogs dpag tu med pa dang ldan pa sa bcu la rab tu gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag yin no
translated: the sons of those very Buddhas who have awakened to reality, who are pure in body, profound and good, endowed with an immeasurable multitude of virtues, the bodhisattvas who are well established in the ten stages.

original: // de'i phyir sems can rin po che khyad par can de lta bu dag gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing khyad par can de dag yongs su gang bar gyur cig ces bya ba @211b yin no //
analyzed: // de'i phyir sems can rin po che khyad par can de lta bu dag gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing khyad par can de dag yongs su gang bar gyur cig ces bya ba @211b yin no //
translated: Therefore, may those special sentient beings fill those special buddha-fields.

original: de ltar gnas dang gnas pa yongs su dag pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyang ba'i bsam pa brjod pas sems can la phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pa yongs su dag pa bstan pa'i phyir /🔽phyogs bcu'i sems can gang rnams ji snyed pa //
analyzed: de ltar gnas dang gnas pa yongs su dag pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyang ba'i bsam pa brjod pas sems can la phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pa yongs su dag pa bstan pa'i phyir / phyogs bcu'i sems can gang rnams ji snyed pa //
translated: Thus, by the purity of the place and the residents, the thought of purifying the buddha-field is expressed. In order to demonstrate the purity of the thought of benefit and happiness for sentient beings,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
translated: he says, “May all the sentient beings in the ten directions” and so on.

original: phyogs bcu dag na gang ji snyed 'khod pa de dag thams cad bde bar gyur cig ces bya ba 'dis ni ngan song ba'i sdug bsngal las bzlog par bstan to //
analyzed: phyogs bcu dag na gang ji snyed 'khod pa de dag thams cad bde bar gyur cig ces bya ba 'dis ni ngan song ba'i sdug bsngal las bzlog par bstan to //
translated: Here, by saying “May all those who are in the ten directions be happy,” he demonstrates the reversal of the suffering of the lower realms.

original: ci re 'ga' zhig gam zhe na /
analyzed: ci re 'ga' zhig gam zhe na /
translated: Is it only some of them?

original: ma yin te rtag tu zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: ma yin te rtag tu zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: No, he says “always.”

original: ngan songa'i sdug bsngal dang bral du zin kyang bde 'gror skyes pa rnams la nad la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal yod do snyam pa la /
analyzed: ngan songa'i sdug bsngal dang bral du zin kyang bde 'gror skyes pa rnams la nad la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal yod do snyam pa la /
translated: Even if they were free from the suffering of the unfortunate realms, those born in the fortunate realms have the suffering of illness, etc.

original: nad med gyur cig ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: nad med gyur cig ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus he says, May they be free from illness!

original: dus thams cad du lhan cig skyes pa dang glo bur gyi sdug bsngal ma lus pa las grol bar gyur cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dus thams cad du lhan cig skyes pa dang glo bur gyi sdug bsngal ma lus pa las grol bar gyur cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: May they be free from all suffering, both that which is innate and that which is adventitious, at all times.

original: sdug bsngal de dang bral du zin kyang de bas chos mi zad pa dbul ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal yod do snyam pa las /🔽'gro ba kun gyi chos kyi don rnams ni //
analyzed: sdug bsngal de dang bral du zin kyang de bas chos mi zad pa dbul ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal yod do snyam pa las / 'gro ba kun gyi chos kyi don rnams ni //
translated: Even if they were free from that suffering, they have the suffering of poverty, etc. which is worse.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Thus he says, May all beings obtain the Dharma!

original: 'gro ba thams cad de /
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad de /
translated: All beings means

original: sems can gyi phung po ma lus pa dag gi chos kyi 'dod pa grub par gyur cig ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sems can gyi phung po ma lus pa dag gi chos kyi 'dod pa grub par gyur cig ces bya ba yin no //
translated: all the masses of sentient beings.

original: chos kyi rnyed pa'i don ni chos kyi don yin te /
analyzed: chos kyi rnyed pa'i don ni chos kyi don yin te /
translated: The meaning of the Dharma is the attainment of the Dharma.

original: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam las ma gol bas rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam las ma gol bas rnyed pa'o //
translated: It is attained by not deviating from the path of the ten virtues.

original: yang na chos kyi zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gnyi gar ma smad ba'o //
analyzed: yang na chos kyi zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gnyi gar ma smad ba'o //
translated: Or else, the word “dharma” means that which is not censured in either of the two worlds.

original: chos kyi zhes smos pas ni pha rol la gnod pa byas pa'i sdug bsngal med par bstan to //
analyzed: chos kyi zhes smos pas ni pha rol la gnod pa byas pa'i sdug bsngal med par bstan to //
translated: By mentioning “dharma,” he shows that there is no suffering from harming others.

original: chos kyi yang ci ste na sgrub pa dang srung ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang 'brel par 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
analyzed: chos kyi yang ci ste na sgrub pa dang srung ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang 'brel par 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
translated: But if it is dharma, how can there be suffering connected with practice and protection, etc.?

original: mthun par gyur cig zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: mthun par gyur cig zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: He says, “May they be favorable.”

original: sgrub pa la sogs pa'i yongs su nyon mongs pa med pas shin tu mthun par gyur cig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa la sogs pa'i yongs su nyon mongs pa med pas shin tu mthun par gyur cig ces bya ba'o //
translated: Since there is no affliction from practice, etc., may they be very favorable.

original: de lta ma yin yang 'dod pas phongs pa la sogs pas byas pa'i sdug bsngal 'byung ba kho na'o snyam pa la /
analyzed: de lta ma yin yang 'dod pas phongs pa la sogs pas byas pa'i sdug bsngal 'byung ba kho na'o snyam pa la /
translated: But even if that is not the case, suffering is produced by the lack of desired objects, etc.

original: re ba'ang 'grub par shog ces bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: re ba'ang 'grub par shog ces bya ba gsungs so //
translated: He says, “May their hopes be fulfilled.”

original: lus can thams cad kyi re ba ste /
analyzed: lus can thams cad kyi re ba ste /
translated: The hope of all embodied beings

original: 'dod pa'i don 'grub par bya ba'i bsam pa grub cing 'byor bar shog ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don 'grub par bya ba'i bsam pa grub cing 'byor bar shog ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: is the thought of accomplishing the desired aim. May that be accomplished and fulfilled.

original: byang @212a * //
analyzed: byang @212a * //
translated: The Perfection of Patience

original: chub kyi sems ni sems can la phan ba skyed pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir da ltar ma 'ongs pa'i sangs rgyas mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par smon pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang sems can yongs su dag par smon pas ni byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa bstan to //
analyzed: chub kyi sems ni sems can la phan ba skyed pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir da ltar ma 'ongs pa'i sangs rgyas mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par smon pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang sems can yongs su dag par smon pas ni byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa bstan to //
translated: The thought of enlightenment is characterized by the production of benefit for sentient beings. Therefore, the generation of the thought of enlightenment is shown by the aspiration to the complete enlightenment of the Buddhas of the present and the future, and by the aspiration to the purification of the Buddha-field and of sentient beings.

original: 'dir dang por mchod pa rab tu dbul bas ni mos pas spyod pas bsdus pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bstan te //
analyzed: 'dir dang por mchod pa rab tu dbul bas ni mos pas spyod pas bsdus pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bstan te //
translated: Here, the offering of worship at the outset shows the perfection of giving included in the career of devoted interest.

original: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa mos pas spyod pas bsdus pa brjod nas /
analyzed: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa mos pas spyod pas bsdus pa brjod nas /
translated: Thus, having described the generation of the thought of enlightenment included in the career of devoted interest in three verses,🔽he shows the other perfections in order to demonstrate it.

original: de bstan par bya ba'i phyir byang chub spyod pa dag ni bdag spyod cing //
analyzed: de bstan par bya ba'i phyir byang chub spyod pa dag ni bdag spyod cing //
translated: Thus, he says, I shall practice the career of the Bodhisattvas, etc.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa rtsa ba drug pa la sogs pas ni de las gzhan pa thabs ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa rtsa ba drug pa la sogs pas ni de las gzhan pa thabs ston to //
translated: In this, the six root verses beginning with the line, I shall practice the career of the Bodhisattvas, etc., show the other means.

original: byang chub kyi sems mi brjed pa dang / de dang mthun pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub pa yang skye ba dran na 'byung gi / de lta ma yin te ;
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems mi brjed pa dang / de dang mthun pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub pa yang skye ba dran na 'byung gi / de lta ma yin te ;
translated: The bodhisattva's recollection of former lives is the cause of the bodhisattva's nonforgetting of the spirit of enlightenment and of the practice of the transcendences in accord with it.

original: dran pa nyams na de gnyi ga med do //
analyzed: dran pa nyams na de gnyi ga med do //
translated: Without that recollection, neither is possible.

original: byang chub tu spyod pa ni byang chub tu spyod pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub tu spyod pa ni byang chub tu spyod pa ste /
translated: The practice of enlightenment is the practice of the spirit of enlightenment.

original: de'i rgyu 'phags pa kun du bzang po'i spyod pa la nan tan byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu 'phags pa kun du bzang po'i spyod pa la nan tan byed pa'o //
translated: Its cause is the practice of the holy universal vehicle.

original: de spyod cing ste thos pa dang bsam pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis bsgom zhing zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽de yang phyugs bdag pa'i thar pa bzhin du skye ba gcig gis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de spyod cing ste thos pa dang bsam pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis bsgom zhing zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // de yang phyugs bdag pa'i thar pa bzhin du skye ba gcig gis ni ma yin no //
translated: Practicing that, that is, cultivating it by the process of hearing, reflection, etc.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: And that is not accomplished in a single lifetime, like the liberation of one who has the life span of a fly.

original: bskal pa grangs med pa du mas 'thob pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyis 'thob par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa du mas 'thob pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyis 'thob par bya ba yin no //
translated: But rather, it is accomplished by the collections of merit and wisdom obtained in the course of many incalculable eons.

original: de'i phyir skye ba dran pa nyid med na de thams cad mi srid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir skye ba dran pa nyid med na de thams cad mi srid do //
translated: Therefore, without the recollection of former lives, all that is impossible.

original: tshe rabs gzhan du brjes nas sdug ste /
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan du brjes nas sdug ste /
translated: It is miserable to change to another life.

original: gnyid kyis log pa'i gnas skabs nas bdag su yin pa dang / bdag gi gnas gang yin pa dang / bdag gis bya ba dang mi bya ba gang yin pa mi shes pa de lta bur gyur pa la ni dge ba med pa dang / yang shin tu ring na tshogs yongs su rdzogs par lta ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: gnyid kyis log pa'i gnas skabs nas bdag su yin pa dang / bdag gi gnas gang yin pa dang / bdag gis bya ba dang mi bya ba gang yin pa mi shes pa de lta bur gyur pa la ni dge ba med pa dang / yang shin tu ring na tshogs yongs su rdzogs par lta ga la 'gyur /
translated: In the state of sleep, I do not know who I am, where I am, what I should do, and what I should not do. In that state, there is no virtue, much less the completion of the accumulations.

original: de bas na skye ba dran par gyur ces bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na skye ba dran par gyur ces bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, he says, “May I remember my birth.”

original: smon lam ma btab par yang lha la sogs pa'i nang na skye ba dran pa dag yod do snyam pa la /
analyzed: smon lam ma btab par yang lha la sogs pa'i nang na skye ba dran pa dag yod do snyam pa la /
translated: One might think that even without making a vow, there are those who remember birth among gods and so on.

original: 'gro ba kun du zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: 'gro ba kun du zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, he says, “In all migrations.”

original: 'gro ba ni sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa lnga ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba ni sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa lnga ste /
translated: “Migration” refers to the five: hell-beings, and so on.

original: las dang nyon @212b mongs pa'i dbang gis sems can rnams shi ba'i 'og tu skye ba'i don du de dag 'gro bas na 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: las dang nyon @212b mongs pa'i dbang gis sems can rnams shi ba'i 'og tu skye ba'i don du de dag 'gro bas na 'gro ba'o //
translated: Because sentient beings go to those for the purpose of being born after death through the power of karma and afflictions, they are migrations.

original: 'di skad du las kyi dbang gis 'gro ba thams cad du skye ba na rtag tu skye ba dran par gyur cig ces bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du las kyi dbang gis 'gro ba thams cad du skye ba na rtag tu skye ba dran par gyur cig ces bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is what is being said: “When I am born in all the realms of rebirth through the power of karma, may I always remember my birth.”

original: 'chi 'pho ni shi ba ste 'chi ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ni shi ba ste 'chi ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Death is the passing away, that is, the passing away of death.

original: skye ba ni skye ba ste ris mthun pa'i khyad par 'thob ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba ni skye ba ste ris mthun pa'i khyad par 'thob ba'o //
translated: Birth is the birth, that is, the acquisition of a particular type of existence.🔽Even though one remembers one’s birth, one has not purified one’s mental continuum in the state of an ordinary person, because one is a householder and associates with those people. Therefore, the text says, “When I die and am born, may I be born in a place where I can see a buddha.”🔽One should be born in a place where one can see a buddha, that is, where one can see a buddha.🔽One should be born in a place where one can see a buddha, that is, where one can see a buddha.🔽One should be born in a place where one can see a buddha, that is, where one can see a buddha.

original: skye ba dran du zin kyang so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs na khyim bar gyur pa'i phyir dang / de'i skye bo dang 'grogs pa'i phyir sems kyi rgyud sbyang ba ma byas pas tshogs la sbyor ba snyed par 'chi 'pho skye ba na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: skye ba dran du zin kyang so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs na khyim bar gyur pa'i phyir dang / de'i skye bo dang 'grogs pa'i phyir sems kyi rgyud sbyang ba ma byas pas tshogs la sbyor ba snyed par 'chi 'pho skye ba na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: One should be born in a place where one can see a buddha, that is, where one can see a buddha.🔽One should be born in a place where one can see a buddha, that is, where one can see a buddha.🔽One should be born in a place where one can see a buddha, that is, where one can see a buddha.🔽One should be born in a place where one can see a buddha, that is, where one can see a buddha.🔽One should be born in a place where one can see a buddha, that is, where one can see a buddha.🔽One should be born in a place where one can see a buddha, that is, where one can see a buddha.🔽One should be born in a place where one can see a buddha, that is, where one can see a buddha.🔽One should be born in a place where one can see a buddha, that is, where one can see a buddha.🔽One should be born in a place where one can see a buddha, that is, where one can see a buddha.🔽One should be born in a place where one can see a buddha, that is, where one can see a buddha.🔽One should be born in a place where one can see a buddha, that is, where one can see a buddha.

original: gang nas 'chi 'pho ba dang / gang du skye ba der rab tu byung bar gyur cig pa'o //🔽gang du skye ba der rab tu byung ste khyim pa'i cha byad dang / der 'grogs pa bor yang dus ji srid cig gi bar du snyam pa la /
analyzed: gang nas 'chi 'pho ba dang / gang du skye ba der rab tu byung bar gyur cig pa'o //🔽gang du skye ba der rab tu byung ste khyim pa'i cha byad dang / der 'grogs pa bor yang dus ji srid cig gi bar du snyam pa la /
translated: One should be born in a place where one can see a buddha, that is, where one can see a buddha.🔽One should be born in

original: rtag tu zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: rtag tu zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: He always means that he is not a renunciate for a while.

original: dus thams cad du ste bar skabs su rab tu byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dus thams cad du ste bar skabs su rab tu byung ba ma yin no //
translated: He is a renunciate at all times.

original: rab tu byung ba yang 'chal pa'i tshul khrims spyod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba yang 'chal pa'i tshul khrims spyod pa'i phyir /
translated: Because he practices pure morality,

original: tshul khrims la sogs pa la skyon byung na tshogs yongs su rdzogs par gal 'gyur /
analyzed: tshul khrims la sogs pa la skyon byung na tshogs yongs su rdzogs par gal 'gyur /
translated: if there is a fault in morality, etc., how can the collections be completed?

original: de med pa'i tshul khrims ni yon tan thams cad kyi gzhi yin pas yon tan 'thob pa thams cad kyang med par 'gyur bas de'i phyir tshul khrims spyod pa dri med ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de med pa'i tshul khrims ni yon tan thams cad kyi gzhi yin pas yon tan 'thob pa thams cad kyang med par 'gyur bas de'i phyir tshul khrims spyod pa dri med ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Since morality without that is the basis of all good qualities, all acquisition of good qualities would be impossible. Therefore, he says, “He practices pure morality, etc.”

original: tshul khrims kyi mtshan nyid kyi spyod pa ni tshul khrims spyod pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi mtshan nyid kyi spyod pa ni tshul khrims spyod pa'o //
translated: The practice of the characteristics of morality is the practice of morality.

original: de yang ci ste 'dod chags la sogs pa'i skyon gyis kun nas bslangs pa'i 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi dri mas dri ma can du 'gyur bas de'i phyir dri ma med ces bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de yang ci ste 'dod chags la sogs pa'i skyon gyis kun nas bslangs pa'i 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi dri mas dri ma can du 'gyur bas de'i phyir dri ma med ces bya ba gsungs so //
translated: If that is motivated by faults such as passion, it becomes stained by the stain of immorality. Therefore, he says, “pure.”

original: de yang ci ste na bslab pa mi 'dod pa'i gti mug gi spyod pas bslab pa'i gnas rnams mi shes pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: de yang ci ste na bslab pa mi 'dod pa'i gti mug gi spyod pas bslab pa'i gnas rnams mi shes pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Why is that? Because of the conduct of delusion that does not desire the training, one does not know the points of training.

original: dran pa nyams pa la sogs pas yongs su ma dag par 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
analyzed: dran pa nyams pa la sogs pas yongs su ma dag par 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
translated: Or, one thinks that it will become impure due to the degeneration of mindfulness, and so on.

original: yongs su dag par zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: yongs su dag par zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “it is completely pure.”

original: shes rab kyis yongs su zin pa'i tshul khrims ni dri ma med cing yongs su dag pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyis yongs su zin pa'i tshul khrims ni dri ma med cing yongs su dag pa yin no //
translated: Morality that is embraced by wisdom is stainless and completely pure.

original: yongs su dag pa yang ci ste na dus tshigs kyi nyi ma dag la 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa yang ci ste na dus tshigs kyi nyi ma dag la 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
translated: Why is it completely pure? One thinks that it is like the sun at the time of the equinox.

original: rtag tu zhes bya ba @213a * //
analyzed: rtag tu zhes bya ba @213a * //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “always.”

original: gsungs te / ji srid 'tsho'i bar du zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsungs te / ji srid 'tsho'i bar du zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is taught that it is for as long as one lives.

original: tshul khrims rnam pa de lta bu yang ci ste na phyogs gcig par 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam pa de lta bu yang ci ste na phyogs gcig par 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
translated: Why is such morality also one-sided?

original: ma nyams zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ma nyams zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “it is not degenerated.”

original: bslab pa yongs su rdzogs par gzung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bslab pa yongs su rdzogs par gzung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the meaning of “upholding the complete training.”

original: de yang ci ste na /
analyzed: de yang ci ste na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bag med pas skyon can du 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
analyzed: bag med pas skyon can du 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
translated: One might think that it is flawed because of heedlessness.

original: skyon med ces bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: skyon med ces bya ba gsungs so //
translated: To remedy that, he said, “flawless.”

original: des na rang bzhin dang bcas pa'i kha na mtho ba'i dngos po dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: des na rang bzhin dang bcas pa'i kha na mtho ba'i dngos po dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because it is free from the things that are naturally reprehensible,

original: kun du kha na ma thob med pa'i tshul khrims su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun du kha na ma thob med pa'i tshul khrims su 'gyur ro //
translated: it is morality that is completely irreproachable.

original: de'i phyir tshul khrims rnam pa de lta bu la rtag bar byed cing rgyun du nan tan byed par shog cig ces bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshul khrims rnam pa de lta bu la rtag bar byed cing rgyun du nan tan byed par shog cig ces bya ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “May I always practice and constantly apply myself to such morality.”

original: bde 'gror lus dang longs spyod kyi khyad par legs pas bde ba dang yid bde ba 'thob pa'i phyir dang / 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi gdung ba zhi bar byed pa'i phyir sems bsil bar byed pa'i don gyis tshul khrims zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bde 'gror lus dang longs spyod kyi khyad par legs pas bde ba dang yid bde ba 'thob pa'i phyir dang / 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi gdung ba zhi bar byed pa'i phyir sems bsil bar byed pa'i don gyis tshul khrims zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called morality because it cools the mind, since one obtains the happiness of pleasure and mental pleasure through the excellence of body and possessions in good destinies, and because it pacifies the torment of immorality.

original: de ltar skye ba dran pa dang rab tu 'byung ba dang tshul khrims yongs su dag pas ni rang gi rgyud yongs su smin par bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar skye ba dran pa dang rab tu 'byung ba dang tshul khrims yongs su dag pas ni rang gi rgyud yongs su smin par bstan to //
translated: Thus, through remembering one’s past lives, going forth, and pure morality, one’s own stream is matured.

original: da ni skye ba gzhan dran pa'i mthu nyid kyis srog chags thams cad kyi skad yongs su shes pa'i phyir skad kyi bye brag de dang de dag thams cad kyis sems can gyi don sgrub pa'i ched du smon lam gyi khyad par gyis lha la sogs pa'i nang
analyzed: da ni skye ba gzhan dran pa'i mthu nyid kyis srog chags thams cad kyi skad yongs su shes pa'i phyir skad kyi bye brag de dang de dag thams cad kyis sems can gyi don sgrub pa'i ched du smon lam gyi khyad par gyis lha la sogs pa'i nang
translated: Now, by the power of remembering other births, in order to accomplish the aims of sentient beings by means of all those various languages, due to the special aspiration, he is born among the gods, etc.

original: de dang der skyes na rang rang gi skad kyi khyad par rnams kyis de dag la chos bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de dang der skyes na rang rang gi skad kyi khyad par rnams kyis de dag la chos bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: and in order to teach the Dharma to them by means of their respective special languages,

original: lha yi skad dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: lha yi skad dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he speaks the language of the gods, etc.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni rgyud gzhan yongs su smin par bstan to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni rgyud gzhan yongs su smin par bstan to //
translated: This verse shows the complete ripening of other continuums.

original: de ltar na de dag gi don spyad nas bdag dang gzhan la don sgrub pa la bsam pa gtum po mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ltar na de dag gi don spyad nas bdag dang gzhan la don sgrub pa la bsam pa gtum po mi rigs te /
translated: Thus, having accomplished their aims, it is not right to be impatient in accomplishing the aims of self and other.

original: don de sgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don de sgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: For the sake of accomplishing that aim,

original: des shing pha rol phyin la rab brtson te //
analyzed: des shing pha rol phyin la rab brtson te //
translated: he is gentle and diligent in the perfections.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsungs so //
translated: This verse is stated.

original: des pa ni sems can thams cad la mchog tu byams pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: des pa ni sems can thams cad la mchog tu byams pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Gentleness is the nature of supreme love for all sentient beings.

original: de ni sems can log par sgrub pa thams cad dang 'grogs kyang yongs su mi skyo zhing rang gi @213b lus dang ngag dang yid kyis kyang gzhan la gnod pa mi byed de /
analyzed: de ni sems can log par sgrub pa thams cad dang 'grogs kyang yongs su mi skyo zhing rang gi @213b lus dang ngag dang yid kyis kyang gzhan la gnod pa mi byed de /
translated: Even when associating with all sentient beings who are wrongly oriented, he is not discouraged, and he does not harm others with his own body, speech, or mind.

original: de ltar sems can thams cad sdung pa la zhugs pa de ni byams pa dang snying rje dang ldan pas sgrib pa med par sems can gyi don bsgrub bo /
analyzed: de ltar sems can thams cad sdung pa la zhugs pa de ni byams pa dang snying rje dang ldan pas sgrib pa med par sems can gyi don bsgrub bo /
translated: Thus, he who is engaged in protecting all sentient beings, being endowed with love and compassion, accomplishes the aims of sentient beings without obstruction.

original: de ltar lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las yongs su dag pas /
analyzed: de ltar lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las yongs su dag pas /
translated: Thus, through the purification of the actions of body, speech, and mind,🔽he is devoted to the perfections.

original: pha rol phyin la rab brtson te zhes bya ba'am pha rol tu phyin pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa ste rang gi phun sum tshogs pa'i mthar phyin par 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol phyin la rab brtson te zhes bya ba'am pha rol tu phyin pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa ste rang gi phun sum tshogs pa'i mthar phyin par 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The perfections are generosity and so on, because they lead to the completion of one's own excellence.

original: de bas na de dag la rab tu brtson te shin tu mngon par dga'o //
analyzed: de bas na de dag la rab tu brtson te shin tu mngon par dga'o //
translated: Therefore, he is devoted to them, he delights in them.

original: ci ste na byang chub kyi sems dang bral bar mi 'gyur ram snyam pa la /
analyzed: ci ste na byang chub kyi sems dang bral bar mi 'gyur ram snyam pa la /
translated: But how is it that he does not forget the Thought of Enlightenment?🔽He says,

original: byang chub sems ni nam kyang brjed ma gyur //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems ni nam kyang brjed ma gyur // zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The Thought of Enlightenment was never forgotten.

original: 'dir ni pha rol tu phyin pa bya ba goms pa'i phyir gnyen po rnyed pas mos par spyod pa'i sa na sems can gyi don gyi rgyu smon lam gyi dbang gis de dang de dag tu skyes na yang mos pa'i dbang gis byang chub kyi sems nam du🔽yang brjed par ma gyur cig ces ston to //
analyzed: 'dir ni pha rol tu phyin pa bya ba goms pa'i phyir gnyen po rnyed pas mos par spyod pa'i sa na sems can gyi don gyi rgyu smon lam gyi dbang gis de dang de dag tu skyes na yang mos pa'i dbang gis byang chub kyi sems nam du yang brjed par ma gyur cig ces ston to //
translated: Here, by the attainment of the antidote, in the stage of practice through belief, for the sake of the practice of the perfections, even though he is born here and there by the power of the vow for the sake of sentient beings, he never forgets the Thought of Enlightenment, by the power of his belief.

original: de la bla na med pa'i ye shes thob pa ni byang chub po //
analyzed: de la bla na med pa'i ye shes thob pa ni byang chub po //
translated: There, the attainment of unexcelled intuition is enlightenment.

original: der sems ni byang chub kyi sems te /
analyzed: der sems ni byang chub kyi sems te /
translated: The Thought is the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rnam pa sna tshogs bsags pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rnam pa sna tshogs bsags pa'i phyir ram /
translated: It is so called because it accumulates the various collections of merit and intuition.

original: ji ltar yongs su sbyang bar byas pa'i mthu yongs su bzung ba'i dbang gis 'khor ba pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i tshul rnam pa tha dad pa sna tshogs kyis bkra bar bya ba'i phyir sems so //
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su sbyang bar byas pa'i mthu yongs su bzung ba'i dbang gis 'khor ba pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i tshul rnam pa tha dad pa sna tshogs kyis bkra bar bya ba'i phyir sems so //
translated: The word mind is used because it is the mind that is the basis of the power of purification, and because it is the mind that is variegated with the various modes of cyclic existence and of the transcendence of suffering, by the power of having taken up the purification.

original: nam yang brjed ma gyur zhes bya ba ni gzhar yang ma gyur cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: nam yang brjed ma gyur zhes bya ba ni gzhar yang ma gyur cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The phrase may it never be forgotten means may it never happen.

original: de la de'i skye ba'i mthu nyams par ma gyur cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽de ltar byang chub kyi sems dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs yongs su dag pa la yang ci ste na sgrib pa kun du 'byung srid do snyam pa la /
analyzed: de la de'i skye ba'i mthu nyams par ma gyur cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go // de ltar byang chub kyi sems dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs yongs su dag pa la yang ci ste na sgrib pa kun du 'byung srid do snyam pa la /
translated: The phrase may its power to be born never be destroyed means may its power to be born never be destroyed.

original: sdig pa gang rnams sgrib par gyur pa dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sdig pa gang rnams sgrib par gyur pa dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Thus, in the purification of the resistances to the spirit of enlightenment, the verse begins, Whatever sins have been committed, whatever have been undertaken, etc.

original: sdig pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams te /
analyzed: sdig pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams te /
translated: Sins are the unwholesome dharmas such as attachment, etc.

original: de dag nyid 'phags pa'i lam skye ba la sgrib pas bsgribs pa rnams te /
analyzed: de dag nyid 'phags pa'i lam skye ba la sgrib pas bsgribs pa rnams te /
translated: They are obscurations because they obscure the arising of the noble path.

original: las dang / nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin rnams so / de la las ni byas shing bsags pas rtogs pa'i @214a * //🔽bar du gcod par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: las dang / nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin rnams so / de la las ni byas shing bsags pas rtogs pa'i @214a * // bar du gcod par gyur pa'o //
translated: Karma is that which is created and accumulated, and which becomes an obstacle until realization.

original: nyon mongs pa ni mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam kun nas slong bar byed pa nyid kyis thams cad du gyur pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam kun nas slong bar byed pa nyid kyis thams cad du gyur pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sgrib pa'o //
translated: Affliction is that which is the motivating force of the ten unwholesome courses of action, and which becomes all-pervasive.

original: rnam par smin pa ni gang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rdzogs pa'i bar du gcod pa ste de nyid sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni gang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rdzogs pa'i bar du gcod pa ste de nyid sgrib pa'o //
translated: Ripening is that which is an obstacle to the completion of the accumulations of merit and wisdom, and which is itself an obscuration.

original: de dag bdag gi rgyud la yongs su byang bar shog ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: de dag bdag gi rgyud la yongs su byang bar shog ces bya ba ste /
translated: May those be completely purified in my continuum.

original: 'byung bar ma gyur cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'byung bar ma gyur cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means may they not arise.

original: yongs su byang ba ci ste nam lus par ma yin na snyam pa la /
analyzed: yongs su byang ba ci ste nam lus par ma yin na snyam pa la /
translated: If one thinks, What is complete purification?

original: ma lus pa zhes bya bas bye brag tu byas te /
analyzed: ma lus pa zhes bya bas bye brag tu byas te /
translated: It is specified by without exception.

original: kun nas dkris pa bag chags dang bcas pa yang med par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa bag chags dang bcas pa yang med par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: And also the fetters together with their residual impressions are not there. This is the meaning.

original: rim pa ni skye ba gzhan du song ba'i tshe dran pa nyams na thog ma med pa'i tshe rabs gzhan na goms pa khyim gyi gnas la sred pa sngon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rim pa ni skye ba gzhan du song ba'i tshe dran pa nyams na thog ma med pa'i tshe rabs gzhan na goms pa khyim gyi gnas la sred pa sngon du 'gyur ro //
translated: The order is as follows: When one has gone to another birth, if memory is lost, then the craving for the home life which was cultivated in other births without beginning will come to the fore.

original: de bas na bu dang bu mo la sogs pa la chags pas nyams na tshul khrims 'tshal zhing dge ba la mngon bar mi dga' ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na bu dang bu mo la sogs pa la chags pas nyams na tshul khrims 'tshal zhing dge ba la mngon bar mi dga' ba'o //
translated: Then, when one is ruined by attachment to sons, daughters, and so on, one will not delight in morality and virtue.

original: de nas tshul khrims 'chal na sems can yongs su smin par byed pa rnyed par dka'o //
analyzed: de nas tshul khrims 'chal na sems can yongs su smin par byed pa rnyed par dka'o //
translated: Then, when one is immoral, it will be difficult to find the opportunity to develop living beings.

original: de nas sems dri ma can du gyur na yid bzhin gyi nor bu lta bu sems can rnams la nges par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas sems dri ma can du gyur na yid bzhin gyi nor bu lta bu sems can rnams la nges par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, when the mind is defiled, one will not be able to give to beings the jewel of the mind which is like a wish-fulfilling gem.

original: de nas pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor ba dang thag ring ngo //
analyzed: de nas pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor ba dang thag ring ngo //
translated: Then, one will be far from the application of the transcendences.

original: de nas bsod nams kyi tshogs thams cad kyi sa bon du 'gyur ba byang chub kyi sems las yongs su nyams so //
analyzed: de nas bsod nams kyi tshogs thams cad kyi sa bon du 'gyur ba byang chub kyi sems las yongs su nyams so //
translated: Then, one falls away from the thought of awakening, which is the seed of all the stores of merit.

original: de nas sems kyi yon tan thams cad kyis stong pa la nyes par spyod pa nyon mongs pa rab 'byams ma bzlog pa dag 'dod dgur rnam par rgyu'o //
analyzed: de nas sems kyi yon tan thams cad kyis stong pa la nyes par spyod pa nyon mongs pa rab 'byams ma bzlog pa dag 'dod dgur rnam par rgyu'o //
translated: Then, one is not restrained from the infinite defilements, which are the bad actions, and one wanders about as one wishes, empty of all the good qualities of the thought of awakening.

original: 'das pa'i skye ba dran pas de nyid rab tu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'das pa'i skye ba dran pas de nyid rab tu 'byung ngo //
translated: One remembers one’s past lives, and one goes forth from home to the homeless life.

original: de nas tshul khrims so //
analyzed: de nas tshul khrims so //
translated: Then, one observes morality.

original: de nas sems can yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: de nas sems can yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: Then, one brings beings to maturity.

original: de nas nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, one becomes irreversible.

original: de nas pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor ro //
analyzed: de nas pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor ro //
translated: Then, one applies oneself to the perfections.

original: de nas byang chub kyi sems mi brjed do //
analyzed: de nas byang chub kyi sems mi brjed do //
translated: Then, one does not forget the thought of awakening.

original: de nas sgrib pa spangs te /
analyzed: de nas sgrib pa spangs te /
translated: Then, one abandons the obscurations.

original: byang chub kyi sems yongs su mi gtong ba'i go rims ni de lta'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems yongs su mi gtong ba'i go rims ni de lta'o //
translated: This is the order in which one does not abandon the thought of awakening.

original: skabs 'dis ni mos pas spyod pas bsdus pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
analyzed: skabs 'dis ni mos pas spyod pas bsdus pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
translated: In this section, the perfection of morality is taught as it is included in the stage of action out of faith.

original: da ni byang chub kyi sems mi brjed pa dang mi gos par bsgrub par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni byang chub kyi sems mi brjed pa dang mi gos par bsgrub par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the practice of not forgetting and not being stained by the Thought of Enlightenment, he states this verse:

original: las dang nyon mongs bdud kyi las rnams @214b las ;🔽/ zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di gsungs so //🔽'dis ni gang gis /
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs bdud kyi las rnams @214b las ; / zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di gsungs so // 'dis ni gang gis /
translated: The deeds, the defilements, the deeds of Mara,

original: gang du dang / ji ltar mi gos pa ste go rims bzhin du ston to //
analyzed: gang du dang / ji ltar mi gos pa ste go rims bzhin du ston to //
translated: By this, he teaches what, where, and how one is not stained, respectively.

original: gang gis mi dgos she na /
analyzed: gang gis mi dgos she na /
translated: By what is one not stained?

original: las rnams kyis so //
analyzed: las rnams kyis so //
translated: By the deeds.

original: las ni sems pa dang des byas ba ste /
analyzed: las ni sems pa dang des byas ba ste /
translated: The deeds are the intention and what is done by it.

original: de bas na mi dge ba'i las byas par gyur par de dag las rnam par grol ba'i spyad par bya bar sbyar ro //🔽ci las 'ga' zhig las sam zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na mi dge ba'i las byas par gyur par de dag las rnam par grol ba'i spyad par bya bar sbyar ro // ci las 'ga' zhig las sam zhe na /
translated: Therefore, one should practice the liberation from those deeds which have been done by non-virtuous deeds.🔽From which deeds?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: Not from any deeds.

original: nyon mongs rnams las kyang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: nyon mongs rnams las kyang zhes gsungs so //
translated: But from the defilements, he says.

original: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa ste /🔽lus dang sems kyi rgyun gdung bar byed /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa ste / lus dang sems kyi rgyun gdung bar byed /
translated: The defilements are attachment, etc.🔽They are defilements because they torment the continuum of body and mind,

original: dri ma can du byed pas nyon mongs pa rnams so //
analyzed: dri ma can du byed pas nyon mongs pa rnams so //
translated: and because they make it dirty.

original: ci las dang nyon mongs pa nyid tshe las sam zhe na /
analyzed: ci las dang nyon mongs pa nyid tshe las sam zhe na /
translated: Are karma and affliction themselves the obstacle to life?

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: No, they are not.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: bdud kyi las rnams las kyang zhes bya ba gsungs te //
analyzed: bdud kyi las rnams las kyang zhes bya ba gsungs te //
translated: It is said, “even from the works of Mara.”

original: dge ba'i chos kyi bar chad byed pa'i phyir bdud rnams so //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos kyi bar chad byed pa'i phyir bdud rnams so //
translated: Because they create obstacles to virtuous dharmas, they are Maras.

original: de dag kyang lha'i bu'i bdud la sogs pa dang / nye du dang yul dang lta la rtog pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang lha'i bu'i bdud la sogs pa dang / nye du dang yul dang lta la rtog pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: They are the Mara of the son of gods, etc., relatives, country, views, and so on.

original: gang du mi dgos snyam pa la /🔽'jig rten 'gro ba rnams su zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gang du mi dgos snyam pa la / 'jig rten 'gro ba rnams su zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Where is there no need for them?🔽It is said, “in the migrations of the world.”

original: 'jig pa'i phyir 'jig rten no //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i phyir 'jig rten no //
translated: The world is so called because it perishes.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /🔽sems can dang / snod do //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te / sems can dang / snod do //
translated: It is of two kinds:🔽sentient beings and the receptacle world.

original: de dag ni 'jig rten gyi 'gro ba rnams te ;
analyzed: de dag ni 'jig rten gyi 'gro ba rnams te ;
translated: They are the migrations of the world.

original: 'di skad du 'gro ba rnams su 'khor na mi gos par spyad ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du 'gro ba rnams su 'khor na mi gos par spyad ces bya ba yin no //
translated: This is to say, “One should practice without being defiled by the migrations.”

original: gos pa ni dri ma can du byed pa ste /
analyzed: gos pa ni dri ma can du byed pa ste /
translated: Defilement is that which makes dirty.

original: de med pa'i phyir mi gos pa'o //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir mi gos pa'o //
translated: Because it does not exist, there is no defilement.

original: ci 'dra bar snyam pa la 'di ji ltar padmo zhes bya ba'i dpes gsal bar byed de /
analyzed: ci 'dra bar snyam pa la 'di ji ltar padmo zhes bya ba'i dpes gsal bar byed de /
translated: How is that? It is clarified by the example of the lotus.

original: dper na padmo chu las skyes pa na chus mi gos par skye ba de bzhin du bdag kyang 'gro ba thams cad la rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba la sogs pa spangs nas mi gos par zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dper na padmo chu las skyes pa na chus mi gos par skye ba de bzhin du bdag kyang 'gro ba thams cad la rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba la sogs pa spangs nas mi gos par zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Just as a lotus, born in the water, grows unsullied by the water, so also I, having abandoned attachment and aversion to all beings, will be unsullied.

original: nyi ma dang zla ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nyi ma dang zla ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Like the sun and moon.

original: dper na nyi ma dang zla ba nam mkha'i dkyil na rgyu bas bsil ba dang tsha ba sgrub par byed kyang /
analyzed: dper na nyi ma dang zla ba nam mkha'i dkyil na rgyu bas bsil ba dang tsha ba sgrub par byed kyang /
translated: Just as the sun and moon, moving in the sky, produce heat and cold,

original: srog chags rnams la rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba spangs pa de bzhin du bdag kyang sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir 'khor ba'i nam mkha' la rgyu zhing rjes su chags pa dang khong khro spangs te spyod do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: srog chags rnams la rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba spangs pa de bzhin du bdag kyang sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir 'khor ba'i nam mkha' la rgyu zhing rjes su chags pa dang khong khro spangs te spyod do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: but are free of attachment and aversion to beings, so also I, moving in the sky of cyclic existence in order to ripen beings, will practice free of attachment and aversion.

original: skabs 'dis ni mos pas spyod pa'i sas bsdus @215a * //
analyzed: skabs 'dis ni mos pas spyod pa'i sas bsdus @215a * //
translated: This section is included in the level of engagement through aspiration.🔽

original: pa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
analyzed: pa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
translated: This section shows the perfection of patience included in the stage of action in faith.

original: de ltar rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba sbangs te gnas pa la sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i bgegs mi 'byung bar bstan pa'i phyir /🔽ngan song sdug bsngal rab tu zhi bar byed //
analyzed: de ltar rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba sbangs te gnas pa la sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i bgegs mi 'byung bar bstan pa'i phyir / ngan song sdug bsngal rab tu zhi bar byed //
translated: Having thus cultivated non-attachment and non-aversion, in order to show that there is no obstacle to helping sentient beings,🔽he says,

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: “I will pacify the suffering of the unfortunate realms.”

original: shin tu nyes par spyad pa'i dbang gis bde 'gro rnams las ngan par 'gro zhing 'og tu 'gro bas na ngan song ngo //
analyzed: shin tu nyes par spyad pa'i dbang gis bde 'gro rnams las ngan par 'gro zhing 'og tu 'gro bas na ngan song ngo //
translated: Because of their extremely bad conduct, they go to the unfortunate realms, going down from the happy realms.

original: de dag tu sdug bsngal te mi bde ba myong ba 'di dag thams cad rab tu zhi bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag tu sdug bsngal te mi bde ba myong ba 'di dag thams cad rab tu zhi bar bya'o //
translated: I will pacify all of the suffering, the unhappiness, experienced in those realms.

original: rab tu zhi bar byas nas kyang sems can de dag bde ba'i khyad par phul du byung ba la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu zhi bar byas nas kyang sems can de dag bde ba'i khyad par phul du byung ba la dgod par bya'o //
translated: Having pacified it, I will establish those sentient beings in the highest happiness.

original: bde ba ni sim pa myong ba ste /
analyzed: bde ba ni sim pa myong ba ste /
translated: Happiness is the experience of comfort.

original: dbang po la phan 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po la phan 'dogs pa'o //
translated: It is the benefit of the faculties.

original: de ltar da ltar byung ba'i sdug bsngal bsal te /
analyzed: de ltar da ltar byung ba'i sdug bsngal bsal te /
translated: Thus, having benefited sentient beings by removing their present suffering

original: dpe med pa'i bde ba thob par byed pas sems can gyi don byas nas ma 'ongs pa'i gtan gyi bde ba la rab tu dgod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dpe med pa'i bde ba thob par byed pas sems can gyi don byas nas ma 'ongs pa'i gtan gyi bde ba la rab tu dgod pa'i phyir /
translated: and having caused them to attain incomparable happiness, in order to establish them in future lasting happiness,

original: 'gro ba thams cad la ni phan par spyad //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad la ni phan par spyad //
translated: he practices for the benefit of all beings.

original: ces bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Thus he speaks.

original: 'gro ba thams cad de sems can gyi tshogs ma lus pa la phan par bya ba'i phyir bla na med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la rab tu dgod par spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad de sems can gyi tshogs ma lus pa la phan par bya ba'i phyir bla na med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la rab tu dgod par spyad par bya'o //
translated: In order to benefit the entire multitude of sentient beings, he practices in order to establish them in unsurpassed nirvana.

original: gang du spyad snyam pa la /
analyzed: gang du spyad snyam pa la /
translated: Where does he practice?

original: phyogs rnams na ni zhing khyon ji tsam par //
analyzed: phyogs rnams na ni zhing khyon ji tsam par //
translated: In the directions, in fields as extensive as they are.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Thus he speaks.

original: phyogs bcu dag na zhing gi khyon ji tsam pa ste sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi khyad par de dag thams cad du'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu dag na zhing gi khyon ji tsam pa ste sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi khyad par de dag thams cad du'o //
translated: In the ten directions, in fields as extensive as they are, in all those special buddha-fields.

original: 'dis ni mos pas spyod pas bsdus pa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni mos pas spyod pas bsdus pa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the perfection of effort included in the stage of action out of faith.

original: de ltar bsod nams kyi chogs su thabs yongs su gzung ba bstan nas ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su gzung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar bsod nams kyi chogs su thabs yongs su gzung ba bstan nas ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su gzung ba'i phyir /
translated: Having thus taught the method of taking up the accumulation of merit, in order to teach the method of taking up the accumulation of knowledge,

original: sems can dag gi spyod dang mthun par 'jug / ces bya ba la sogs pa go cha bgo ba bstan to //
analyzed: sems can dag gi spyod dang mthun par 'jug / ces bya ba la sogs pa go cha bgo ba bstan to //
translated: he teaches the donning of the armor, beginning with “engaging in accordance with the conduct of sentient beings.”

original: 'khor ba na las dang nyon mongs pas spel ba'i srog chags rnams chags par 'gyur ba'i phyir sems can rnams so //
analyzed: 'khor ba na las dang nyon mongs pas spel ba'i srog chags rnams chags par 'gyur ba'i phyir sems can rnams so //
translated: Sentient beings are those living beings who are spread out in cyclic existence by karma and afflictions and who become attached.

original: de dag gi spyod pa ni sems can gyi bye brag gis lus dang ngag gi las rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag gi spyod pa ni sems can gyi bye brag gis lus dang ngag gi las rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Their conduct is the various types of physical and verbal karma, according to the different types of sentient beings.

original: de dag dang mthun par 'jug pa ni de dag gi bsam pa dang bag la nyal ba yongs su shes pa'i phyir de dag gi bsam pa dang mthun par de lta bu de dag gi spyod @215b pa dang mthun par 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: de dag dang mthun par 'jug pa ni de dag gi bsam pa dang bag la nyal ba yongs su shes pa'i phyir de dag gi bsam pa dang mthun par de lta bu de dag gi spyod @215b pa dang mthun par 'jug pa ste /
translated: Engaging in accordance with that is engaging in accordance with their conduct, in accordance with their thoughts, by way of knowing their thoughts and latent tendencies.

original: sems can mgu bar byed pa'i thabs 'dis ni byang chub kyi spyod pa ye shes kyi tshogs kyi mtshan nyid byang chub kyi rgyur thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa khyad par can la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: sems can mgu bar byed pa'i thabs 'dis ni byang chub kyi spyod pa ye shes kyi tshogs kyi mtshan nyid byang chub kyi rgyur thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa khyad par can la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa ste /
translated: By this method of pleasing sentient beings, one accomplishes the perfection of wisdom, which is the cause of enlightenment, and which has the nature of the special hearing, reflection, and meditation on the Dharma.

original: yongs su rdzogs par byed cing ste sgrub par byed cing ngo ;
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs par byed cing ste sgrub par byed cing ngo ;
translated: One accomplishes it, that is, one perfects it.

original: bzang po spyod pa dag ni rab ston cing //🔽zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po kun du bzang pos bstan pa bla na med pa'i ye shes thob par byed pa'i spyod pa'i thabs dpag tu med pa ston pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de dag sems can rnams la ston cing rab tu 'chad
analyzed: bzang po spyod pa dag ni rab ston cing // zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po kun du bzang pos bstan pa bla na med pa'i ye shes thob par byed pa'i spyod pa'i thabs dpag tu med pa ston pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de dag sems can rnams la ston cing rab tu 'chad
translated: And one reveals the excellent conduct.🔽This is the nature of the teaching of the great bodhisattva Samantabhadra, which reveals the immeasurable methods of conduct that cause the attainment of unexcelled wisdom.

original: cing spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: cing spyad par bya'o //
translated: One reveals those to sentient beings, and one should explain and practice them.

original: dus ji srid cig gi bar du snyam pa la /
analyzed: dus ji srid cig gi bar du snyam pa la /
translated: For how long a period of time?

original: ma 'ongs bskal ba kun du spyod par gyur //🔽ces bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: ma 'ongs bskal ba kun du spyod par gyur //🔽ces bya ba gsungs so //
translated: One engages in conduct for all future eons.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i bskal pa de dag thams cad du skye zhing skyes nas sems can mgu bar byed pas ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i bskal pa de dag thams cad du skye zhing skyes nas sems can mgu bar byed pas ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: In all those future eons, I will be born and, having been born, I will please sentient beings, and thereby complete the accumulation of wisdom.

original: 'dis ni sems can gyi spyod pa dang mthun par 'jug pa'i phyir mos pas spyod pas bsdus pa'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsnyad de /
analyzed: 'dis ni sems can gyi spyod pa dang mthun par 'jug pa'i phyir mos pas spyod pas bsdus pa'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsnyad de /
translated: This explains the perfection of meditative stabilization included in the stage of action out of faith, because it engages in accordance with the conduct of sentient beings.

original: gzhan gyi bsam pa yongs su shes pa ni mnyam par gzhag pa med par mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzhan gyi bsam pa yongs su shes pa ni mnyam par gzhag pa med par mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Understanding the thoughts of others does not occur without meditative stabilization.

original: de ltar go cha chen po bgos pa sems can mgu bar bya ba lhur len pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' skal ba mtshungs pa dang phrad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar go cha chen po bgos pa sems can mgu bar bya ba lhur len pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' skal ba mtshungs pa dang phrad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the donning of the great armor and the dedication to pleasing sentient beings and the meeting with other bodhisattvas who are equal in fortune,

original: bdag gi spyod dang mtshungs par gang spyod pa //
analyzed: bdag gi spyod dang mtshungs par gang spyod pa //
translated: he says, Those who practice in accordance with my conduct,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: and so on.

original: gzhan gang dag byang chub tu sems bskyed de bzang po spyod pa la nan tan byed pa de dag ni de dang skal ba 'dra bas na mtshungs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gang dag byang chub tu sems bskyed de bzang po spyod pa la nan tan byed pa de dag ni de dang skal ba 'dra bas na mtshungs pa ste /
translated: Those others who generate the Thought of Awakening and practice the Good Conduct, they are similar to him in fortune, so they are similar.

original: de'i dngos po ni mtshungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni mtshungs pa nyid do //
translated: The state of that is similarity.

original: sems can gang dag bdag dang mtshungs par gyur pa spyod pa mthun par gyur pa de dag ngang bdag phrad par gyur cig pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gang dag bdag dang mtshungs par gyur pa spyod pa mthun par gyur pa de dag ngang bdag phrad par gyur cig pa'o //
translated: Those sentient beings who have become like me, who have become of similar practice, may they meet with me.

original: phrad pa ni lhan cig 'grogs pa ste /
analyzed: phrad pa ni lhan cig 'grogs pa ste /
translated: Meeting is associating together.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyis gcig tu kun du bzang po spyod pa'i smon lam la nan tan byed par gyur cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyis gcig tu kun du bzang po spyod pa'i smon lam la nan tan byed par gyur cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that they should practice the aspiration to the Good Conduct in a single way, with body, speech, and mind.

original: dus ji srid cig gi bar du snyam pa la /
analyzed: dus ji srid cig gi bar du snyam pa la /
translated: For how long a time?

original: rtag tu zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: rtag tu zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: It is said, “always.”

original: 'dis ni byang chub sems dpa' skal ba 'dra ba dang 'grogs pas chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i phyir mos pas spyod @216a * //
analyzed: 'dis ni byang chub sems dpa' skal ba 'dra ba dang 'grogs pas chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i phyir mos pas spyod @216a * //
translated: By this, the Bodhisattva, through associating with those of similar fortune, discriminates the Dharma well, and through that discrimination, he practices the Good Conduct.

original: pas bsdus pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
analyzed: pas bsdus pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is taught as included in the perfection of giving.

original: da ni spyod pa mtshungs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang mthun par bya ba goms par byas nas /
analyzed: da ni spyod pa mtshungs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang mthun par bya ba goms par byas nas /
translated: Now, having cultivated the practice of being in harmony with the bodhisattvas who are one's companions,

original: bdag la phan par 'dod pa'i grogs po dag / ces bya ba la sogs pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen mnyes par bya ba ston te /
analyzed: bdag la phan par 'dod pa'i grogs po dag / ces bya ba la sogs pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen mnyes par bya ba ston te /
translated: the verse beginning Those friends who wish me well teaches pleasing the spiritual friend.

original: gang dag la zhe'am bdag la skyabs 'byung ba ni grogs po rnams so //
analyzed: gang dag la zhe'am bdag la skyabs 'byung ba ni grogs po rnams so //
translated: Those who have come to my refuge are the friends.

original: bdag la phan par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub mchog thob par byed pa dag ste /🔽bdag 'khor ba na 'khor ba'i che mchog tu phan 'dogs par 'dod pa mchog tu byams pa'i rang bzhin can kun du bzang po'i lung phyin ci ma log pa sbyin pa de dag dang phrad par gyur cig / phyir zhing 'grogs par gyur cig ces bya ba yin
analyzed: bdag la phan par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub mchog thob par byed pa dag ste / bdag 'khor ba na 'khor ba'i che mchog tu phan 'dogs par 'dod pa mchog tu byams pa'i rang bzhin can kun du bzang po'i lung phyin ci ma log pa sbyin pa de dag dang phrad par gyur cig / phyir zhing 'grogs par gyur cig ces bya ba yin
translated: Those who wish me well are those who cause the attainment of supreme enlightenment.

original: no // ci res 'ga' zhig gam zhe na //
analyzed: no // ci res 'ga' zhig gam zhe na //
translated: Those who wish me the highest benefit are those who wish me the highest benefit while I am wandering in cyclic existence. Those who are of a loving nature are those who are of a completely good nature. Those who give unmistaken instruction are those who give the unmistaken transmission of Samantabhadra. May I meet with them means May I meet with them again and again.🔽Sometimes?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.🔽

original: rtag tu zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: rtag tu zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Always is stated.

original: dus thams cad du ste thams cad kyi mchog rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: dus thams cad du ste thams cad kyi mchog rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob kyi bar du'o //
translated: At all times, until the attainment of the supreme enlightenment.

original: de ltar phan pa'i phyir zhugs pa de lta bu de dag la bdag gis ci zhig bya snyam pa la /
analyzed: de ltar phan pa'i phyir zhugs pa de lta bu de dag la bdag gis ci zhig bya snyam pa la /
translated: Having thus entered into the benefit of others, what should one do for those who have entered into the benefit of others?

original: nams kyang yid mi dbyung zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: nams kyang yid mi dbyung zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: One should never displease them.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid rnams kyis de'i lung dang 'gal bar mi spyod pa'i phyir lan 'ga' yang de dag yid 'byung bar mi bya'i //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid rnams kyis de'i lung dang 'gal bar mi spyod pa'i phyir lan 'ga' yang de dag yid 'byung bar mi bya'i //
translated: One should never displease them means that one should never displease them by acting in a way that contradicts their instructions, either physically, verbally, or mentally.

original: yang dag pa'i sgrub pa la nan tan byed pas kun du mnyes par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i sgrub pa la nan tan byed pas kun du mnyes par bya'o //
translated: One should always please them by practicing correctly.

original: 'dis ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen mnyes par bya ba'i thabs yongs su shes pas mos pas spyod pas bsdus pa'i thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen mnyes par bya ba'i thabs yongs su shes pas mos pas spyod pas bsdus pa'i thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the perfection of skillful means included in the stage of devotion, through complete understanding of the means of pleasing the spiritual friend.

original: de ltar go cha bgos pa skal ba 'dra ba'i byang chub sems dpa' mnyes par bya ba lhur len pas smon lam gyi stobs kyis dge ba'i bshes gnyen bla na med pa yang dag par mnyes par bya bas sangs rgyas su blta ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar go cha bgos pa skal ba 'dra ba'i byang chub sems dpa' mnyes par bya ba lhur len pas smon lam gyi stobs kyis dge ba'i bshes gnyen bla na med pa yang dag par mnyes par bya bas sangs rgyas su blta ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, the armor is donned. The bodhisattva who is like-minded, intent on pleasing the spiritual friends, by the power of his vow, perfectly pleases the unsurpassed spiritual friends. In order to teach that one should see the Buddhas,

original: mngon sum rtag tu bdag gis rgyal ba blta //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: mngon sum rtag tu bdag gis rgyal ba blta // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, “I always see the Victor in person.”

original: mngon sum ni mngon sum ste /
analyzed: mngon sum ni mngon sum ste /
translated: In person means in person.

original: nyon mongs pa las rgyal ba blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa las rgyal ba blta bar bya'o //
translated: One should see the Victor who is victorious over the afflictions.

original: ci bar 'ga' 'am snyam pa la rtag tu zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ci bar 'ga' 'am snyam pa la rtag tu zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thinking that this is so only sometimes, he says, “always.”

original: dus thams cad du'o //🔽ci rgyal ba nyag gcig gam zhe na /
analyzed: dus thams cad du'o // ci rgyal ba nyag gcig gam zhe na /
translated: It is at all times.

original: ma yin no //🔽'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: ma yin no // 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Thinking that it is only the Victor, he says,

original: sangs rgyas sras kyis bskor ba'i mgon po rnams //🔽@216b zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sras kyis bskor ba'i mgon po rnams //🔽@216b zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: “the protectors surrounded by the Buddha’s sons.”

original: bdag dang gzhan mngon par rtogs nas dngos por mngon par zhen pa'i gnyid dang bral te bdag nyid sangs rgyas pa'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams so //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan mngon par rtogs nas dngos por mngon par zhen pa'i gnyid dang bral te bdag nyid sangs rgyas pa'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams so //
translated: The Buddhas are so called because they have realized both their own and others' goals and are free from the sleep of attachment to things.

original: de rnams kyi sras ni bu rnams te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi sras ni bu rnams te /
translated: Their sons are the Bodhisattvas.

original: chos ma nor bar bstan pa las skyes shing byung bas sras rnams so //
analyzed: chos ma nor bar bstan pa las skyes shing byung bas sras rnams so //
translated: They are called sons because they are born from and arise from the teaching of the Dharma without error.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sras de dag gis yongs su bskor cing kun nas bskor ba de rtag tu blta zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sras de dag gis yongs su bskor cing kun nas bskor ba de rtag tu blta zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Always look at the Buddhas surrounded by their sons, the Bodhisattvas.

original: de lta bu de dag mthong nas ci zhig bya snyam pa la /
analyzed: de lta bu de dag mthong nas ci zhig bya snyam pa la /
translated: Having seen them in that way, what should one do?

original: de dag la yang mchod pa rgya cher bgyi //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de dag la yang mchod pa rgya cher bgyi // zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Make vast offerings to them as well.

original: sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa' dang bcas pa de dag la mchod pa bya ba ni yo byad khyad par can rnam pa sna tshogs spel te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa' dang bcas pa de dag la mchod pa bya ba ni yo byad khyad par can rnam pa sna tshogs spel te /
translated: Making offerings to the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas means to make various special offerings.

original: rnam par bkod pas rab tu phye ba me tog rin po che la sogs pa bla na yod pa'am bla na med pa dag gis mchod cing rjed par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam par bkod pas rab tu phye ba me tog rin po che la sogs pa bla na yod pa'am bla na med pa dag gis mchod cing rjed par bya ba yin no //
translated: One should worship and honor the buddhas with the highest or highest-common offerings, such as flowers, jewels, etc.

original: ci 'dra snyam pa la /
analyzed: ci 'dra snyam pa la /
translated: What are they like?

original: rgya cher zhes bya bar gsungs te /
analyzed: rgya cher zhes bya bar gsungs te /
translated: It is said, vastly.

original: dngos po dang bsam pas mthar thug pa med par bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po dang bsam pas mthar thug pa med par bya ba'o //
translated: They are to be made without limit in terms of things and thoughts.

original: dus ji srid cig gi bar du snyam pa la /
analyzed: dus ji srid cig gi bar du snyam pa la /
translated: For how long a time?

original: ma 'ongs bskal ba kun du zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs bskal ba kun du zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is said, throughout all future ages.

original: da lta dang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: da lta dang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The present, the past, and the future are called ages.

original: 'ongs pa ma yin pas na ma 'ongs pa ste 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'ongs pa ma yin pas na ma 'ongs pa ste 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since it has not come, it is future; it is said, it will come.

original: dus kyi rgyun mi thung bas na bskal ba ste /
analyzed: dus kyi rgyun mi thung bas na bskal ba ste /
translated: Since the stream of time is not interrupted, it is an age.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i bskal pa thams cad du bye brag med par mchod par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i bskal pa thams cad du bye brag med par mchod par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: One should worship without distinction throughout all future ages.

original: mi skyo bar zhes bya ba ni mchog tu dga' ba'o //
analyzed: mi skyo bar zhes bya ba ni mchog tu dga' ba'o //
translated: It is said, without weariness, which is supreme joy.

original: sangs rgyas la blta ba dang mchod ba bstan pa 'dis ni mos pas spyod pas bsdus pa'i smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la blta ba dang mchod ba bstan pa 'dis ni mos pas spyod pas bsdus pa'i smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan te /
translated: This shows the perfection of vows included in the stage of action out of faith,

original: smon lam gyi stobs kyis sangs rgyas mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smon lam gyi stobs kyis sangs rgyas mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one sees the Buddhas through the power of vowing.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa de dag mthong zhing mchod nas gzhan ci zhig bya snyam pa la /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa de dag mthong zhing mchod nas gzhan ci zhig bya snyam pa la /
translated: Having thus seen and worshipped those Tathagatas, what else should one do?🔽The verse says,

original: rgyal ba rnams kyi dam pa'i chos 'dzin cing //
analyzed: rgyal ba rnams kyi dam pa'i chos 'dzin cing //
translated: I will hold the good Dharma of the Conquerors,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and so on.

original: rgyal ba rnams kyi dam pa'i chos zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyal ba rnams kyi dam pa'i chos zhes bya ba la /
translated: The good Dharma of the Conquerors means

original: dam pa rnams kyi chos ni dam pa'i chos so //
analyzed: dam pa rnams kyi chos ni dam pa'i chos so //
translated: the Dharma of the good ones is the good Dharma.

original: yang na de ni dam pa yang yin la chos kyang yin pas dam pa'i chos so //🔽'dzin zhes bya ba ni mi brjed pa'i tshul gyis tshig dang don 'dzin cing rang gi sems la mngon du 'jog ste /
analyzed: yang na de ni dam pa yang yin la chos kyang yin pas dam pa'i chos so // 'dzin zhes bya ba ni mi brjed pa'i tshul gyis tshig dang don 'dzin cing rang gi sems la mngon du 'jog ste /
translated: Or, it is good and it is Dharma, thus it is the good Dharma.

original: sangs rgyas @217a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas @217a * //
translated: Hold means to hold the words and meanings by the method of non-forgetting and to make them manifest in one's own mind.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi dam pa'i chos lung dang rtogs pa'i bdag nyid 'dzin cing /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi dam pa'i chos lung dang rtogs pa'i bdag nyid 'dzin cing /
translated: They uphold the holy Dharma of the Bhagavans, which has the nature of scripture and realization.

original: ma 'ongs bskal pa kun du spyad par bgyi //
analyzed: ma 'ongs bskal pa kun du spyad par bgyi //
