translated: And practice it for all ages to come.

original: zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This is how it is to be applied.

original: ci dam pa'i chos gzung ba 'ba' zhig tu zad dam zhe nam yin no //
analyzed: ci dam pa'i chos gzung ba 'ba' zhig tu zad dam zhe nam yin no //
translated: Is it only the holy Dharma that is to be upheld?

original: 'o na ci zhe na /🔽byang chub spyod pa yongs su ston par byed //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na / byang chub spyod pa yongs su ston par byed //
translated: No, it is not.

original: ces bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs so //
translated: It is also the practice of enlightenment that is to be demonstrated.

original: byang chub ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: byang chub ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Enlightenment is the knowledge of all things.

original: de'i phyir spyod pa ni byang chub kyi spyod pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir spyod pa ni byang chub kyi spyod pa ste /
translated: The practice is the practice of enlightenment,

original: de thob par byed pa'i thabs pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid de //
analyzed: de thob par byed pa'i thabs pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid de //
translated: which is the method for attaining it, characterized by the practice of the perfections.

original: de yongs su bstan pa ni kun du rab tu bshad pa ste /
analyzed: de yongs su bstan pa ni kun du rab tu bshad pa ste /
translated: The demonstration of that is the complete explanation.

original: ser sna'i dri ma dang dral ba'i sems kyis 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag tu yang song nas yongs su mi skyo bar sems can rnams la ci rigs par theg pa chen po'i chos ston par byed cing zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ser sna'i dri ma dang dral ba'i sems kyis 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag tu yang song nas yongs su mi skyo bar sems can rnams la ci rigs par theg pa chen po'i chos ston par byed cing zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: With a mind free from the stain of stinginess, he goes to other world systems and, without getting tired, teaches the Mahayana Dharma to sentient beings, as is appropriate.

original: ci de tsam zhig bya bar zad dam zhe na /
analyzed: ci de tsam zhig bya bar zad dam zhe na /
translated: Is that all he does?

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: No, it is not.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What else does he do?

original: bzang po spyod pa rnam par sbyangs pa yang //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: bzang po spyod pa rnam par sbyangs pa yang // zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: He also purifies the conduct of good people.

original: bzang po ni 'phags pa kun du bzang po'o //
analyzed: bzang po ni 'phags pa kun du bzang po'o //
translated: Good people are the noble ones, Samantabhadra and so on.

original: de spyod pa ni bzang po spyod pa'o //
analyzed: de spyod pa ni bzang po spyod pa'o //
translated: Their conduct is the conduct of good people.

original: yang na de ni dge ba thams cad yongs su thob bar byed pa'i phyir spyod pa yang yin la bzang po yang yin pas bzang po spyod pa'o //
analyzed: yang na de ni dge ba thams cad yongs su thob bar byed pa'i phyir spyod pa yang yin la bzang po yang yin pas bzang po spyod pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, it is the conduct of good people because it is the conduct that brings about the attainment of all that is virtuous.

original: de dag rnam par sbyang ba zhes bya ba la kun du sbyang pa ni rnam par sbyang ba'o //
analyzed: de dag rnam par sbyang ba zhes bya ba la kun du sbyang pa ni rnam par sbyang ba'o //
translated: Purifying those is purifying the conduct of good people.

original: yang na sngar thos pa dang bsams ba tsam gyis sems la gtad de rgyas par byas nas phyis sgom pa'i ye shes kyi yongs su mthar thug par byed pa ni rnam par sbyangs pa'o //
analyzed: yang na sngar thos pa dang bsams ba tsam gyis sems la gtad de rgyas par byas nas phyis sgom pa'i ye shes kyi yongs su mthar thug par byed pa ni rnam par sbyangs pa'o //
translated: Or else, having previously made the mind stable by means of study and reflection, and having expanded it, later one makes it reach the ultimate by means of the wisdom of meditation. This is purification.

original: de ltar dam pa'i chos 'dzin pa dang / byang chub kyi spyod pa ston pa dang / bzang po spyod pa spyod pa na ci zhig bya snyam pa la /
analyzed: de ltar dam pa'i chos 'dzin pa dang / byang chub kyi spyod pa ston pa dang / bzang po spyod pa spyod pa na ci zhig bya snyam pa la /
translated: Thus, when one is upholding the holy Dharma, demonstrating the conduct of enlightenment, and practicing the conduct of the excellent being, what should one do?

original: ma 'ongs bskal ba kun du spyad par bgyi //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: ma 'ongs bskal ba kun du spyad par bgyi // zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: One should practice for all future ages.

original: 'dis ni smon lam yongs su rdzogs pas de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi stobs zil gyis gnon pa'i phyogs mos pas spyod pas bsdus pa'i stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to ;
analyzed: 'dis ni smon lam yongs su rdzogs pas de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi stobs zil gyis gnon pa'i phyogs mos pas spyod pas bsdus pa'i stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to ;
translated: This shows the perfection of power included in the stage of action out of faith, by means of the completion of vows, and by the subduing of the power of the resistances.

original: / de ltar dge ba'i las dpag tu med pa bsags pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: / de ltar dge ba'i las dpag tu med pa bsags pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the accumulations of merit and wisdom of the bodhisattva who has thus gathered immeasurable virtuous karma,🔽he says,

original: srid pa thams cad du yang 'khor ba na //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: srid pa thams cad du yang 'khor ba na //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: While wandering through all existences.

original: 'dir 'byung bar srid pa ste 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir 'byung bar srid pa ste 'khor ba'o //
translated: Here, existence is samsara.

original: de dag ni thams cad kyang yin la srid pa yang yin @217b pas srid pa thams cad de /
analyzed: de dag ni thams cad kyang yin la srid pa yang yin @217b pas srid pa thams cad de /
translated: Since they are all and are also existence, they are all existences.

original: khams gsum mtha' dag gis bsdus pa'i 'gro ba rnams so //
analyzed: khams gsum mtha' dag gis bsdus pa'i 'gro ba rnams so //
translated: They are all the beings included in the three realms.

original: las kyi dbang ngam smon lam gyi stobs kyis de dag tu 'khor zhing skye ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud bar myong ba ni /
analyzed: las kyi dbang ngam smon lam gyi stobs kyis de dag tu 'khor zhing skye ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud bar myong ba ni /
translated: Through the power of karma or the power of prayer, one cycles through them and is born, experiencing one life after another.

original: yon tan kun gyi mi zad mdzod du gyur //
analyzed: yon tan kun gyi mi zad mdzod du gyur //
translated: They become an inexhaustible treasure of all good qualities.

original: ces bya ba'i tha ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i tha ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is connected to the end of the verse.

original: bsod nams ye shes dag ni mi zad rnyed //🔽ces bya ba la /
analyzed: bsod nams ye shes dag ni mi zad rnyed // ces bya ba la /
translated: One attains inexhaustible merit and wisdom.

original: goms par byed pa'i phyir bsod nams so //
analyzed: goms par byed pa'i phyir bsod nams so //
translated: One becomes familiar with them, so they are merit.

original: shes pa'i phyir ye shes te /
analyzed: shes pa'i phyir ye shes te /
translated: One knows them, so they are wisdom.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes de dag gi mi zad pa ni yongs su mi gtugs pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes de dag gi mi zad pa ni yongs su mi gtugs pa'o //
translated: The inexhaustibility of that merit and wisdom is their non-depletion.

original: rnyed pa ni thob pa ste rab tu thob ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnyed pa ni thob pa ste rab tu thob ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Attainment is acquisition, which is to say, one obtains them.

original: de ltar ji skad smos pa'i thabs yongs su bzung bas sems can gyi khams ji snyed pa de snyed kyi bsod nams dang ye shes mi zad pa rnyed de bdag dang gzhan gyi don ma lus pa sgrub pa'i phyir yang shes rab la sogs pa yon tan rnams
analyzed: de ltar ji skad smos pa'i thabs yongs su bzung bas sems can gyi khams ji snyed pa de snyed kyi bsod nams dang ye shes mi zad pa rnyed de bdag dang gzhan gyi don ma lus pa sgrub pa'i phyir yang shes rab la sogs pa yon tan rnams
translated: Thus, by taking up the means as described, one obtains inexhaustible merit and wisdom equal to the extent of the realm of sentient beings.

original: kyis mi zad pa nyid thob par bya bar bzhed nas /
analyzed: kyis mi zad pa nyid thob par bya bar bzhed nas /
translated: In order to accomplish the aims of self and other without exception, one should also obtain the inexhaustibility of the qualities of wisdom and so forth.🔽Thus, it is stated:🔽Wisdom, means, samadhi, liberation,

original: shes rab thabs dang ting 'dzin rnam thar dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: shes rab thabs dang ting 'dzin rnam thar dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and so forth.

original: rab tu shes pa'i phyir shes rab bo //
analyzed: rab tu shes pa'i phyir shes rab bo //
translated: It is wisdom because of thorough knowledge.

original: bsam pa'i don bsgrims mi dgos par thob par byed pas thabs so //
analyzed: bsam pa'i don bsgrims mi dgos par thob par byed pas thabs so //
translated: It is means because it causes the attainment of the intended object without the need for effort.

original: dmigs pa la sems yang dag par 'dzin pas ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: dmigs pa la sems yang dag par 'dzin pas ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: It is samadhi because it correctly holds the mind to the object.

original: sgrib pa rnams las sems bye brag tu thar par byed pas rnam par thar pa ste /
analyzed: sgrib pa rnams las sems bye brag tu thar par byed pas rnam par thar pa ste /
translated: It is liberation because it causes the mind to be specifically liberated from obscurations.

original: ji skad smras pa de dag dang / bde bar gshegs pa'i sras mtha' dag gi rgyud la yod pa'i yon tan gyi tshogs rmad du byung ba grangs med dpag tu med pa gzhan dag gis kyang mi zad mdzod du gyur ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ji skad smras pa de dag dang / bde bar gshegs pa'i sras mtha' dag gi rgyud la yod pa'i yon tan gyi tshogs rmad du byung ba grangs med dpag tu med pa gzhan dag gis kyang mi zad mdzod du gyur ces bya ba yin no //
translated: May the store of the Sugata's children be inexhaustible, and may it be a treasure.

original: mi zad mdzod du gyur zhes bya ba ni mdzod zad mi shes par gyur cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi zad mdzod du gyur zhes bya ba ni mdzod zad mi shes par gyur cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase may it be a treasure means may it be an inexhaustible treasure.

original: sangs rgyas ni 'khor ba ji srid par bzhugs pa'i rgyun gyis rtag pa nyid kyis mi zad pa yang yin la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni 'khor ba ji srid par bzhugs pa'i rgyun gyis rtag pa nyid kyis mi zad pa yang yin la /
translated: The Buddha is inexhaustible because he is eternal due to the continuity of his existence as long as cyclic existence lasts.

original: de'i rgyud la mnga' ba'i yon tan stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i snod yin pa'i phyir mdzod kyang yin no //
analyzed: de'i rgyud la mnga' ba'i yon tan stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i snod yin pa'i phyir mdzod kyang yin no //
translated: He is also a treasure because he is a repository of the qualities of strength, fearlessness, and so on that exist in his stream of being.

original: yang na sangs rgyas ni yon tan rin po che thun mong ngam thun mong ma yin pa zad mi shes pa rnams kyi snod yin pa'i phyir mdzod de /
analyzed: yang na sangs rgyas ni yon tan rin po che thun mong ngam thun mong ma yin pa zad mi shes pa rnams kyi snod yin pa'i phyir mdzod de /
translated: Alternatively, the Buddha is a treasure because he is a repository of inexhaustible jewels of good qualities, whether common or uncommon.

original: gnyi ga'i dpe yang nam mkha'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i dpe yang nam mkha'o //
translated: Space is the example for both.

original: yon tan thams cad yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: yon tan thams cad yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: and all good qualities are completely pure.

original: zad mi shes pa @218a * //
analyzed: zad mi shes pa @218a * //
translated: They are inexhaustible.

original: 'dis ni mos pas spyod pas bsdus pa'i ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni mos pas spyod pas bsdus pa'i ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the perfection of knowledge included in the stage of action out of faith.

original: de ltar phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa dang / bshad ma thag pa mos pas spyod pas bsdus pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa goms par byas pas bsod nams dpag tu med pa yongs su bzung ba bstan nas //
analyzed: de ltar phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa dang / bshad ma thag pa mos pas spyod pas bsdus pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa goms par byas pas bsod nams dpag tu med pa yongs su bzung ba bstan nas //
translated: Thus, having shown the taking hold of immeasurable merit by the practice of the perfections included in the stage of action out of faith, such as the salutation, etc., and the immediately preceding practice of the perfections,

original: da ni lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa la 'jug pa ston te /
analyzed: da ni lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa la 'jug pa ston te /
translated: now he shows the entry into the stage of pure superior intention.

original: de yang rnam pa brgyad do //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa brgyad do //
translated: And that is eightfold.

original: de la sangs rgyas kyi zhing blta ba la 'jug pa ni /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas kyi zhing blta ba la 'jug pa ni /
translated: Among them, the entry into the vision of the Buddha-fields is

original: rdul gcig steng na rdul snyed zhing rnams te //
analyzed: rdul gcig steng na rdul snyed zhing rnams te //
translated: the vision of all the Buddha-fields in a single atom.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: This is shown by the verse:🔽In a single atom are Buddha-fields as many as all atoms,🔽with Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.🔽In a single atom are all atoms, and in each of them,

original: rdul shin tu phra ba gcig la rdul phra rab shin tu tshad med grangs med pa snyed kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad blta ba'o //
analyzed: rdul shin tu phra ba gcig la rdul phra rab shin tu tshad med grangs med pa snyed kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad blta ba'o //
translated: an infinite number of Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: ci de 'ba' zhig gam snyam pa la /
analyzed: ci de 'ba' zhig gam snyam pa la /
translated: One might think, Are only those [lands] to be seen?

original: de ma yin te /
analyzed: de ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not so.

original: gzhan yang / zhing der bsam gyis mi khyab sangs rgyas rnams //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang / zhing der bsam gyis mi khyab sangs rgyas rnams // zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Moreover, in those fields, the inconceivable Buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag so so la yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yon tan bsam gyis mi khyab pa grangs med pa dag blta ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag so so la yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yon tan bsam gyis mi khyab pa grangs med pa dag blta ste /
translated: and in each of those Buddha-fields, the Bhagavat Buddhas with inconceivable, innumerable good qualities are to be seen.

original: byang chub spyad pa spyod cing blta bar bgyi //
analyzed: byang chub spyad pa spyod cing blta bar bgyi //
translated: One should see them while practicing the conduct of enlightenment.

original: zhes 'og nas 'byung ba 'di dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes 'og nas 'byung ba 'di dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is to be applied with what will be stated below.

original: ci sangs rgyas nyag gcig blta bar bya ba'am zhe na /
analyzed: ci sangs rgyas nyag gcig blta bar bya ba'am zhe na /
translated: One might think, Are only the Buddhas to be seen?

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: No, it is not so.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Then what?

original: sangs rgyas sras kyi dbus na bzhugs pa la //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas sras kyi dbus na bzhugs pa la //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
translated: In the midst of the Buddha's sons,

original: sangs rgyas kyi sras byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus na bzhugs pa ma brdos shing phan tshun gnod par mi gnas par bzhugs pa bar mtshams yod par bzhugs pa la zhes bya ba rnams blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sras byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus na bzhugs pa ma brdos shing phan tshun gnod par mi gnas par bzhugs pa bar mtshams yod par bzhugs pa la zhes bya ba rnams blta bar bya'o //
translated: One should see the Bodhisattvas, the Sons of the Buddha, in the middle of the circle of their retinue, not crowded, not injuring each other, not dwelling in the same place, but dwelling in different places.

original: nam zhig de ltar blta bar 'dod ce na /
analyzed: nam zhig de ltar blta bar 'dod ce na /
translated: When does one wish to see them in this way?

original: byang chub spyad pa spyod cing zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: byang chub spyad pa spyod cing zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: He says, “while practicing the career of the Bodhisattva.”

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa ste /
translated: He is practicing the career of the Bodhisattva.

original: sa rnams dang pha rol tu phyin pa dag yongs su rdzogs par byed cing zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sa rnams dang pha rol tu phyin pa dag yongs su rdzogs par byed cing zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: He is fulfilling the stages and the perfections.

original: rdul phra rab kyi rdul gcig la sangs rgyas kyi zhing de snyed dang / de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor dang bcas pa de snyed ji ltar rung ste /
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi rdul gcig la sangs rgyas kyi zhing de snyed dang / de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor dang bcas pa de snyed ji ltar rung ste /
translated: How is it possible that in one atom there are so many Buddha-fields, and so many Tathagatas with their circles of Bodhisattvas?

original: tha mal bar gnas pa'i blos ni thams cad pas phra ba'i rdul phra rab la dpag tu med pa bgrang @218b pa las 'das pa'i zhing rnams dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams blta'o zhes bya ba de yid mi ches pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: tha mal bar gnas pa'i blos ni thams cad pas phra ba'i rdul phra rab la dpag tu med pa bgrang @218b pa las 'das pa'i zhing rnams dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams blta'o zhes bya ba de yid mi ches pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is it not incredible that the mind in its ordinary state should see the buddha-fields, which are beyond measure and calculation, and the buddhas and bodhisattvas, in the most subtle atoms?

original: bsgoms pa'i stobs goms par ma byas pa phyi rol gyi don la mngon par zhen pa theg pa chen po'i don gyi de kho na ma rtogs pa rnams ni yid mi ches pa bden no //
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i stobs goms par ma byas pa phyi rol gyi don la mngon par zhen pa theg pa chen po'i don gyi de kho na ma rtogs pa rnams ni yid mi ches pa bden no //
translated: It is true that those who have not cultivated the power of meditation, who are attached to external objects, and who have not understood the reality of the Mahayana, do not believe it.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam du mos pa theg pa chen po'i don bsgom pa la brtson pa rgyu'i stobs can dag ni yid ches te /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam du mos pa theg pa chen po'i don bsgom pa la brtson pa rgyu'i stobs can dag ni yid ches te /
translated: But those who are devoted to the doctrine of consciousness-only, who strive to cultivate the meaning of the Mahayana, and who have the power of the cause, do believe it.

original: 'di ltar rmi lam na khang bu dog pa na gnas pa'i glang po che'i khyu dang skye bo mang po 'dus pa dang / nags tshal thibs po dang / klung dang / mtshe'u dang / lteng ka bkod pa rnam pa sna tshogs mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar rmi lam na khang bu dog pa na gnas pa'i glang po che'i khyu dang skye bo mang po 'dus pa dang / nags tshal thibs po dang / klung dang / mtshe'u dang / lteng ka bkod pa rnam pa sna tshogs mthong ngo //
translated: In a dream, one sees a herd of elephants in a small house, a crowd of people, a thick forest, a river, a lake, a pond, and various arrangements.

original: mang po grangs med pa de snyed cig de na gnas par yang mi rung na de'i tshe de dag kyang dmigs pa la sad pa'i dus na yang dran no //
analyzed: mang po grangs med pa de snyed cig de na gnas par yang mi rung na de'i tshe de dag kyang dmigs pa la sad pa'i dus na yang dran no //
translated: Since it is not possible for so many innumerable beings to be there, one remembers them at the time of waking, when the object is perceived.

original: de lta bas na bsam gtan pa rnal 'byor can gyi dbang phyug rnams kyi gnas ni bsam gyis mi khyab pas yongs su sbyang ba byas pa'i sems la yid mi ches pa ci zhig yod ces de bstan bcos dang mdo dag las mang du dpyad zin to //
analyzed: de lta bas na bsam gtan pa rnal 'byor can gyi dbang phyug rnams kyi gnas ni bsam gyis mi khyab pas yongs su sbyang ba byas pa'i sems la yid mi ches pa ci zhig yod ces de bstan bcos dang mdo dag las mang du dpyad zin to //
translated: Therefore, since the domain of the contemplatives, the lords of yoga, is inconceivable, what is there to disbelieve about the mind that has been purified? This has been analyzed many times in the treatises and sūtras.

original: 'di ni 'jig rten na yang mthong ste /
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig rten na yang mthong ste /
translated: This is also seen in the world.

original: dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyis rnga brdungs pa las dngos po thams cad 'jug pa dang 'byung ba la sogs pa snang ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyis rnga brdungs pa las dngos po thams cad 'jug pa dang 'byung ba la sogs pa snang ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the case of a magician who, by beating a drum, causes all things to appear and disappear.

original: gal te de ni 'khrul pa tsam du zad do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ni 'khrul pa tsam du zad do zhe na /
translated: If you say that this is just an error,

original: 'dus byas thams cad kyang de bzhin te /
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad kyang de bzhin te /
translated: then all conditioned things are the same.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:🔽Like a star, a cataract, a lamp,

original: skar ma rab rib mar me dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: skar ma rab rib mar me dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: and so on.

original: de bas 'di ni mkhas pa rnams kyis rigs pa dang lung dag gis bsgrub bar bya ba yin gyi 'di la the tshom ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bas 'di ni mkhas pa rnams kyis rigs pa dang lung dag gis bsgrub bar bya ba yin gyi 'di la the tshom ni mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this should be established by reasoning and scripture for the wise. One should not doubt this.

original: yang na rnal 'byor gyi stobs kyis rdul phra rab dngos po thams cad kyi gnas ji tsam du 'dod par byed pa de tsam du rgyas par byed do //
analyzed: yang na rnal 'byor gyi stobs kyis rdul phra rab dngos po thams cad kyi gnas ji tsam du 'dod par byed pa de tsam du rgyas par byed do //
translated: Or else, by the power of yoga, one should expand the subtle particle to the extent one wishes, as the abode of all things.🔽Now, in order to expand the meditation, it is taught beginning with the line:

original: da ni / de ltar phyogs rnams ma lus thams cad du //
analyzed: da ni / de ltar phyogs rnams ma lus thams cad du //
translated: In this way, in all directions without exception,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsgom pa rgyas par bya ba ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsgom pa rgyas par bya ba ston to //
translated: one should meditate on the earth element as the nature of water, and so on.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni ji skad smos pa'i tshul du'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni ji skad smos pa'i tshul du'o //
translated: Thus means in the manner that has been stated.

original: ma lus phyogs rnams thams cad du zhes bya ba ni phyogs bcu ma lus pa thams cad du rdul phra rab re re'i steng du sangs rgyas rgya mtsho la mos pa 'jug go zhes bya ba yin no //🔽de ltar @219a * //
analyzed: ma lus phyogs rnams thams cad du zhes bya ba ni phyogs bcu ma lus pa thams cad du rdul phra rab re re'i steng du sangs rgyas rgya mtsho la mos pa 'jug go zhes bya ba yin no // de ltar @219a * //
translated: In all the directions without exception means in all the ten directions without exception. One should understand that one engages in the ocean of Buddhas on each atom.

original: phyogs la khyab par bstan nas dus la khyab par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyogs la khyab par bstan nas dus la khyab par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having thus taught the pervasion of space, in order to teach the pervasion of time, he says:

original: byis pa'i lam du zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: byis pa'i lam du zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: In the path of the childish.

original: byis pa ni de kho na nyid ma mthong bdag ste /
analyzed: byis pa ni de kho na nyid ma mthong bdag ste /
translated: The childish are those who have not seen reality.

original: dge ba'i las la nan gyis gzud dgos pas byis bdag go //
analyzed: dge ba'i las la nan gyis gzud dgos pas byis bdag go //
translated: They are childish because they must be forced into virtuous actions.

original: de dag gi lam ste 'gro ba rnams su 'gro ba la sogs pa'i rgyun gyis kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams so //
analyzed: de dag gi lam ste 'gro ba rnams su 'gro ba la sogs pa'i rgyun gyis kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams so //
translated: Their path is the world-realms that are thoroughly afflicted by the continuity of going and so forth in the migrations.

original: de nyid na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus rnam par gzhag pa yod kyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus rnam par gzhag pa yod kyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: Only there is there a past and future time, not elsewhere.

original: de bas na der gtogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang zhing dang bskal par spyod pas bsdus pa rnams la 'jug go zhes bya bar sbyor ro //
analyzed: de bas na der gtogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang zhing dang bskal par spyod pas bsdus pa rnams la 'jug go zhes bya bar sbyor ro //
translated: Therefore, one should understand that the Buddhas, their fields, and the activities of the eons are included in the entry into the realm of the Dharma Body.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa rnams ni rang gi 'od kyi dkyil 'khor gyi snang bas mun pa mun nag ma lus par bsal ba'i phyir sangs rgyas nyi ma rtag tu shar ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa rnams ni rang gi 'od kyi dkyil 'khor gyi snang bas mun pa mun nag ma lus par bsal ba'i phyir sangs rgyas nyi ma rtag tu shar ro //
translated: The fields of the Buddhas are always illuminated by the light of the sun of the Buddha, because the darkness is completely removed by the light of the halo of his own body.

original: de'i phyir de dag na byang chub sems dpa' rnams rtag par sad pas dus rnam par gzhag pa nyid med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag na byang chub sems dpa' rnams rtag par sad pas dus rnam par gzhag pa nyid med do //
translated: Therefore, the Bodhisattvas there are always awake, and so there is no division of time.

original: gza' dang skar ma'i tshogs med pa'i phyir nyin mtshan la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa med pa'i phyir yang dus rnam par gzhag pa med do //
analyzed: gza' dang skar ma'i tshogs med pa'i phyir nyin mtshan la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa med pa'i phyir yang dus rnam par gzhag pa med do //
translated: And there is no division of time because there is no division of day and night, etc., due to the absence of the hosts of planets and stars.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing blta ba la 'jug pa 'dis ni thog mar de kho na nyid rtogs na rab tu dga' ba thob pa'i phyir sa rab tu dga' ba dang sangs rgyas la mchod pa la sogs pa'i sbyin pas lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sas bsdus pa'i
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing blta ba la 'jug pa 'dis ni thog mar de kho na nyid rtogs na rab tu dga' ba thob pa'i phyir sa rab tu dga' ba dang sangs rgyas la mchod pa la sogs pa'i sbyin pas lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sas bsdus pa'i
translated: This engagement in seeing the buddha field is the ground of joy, since one first attains joy upon realizing thatness.🔽

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bstan to //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bstan to //
translated: By this entry into seeing the Buddha-land, first, the perfection of giving is taught to be fulfilled by the stage of the Joyful One and the stage of pure intention, which includes giving worship to the Buddha, etc., because one attains the Joyful One when one first realizes reality.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas kyi zhing blta ba la 'jug par brjod nas /
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas kyi zhing blta ba la 'jug par brjod nas /
translated: Having thus described the entry into seeing the Buddha-land,🔽now,

original: da ni / gsung gcig yan lag rgya mtsho'i skad rnams kyis //
analyzed: da ni / gsung gcig yan lag rgya mtsho'i skad rnams kyis //
translated: with the words “One voice, with its ocean of tones,”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas sangs rgyas kyi gsung la 'jug pa ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas sangs rgyas kyi gsung la 'jug pa ston to //
translated: he teaches the entry into the Buddha’s speech.

original: de la gsung gi dkyil 'khor gyi me long gcig shar ba la sems can thams cad kyi dbyangs kyi gzugs brnyan cig car du dmigs pas sems can du ma'i dri ba'i don gyi yul phan tshun mi mthun pa tha dad pa dag rtag tu dris kyang brjod pa
analyzed: de la gsung gi dkyil 'khor gyi me long gcig shar ba la sems can thams cad kyi dbyangs kyi gzugs brnyan cig car du dmigs pas sems can du ma'i dri ba'i don gyi yul phan tshun mi mthun pa tha dad pa dag rtag tu dris kyang brjod pa
translated: There, in one arising of the mirror of the circle of speech, the reflections of the voices of all sentient beings are simultaneously perceived, so that the meaning of the questions of many sentient beings, with their different and mutually exclusive objects, is always understood.

original: med cing 'bad mi dgos bar 'dri ba thams cad lung ston pa dmigs pa'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung ni sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: med cing 'bad mi dgos bar 'dri ba thams cad lung ston pa dmigs pa'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung ni sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'byung ba yin te /
translated: Because the speech of the Lord Buddha is seen to be able to respond to all questions without exception, and without effort, it arises in accordance with the thoughts of all sentient beings.

original: sangs rgyas kyi gsung bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du skye bo mtha' yas pa'i yid tshim par byed pa de lta bur 'jug par bya zhing @219b yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gsung bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du skye bo mtha' yas pa'i yid tshim par byed pa de lta bur 'jug par bya zhing @219b yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: One should engage in the speech of the Buddha, which satisfies the minds of infinite beings in accordance with their thoughts, and one should realize it as it is.

original: 'dis ni sa dri ma med pa dang tshul khrims yongs su dag par 'dod pa'i dngos po 'grub pa'i phyir tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni sa dri ma med pa dang tshul khrims yongs su dag par 'dod pa'i dngos po 'grub pa'i phyir tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang bstan to //
translated: By this, he also teaches the perfection of morality, because the stainless stage and the attainment of the object of pure morality are accomplished.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas kyi gsung la 'jug pa brjod nas /
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas kyi gsung la 'jug pa brjod nas /
translated: Having thus described the engagement with the speech of the Buddha,

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la 'jug par bya bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la 'jug par bya bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the engagement with the turning of the wheel of the Dharma,🔽he says,

original: gsung dbyangs zad mi shes pa de dag la //
analyzed: gsung dbyangs zad mi shes pa de dag la //
translated: With regard to those inexhaustible tones of speech,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽dbyangs ni gang la brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i dngos pos brjod par bya bar mi rtog pas nga ro tsam du zad pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // dbyangs ni gang la brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i dngos pos brjod par bya bar mi rtog pas nga ro tsam du zad pa ste /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: ca co'i sgra bzhin no //
analyzed: ca co'i sgra bzhin no //
translated: Melody is the mere sound, since it is not conceived as the entity of the expressed and the expresser, as in the case of the sound of a bell.

original: dbyangs de la mos pa'i stobs kyis gsung grangs med pa yod pa'i phyir gsung dbyangs zhes bstan te /
analyzed: dbyangs de la mos pa'i stobs kyis gsung grangs med pa yod pa'i phyir gsung dbyangs zhes bstan te /
translated: Melody is taught as the voice, because of the existence of innumerable voices by the power of devotion to that melody.

original: gsung ni brjod par bya brjod par byed pa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: gsung ni brjod par bya brjod par byed pa'i dngos po'o //
translated: Voice is the entity of the expressed and the expresser.

original: zad mi shes pa de dag la zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi khams kyi mthar thug pa ji snyed pa dag la'o //🔽dus gsum gshegs pa'i rgyal ba thams cad kyi //
analyzed: zad mi shes pa de dag la zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi khams kyi mthar thug pa ji snyed pa dag la'o // dus gsum gshegs pa'i rgyal ba thams cad kyi //
translated: In those inexhaustible ones means in those as many as there are limits to the realm of sentient beings.🔽Of all the Victors who have gone in the three times

original: zhes bya ba ni dus gsum po dag tu gshegs shing rnam par bzhugs pas na dus gsum gshegs pa dag ste thams cad kyang yin la dus gsum gshegs pa yang yin pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dus gsum po dag tu gshegs shing rnam par bzhugs pas na dus gsum gshegs pa dag ste thams cad kyang yin la dus gsum gshegs pa yang yin pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: means that all of them are Victors who have gone in the three times, since they have gone and are dwelling in the three times.

original: dus gsum smos pas ni sangs rgyas rnams te ma lus pa la 'jug pa bstan to //
analyzed: dus gsum smos pas ni sangs rgyas rnams te ma lus pa la 'jug pa bstan to //
translated: The mention of the three times indicates the entry into all the Buddhas without exception.

original: thams cad smos pas ni bar chad med par 'jug pa bstan to //🔽'di skad du gsung gi dkyil 'khor gcig gis bsdus pa skad ci khyad par thams cad dang ldan pa de dag gis phyogs dang dus thams cad na rnam par bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos gdul bya'i bsam pa tha dad pas so sor tha
analyzed: thams cad smos pas ni bar chad med par 'jug pa bstan to // 'di skad du gsung gi dkyil 'khor gcig gis bsdus pa skad ci khyad par thams cad dang ldan pa de dag gis phyogs dang dus thams cad na rnam par bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos gdul bya'i bsam pa tha dad pas so sor tha
translated: The mention of all indicates the entry without interruption.

original: dad par bshad par bya'o zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: dad par bshad par bya'o zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is what is being said: “By means of a single maṇḍala of speech, which is endowed with all the different languages, the Blessed Buddhas, who are present in all directions and times, should explain the Dharma, which is differentiated by the various inclinations of those to be trained, in the language of each of those to be trained.”

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that,🔽he says,

original: 'khor lo'i tshul rnams rab tu skor byed cing //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i tshul rnams rab tu skor byed cing // zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Causing the modes of the wheel to be turned.

original: 'khor lo'i tshul zhes bya ba ni chos kyi 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i tshul zhes bya ba ni chos kyi 'khor lo'o //
translated: The modes of the wheel means the wheel of the Dharma.

original: gdul bya'i rgyud la grol bas 'khor lo ste /
analyzed: gdul bya'i rgyud la grol bas 'khor lo ste /
translated: It is a wheel because it causes liberation in the mental continuum of those to be trained.

original: de dag la 'jug bar bya ba ni rab tu dga' bas sems can rnams la ston pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la 'jug bar bya ba ni rab tu dga' bas sems can rnams la ston pa'o //
translated: The entry into those is the teaching to sentient beings by means of the stage of great joy.

original: che ba'i bdag nyid de thams cad la yang rang gi blo'i stobs kyis bdag nyid 'jug par bya ste /
analyzed: che ba'i bdag nyid de thams cad la yang rang gi blo'i stobs kyis bdag nyid 'jug par bya ste /
translated: And in all of these great natures, one should engage by the power of one's own mind.

original: bzang po spyod pas sgrub pa'i nan tan gyis thob pa'i shes rab phul du @220a * //
analyzed: bzang po spyod pas sgrub pa'i nan tan gyis thob pa'i shes rab phul du @220a * //
translated: By the practice of the vow of good conduct, one should engage by the highest wisdom attained by that practice.

original: byung ba'i 'dis 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byung ba'i 'dis 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the verse.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la 'jug pa des ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos bstan brtag pa'i 'od kyi snang bas bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i mi shes pa'i mun pa sel ba'i phyir sa 'od byed pa yang bstan la ;
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la 'jug pa des ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos bstan brtag pa'i 'od kyi snang bas bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i mi shes pa'i mun pa sel ba'i phyir sa 'od byed pa yang bstan la ;
translated: By engaging in the turning of the wheel of the Dharma, one should illuminate the stage of the Luminous, because the light of the teaching of the Dharma as it truly is removes the darkness of ignorance in oneself and others.

original: sems can log bar sgrub pa dang du len pa'i phyir don gyis na bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang bstan to //
analyzed: sems can log bar sgrub pa dang du len pa'i phyir don gyis na bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang bstan to //
translated: And by accepting the wrong practice of sentient beings, one should also teach the perfection of patience.

original: de ltar chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la 'jug pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la 'jug pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the engagement in the turning of the wheel of the Dharma,

original: bskal pa la 'jug pa bstan par bzhed nas /
analyzed: bskal pa la 'jug pa bstan par bzhed nas /
translated: in order to teach the engagement in the eons,🔽he says,

original: ma 'ongs bskal pa thams cad 'jug par yang //
analyzed: ma 'ongs bskal pa thams cad 'jug par yang //
translated: In all future eons,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi skad cig me long gi dkyil 'khor gcig la ma 'ongs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i bskal pa thams cad 'jug par bya zhing khongs su gtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi skad cig me long gi dkyil 'khor gcig la ma 'ongs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i bskal pa thams cad 'jug par bya zhing khongs su gtogs par bya'o //
translated: In the single mirror-like instant of nonconceptual wisdom, all kalpas of the future are to be entered and included.

original: bskal pa smos pas ni dus der gtogs pa bde bar gshegs pa sras dang nyan thos la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyis bskor ba thams cad dang / 'gro bar gtogs pa dus la sogs pa bye brag du mas tha dad pa ji ltar gnas pa'i srog chags thams cad bsdus te /
analyzed: bskal pa smos pas ni dus der gtogs pa bde bar gshegs pa sras dang nyan thos la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyis bskor ba thams cad dang / 'gro bar gtogs pa dus la sogs pa bye brag du mas tha dad pa ji ltar gnas pa'i srog chags thams cad bsdus te /
translated: By mentioning the kalpas, all the Sugatas, together with their retinues of Bodhisattvas, Shravakas, and so on, who appear during that time, and all the living beings who are included in the world, differentiated by various times and so on, are included.

original: dngos po de bzhin du snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po de bzhin du snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those things appear as they are.

original: ji ltar skad cig gcig la ma 'ongs pa'i bskal pa thams cad 'jug par bya ba de bzhin du skad cig gcig pa nyid du mos pa'i sgo nas 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i bskal pa thams cad skad cig gcig la 'jug par
analyzed: ji ltar skad cig gcig la ma 'ongs pa'i bskal pa thams cad 'jug par bya ba de bzhin du skad cig gcig pa nyid du mos pa'i sgo nas 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i bskal pa thams cad skad cig gcig la 'jug par
translated: Just as all future eons are entered into in a single moment, in the same way, through the power of aspiration for a single moment, all past, future, and present eons are entered into in a single moment.

original: bya zhing khong su gtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bya zhing khong su gtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to enter into and include them,🔽it is said:

original: gang yang dus gsum bskal pa tshad de dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gang yang dus gsum bskal pa tshad de dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: “And all the eons of the three times are measured by him.”

original: 'dis ni skad cig gcig la skad cig gcig gis bskal pa thams cad la 'jug pa ste khongs su gtogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni skad cig gcig la skad cig gcig gis bskal pa thams cad la 'jug pa ste khongs su gtogs par bya ba'o //
translated: By this, all eons are entered into and included in a single moment by a single moment.

original: de ltar spyod pa'i khyad par bstan pa dang brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor bas yongs su grub pa'i bye brag 'dis ni byang chub kyi yan lag rtogs pa'i 'od 'phro ba thob pas sa 'od 'phro can yang bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar spyod pa'i khyad par bstan pa dang brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor bas yongs su grub pa'i bye brag 'dis ni byang chub kyi yan lag rtogs pa'i 'od 'phro ba thob pas sa 'od 'phro can yang bstan to //
translated: By teaching the special practice in this way and by applying the perfection of effort, this perfection of wisdom is accomplished. By attaining the light of understanding the branches of enlightenment, the stage of Brilliance is also taught.

original: de ltar bskal pa la 'jug pa brjod nas /
analyzed: de ltar bskal pa la 'jug pa brjod nas /
translated: Having thus described the entry into the eons,

original: sangs rgyas blta ba dang de'i spyod yul la 'jug pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sangs rgyas blta ba dang de'i spyod yul la 'jug pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to demonstrate the vision of the Buddhas and the entry into their domain,🔽he says:

original: dus gsum gshegs pa mi yi seng ge dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: dus gsum gshegs pa mi yi seng ge dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: I will see in a single instant all the Lions of Men who have gone in the three times.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs @220b pa dang da ltar byung ba'i dus na gshegs pa'i mi'i seng ge ste /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs @220b pa dang da ltar byung ba'i dus na gshegs pa'i mi'i seng ge ste /
translated: Those who have gone in the past, future, and present, the Lions of Men,

original: mi'i gtso bo rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi me long gi dkyil 'khor du chud pa gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad bdag gis skad cig gcig la blta bar bya zhing /
analyzed: mi'i gtso bo rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi me long gi dkyil 'khor du chud pa gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad bdag gis skad cig gcig la blta bar bya zhing /
translated: the chief of men, who are reflected in the mirror of nonconceptual intuition, I will see all of them in a single instant.

original: de dag gi spyod yul te /
analyzed: de dag gi spyod yul te /
translated: And I will enter into their domain,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi yul bsam gyis mi khyab pa la yang 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi yul bsam gyis mi khyab pa la yang 'jug par bya'o //
translated: into the inconceivable domain of the intuition of omniscience.

original: ji lta bu snyam pa la /
analyzed: ji lta bu snyam pa la /
translated: How is that?

original: sgyu mar gyur pa'i rnam thar stobs kyis 'jug / ces bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: sgyu mar gyur pa'i rnam thar stobs kyis 'jug / ces bya ba gsungs so //
translated: He says: I will enter by the power of the liberation that is like an illusion.

original: sgyu mar gyur ba'i rnam par thar pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas pa de dag dngos po thams cad sgyu ma lta bur gzigs pas ji ltar mos pa bzhin du lus rnam par gnas pas 'grub bo //
analyzed: sgyu mar gyur ba'i rnam par thar pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas pa de dag dngos po thams cad sgyu ma lta bur gzigs pas ji ltar mos pa bzhin du lus rnam par gnas pas 'grub bo //
translated: The concentration of liberation that is illusory, abiding in which they see all things as like illusions, is accomplished by the body abiding as one wishes.

original: sangs rgyas blta ba dang de'i spyod yul la 'jug pa brjod pa des ni bdud thams cad kyis shin tu thub par dka' ba'i phyir sa shin tu sbyangs dka' ba la 'jug par bstan la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas blta ba dang de'i spyod yul la 'jug pa brjod pa des ni bdud thams cad kyis shin tu thub par dka' ba'i phyir sa shin tu sbyangs dka' ba la 'jug par bstan la /
translated: By that description of the vision of the Buddha and entry into his domain, the difficulty of purifying the ground is taught, because it is very difficult for all demons to overcome.

original: sgyu ma lta bu la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs thob par bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang bstan to //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs thob par bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang bstan to //
translated: The perfection of meditation is also taught, by the attainment of the power of concentration such as the illusory.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas blta ba dang de'i spyod yul la 'jug pa brjod nas /
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas blta ba dang de'i spyod yul la 'jug pa brjod nas /
translated: Thus, after the description of the vision of the Buddha and entry into his domain,

original: da ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing bkod pa bsgrub pa la 'jug par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing bkod pa bsgrub pa la 'jug par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to teach the entry into the accomplishment of the array of the Buddha-land,🔽he says,

original: gang yang dus gsum dag gi zhing bkod pa //
analyzed: gang yang dus gsum dag gi zhing bkod pa //
translated: The array of the lands of the three times,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and so on.

original: dus gsum gyis bsdus pa'i zhing rnams kyi bkod pa rgyan gyi khyad par kha dog dang dbyibs sna tshogs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gang dag yin pa de dag rdul phra rab kyi rdul gcig la mos pa'i shes pas mngon sum du bya ba ni mngon par bsgrub
analyzed: dus gsum gyis bsdus pa'i zhing rnams kyi bkod pa rgyan gyi khyad par kha dog dang dbyibs sna tshogs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gang dag yin pa de dag rdul phra rab kyi rdul gcig la mos pa'i shes pas mngon sum du bya ba ni mngon par bsgrub
translated: The nature of the array of the special ornaments of the fields included in the three times, such as various colors and shapes, is to be actualized by the cognition of the aspiration for a single subtle particle.🔽That is the accomplishment.

original: pa'o // rdul gcig gi steng du ji lta ba de bzhin du phyogs bcu'i rdul phra rab re re la yang bar med par mos pas khyab bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: pa'o // rdul gcig gi steng du ji lta ba de bzhin du phyogs bcu'i rdul phra rab re re la yang bar med par mos pas khyab bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Just as on one particle, so on each subtle particle in the ten directions, without interruption, it is to be pervaded by the aspiration.

original: de ltar ma lus phyogs rnams thams cad du //
analyzed: de ltar ma lus phyogs rnams thams cad du //
translated: Thus, in all the endless directions,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: it is said.

original: phyogs thams cad du yang de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhing bkod pa thams cad la 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: phyogs thams cad du yang de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhing bkod pa thams cad la 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: In all directions, in the same way, one should enter all the arrays of the fields of all the Tathagatas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gtos kyis shin tu tha gru che ba grangs kyis mtha' yas pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gtos kyis shin tu tha gru che ba grangs kyis mtha' yas pa /
translated: The buddha fields are extremely vast in terms of their extent, and are limitless in number.

original: dus kyi bye brag gis dus gsum du gtogs pa rnams kyang rdul shin tu phra ba'i rdul phra rab kyi rdul gcig la 'jug pa'i ye shes kyi che ba nyid bstan pa @221a * //
analyzed: dus kyi bye brag gis dus gsum du gtogs pa rnams kyang rdul shin tu phra ba'i rdul phra rab kyi rdul gcig la 'jug pa'i ye shes kyi che ba nyid bstan pa @221a * //
translated: The greatness of the wisdom that enters a single atom of the finest dust particle of the three times that are included in the particular times is shown.

original: 'dis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa dang sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mngon du gyur pas sa mngon du gyur pa yang bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa dang sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mngon du gyur pas sa mngon du gyur pa yang bstan to //
translated: By this, the perfection of wisdom is shown, and the stage of manifestation is also shown by the manifestation of all the Buddha qualities.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas kyi zhing bkod bsgrub pa la 'jug pa brjod nas /
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas kyi zhing bkod bsgrub pa la 'jug pa brjod nas /
translated: Having thus described the engagement in establishing the array of the Buddha field,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i drung du 'gro ba la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir /🔽gang yang ma byon 'jig rten sgron ma rnams //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i drung du 'gro ba la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir / gang yang ma byon 'jig rten sgron ma rnams //
translated: for the sake of engaging in going to the presence of the Tathagata,🔽it is said:

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: And all the future lamps of the world... and so on.

original: ma byon pa ni ma byon pa ste snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ma byon pa ni ma byon pa ste snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The future is the future, as before.

original: 'od zer rab tu 'gyed pas phyi nang du bcas pa'i mi shes pa'i mun pa chen po sel ba'i phyir dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu ston pa'i phyir 'jig rten rnam pa gnyi ga'i yang sgron ma dang 'dra bas sgron ma dag ste /
analyzed: 'od zer rab tu 'gyed pas phyi nang du bcas pa'i mi shes pa'i mun pa chen po sel ba'i phyir dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu ston pa'i phyir 'jig rten rnam pa gnyi ga'i yang sgron ma dang 'dra bas sgron ma dag ste /
translated: Because they emit light rays that dispel the great darkness of ignorance, both internal and external, and because they perfectly reveal the eightfold noble path, they are like lamps for both worlds.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so //
translated: The Bhagavans are the Tathagatas.

original: ma byon pa de dag bla na med pa'i ye shes mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i dus dang / bla na med pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i dus te /
analyzed: ma byon pa de dag bla na med pa'i ye shes mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i dus dang / bla na med pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i dus te /
translated: Those who have not yet come are the time of the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment of pristine wisdom and the time of turning the unsurpassed wheel of the Dharma.

original: 'dul ba ji lta bdag gi nang du sprul pas bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par rab tu ston pa'i dus dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus byang chub sems dpa' chen po dag dang / thabs gcig tu theg pa'i chos bla na med pa 'phel ba'i gtam rdzogs par longs spyod pa'i dus dang /
analyzed: 'dul ba ji lta bdag gi nang du sprul pas bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par rab tu ston pa'i dus dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus byang chub sems dpa' chen po dag dang / thabs gcig tu theg pa'i chos bla na med pa 'phel ba'i gtam rdzogs par longs spyod pa'i dus dang /
translated: The time of the emanation body is when, although it is the nonabiding nirvana itself, it displays nirvana in order to ripen the thoughts of those to be trained.🔽The time of the emanation body is when, although it is the nonabiding nirvana itself, it displays nirvana in order to ripen the thoughts of those to be trained.🔽The time of the emanation body is when, although it is the nonabiding nirvana itself, it displays nirvana in order to ripen the thoughts of those to be trained.🔽The time of the emanation body is when, although it is the nonabiding nirvana itself, it displays nirvana in order to ripen the thoughts of those to be trained.🔽The time of the emanation body is when, although it is the nonabiding nirvana itself, it displays nirvana in order to ripen the thoughts of those to be trained.🔽The time of the emanation body is when, although it is the nonabiding nirvana itself, it displays nirvana in order to ripen the thoughts of those to be trained.🔽The time of the emanation body is when, although it is the nonabiding nirvana itself, it displays nirvana in order to ripen the thoughts of those to be trained.🔽The time of the emanation body is when, although it is the nonabiding nirvana itself, it displays nirvana in order to ripen the thoughts of those to be trained.🔽The time of the emanation body is when, although it is the nonabiding nirvana itself, it displays nirvana in order to ripen the thoughts of those to be trained.

original: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa nyid yin yang des 'dul ba'i bsam pa yongs su smin par bya ba'i dbang gis mya ngan las 'das pa ston pa'i dus ma byon pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad kyi drung du cig car du mchi'o //🔽der 'gro bas ni de'i dus na thob par bya ba'i yon tan gyi khyad par thob pas bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa ston te /
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa nyid yin yang des 'dul ba'i bsam pa yongs su smin par bya ba'i dbang gis mya ngan las 'das pa ston pa'i dus ma byon pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad kyi drung du cig car du mchi'o // der 'gro bas ni de'i dus na thob par bya ba'i yon tan gyi khyad par thob pas bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa ston te /
translated: The time of the emanation body is when, although it is the nonabiding nirvana itself, it displays nirvana in order to ripen the thoughts of those to be trained.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i drung du 'gro ba 'di ni 'jug pa brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i drung du 'gro ba 'di ni 'jug pa brgyad pa'o //
translated: The time of the emanation body

original: 'dis ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ring du rtogs pa'i phyir sa ring du song ba bstan la /
analyzed: 'dis ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ring du rtogs pa'i phyir sa ring du song ba bstan la /
translated: This shows that the stage is Gone Afar because it is far advanced in the realization of the qualities of the Buddha.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang ldan pas gcig na gnas kyang thabs kyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du lus cig car du ston pa'i phyir thabs kyi pha rol du phyin pa yang bstan to /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang ldan pas gcig na gnas kyang thabs kyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du lus cig car du ston pa'i phyir thabs kyi pha rol du phyin pa yang bstan to /
translated: And it shows that the perfection of means is far advanced because, endowed with nonconceptual intuition, the bodhisattva, though dwelling in one place, by means of his magical power displays his body simultaneously in all buddhafields.

original: de ltar 'jug pa rnam pa brgyad brjod nas /🔽da ni de ltar lam la zhugs pa'i @221b yon tan gnyen por gyur pa rnams la mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams kyis rnam pa thams cad du zil gyis mi non pa'i phyir dang des zil gyi non pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar 'jug pa rnam pa brgyad brjod nas / da ni de ltar lam la zhugs pa'i @221b yon tan gnyen por gyur pa rnams la mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams kyis rnam pa thams cad du zil gyis mi non pa'i phyir dang des zil gyi non pa'i phyir /
translated: Having thus described the eight kinds of engagement,🔽now, in order to show the ten powers of one who has thus entered the path, two verses on the ten powers.

original: kun du myur pa'i rdzu 'phrul stobs rnams dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa rnam pa gnyis kyis stobs rnam pa bcu gsungs so //
analyzed: kun du myur pa'i rdzu 'phrul stobs rnams dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa rnam pa gnyis kyis stobs rnam pa bcu gsungs so //
translated: The ten powers of the bodhisattva are:

original: de la 'byor ba ni rdzu 'phrul te sems kyis 'gro ba dang 'ong bal dbang 'byor ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'byor ba ni rdzu 'phrul te sems kyis 'gro ba dang 'ong bal dbang 'byor ba'o //
translated: Mastery is the magical power of going and coming by the mind.

original: 'gro ba de yang nam mkha' la sogs pa la ring ba dang / myur du 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba de yang nam mkha' la sogs pa la ring ba dang / myur du 'gro ba ste /
translated: And that going is in the sky, etc., and is swift.

original: rtsig pa la yang thad kar 'gro'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: rtsig pa la yang thad kar 'gro'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: One goes through a wall, etc.

original: de nyid kyi bye brag bstan pa'i phyir kun du myur ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi bye brag bstan pa'i phyir kun du myur ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says, “omnipresent speed.”

original: gang du 'dod pa dang ji ltar 'dod pa la sogs pa'i bar du thams cad la thags thogs med par 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang du 'dod pa dang ji ltar 'dod pa la sogs pa'i bar du thams cad la thags thogs med par 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one goes everywhere without obstruction, wherever one wishes, and as one wishes, etc.

original: theg pa ni theg pa chen po la sogs pa'i bye brag gis theg pa rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: theg pa ni theg pa chen po la sogs pa'i bye brag gis theg pa rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: The vehicle is the three kinds of vehicles, distinguished by the Great Vehicle, etc.

original: de la theg pa chen po ni byang chub kyi lam 'bras bu dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: de la theg pa chen po ni byang chub kyi lam 'bras bu dang bcas pa ste /
translated: The Great Vehicle is the path to enlightenment together with its result.

original: sa bcu dang pha rol tu phyin pa dang bla na med pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: sa bcu dang pha rol tu phyin pa dang bla na med pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: It is the nature of the ten stages, the perfections, and unsurpassed intuition.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa ni mdo sde dang 'dul ba dang chos mngon pa zhes bya ba ste sde snod gsum dang de la rag las pa rjes su mthun pa'i chos bsgrub pa dang / des thob par bya ba'i 'bras bu bzhi'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa ni mdo sde dang 'dul ba dang chos mngon pa zhes bya ba ste sde snod gsum dang de la rag las pa rjes su mthun pa'i chos bsgrub pa dang / des thob par bya ba'i 'bras bu bzhi'o //
translated: The vehicle of the disciples is the three scriptural collections called discourse, discipline, and clear science, and that which is dependent on them, the teachings that are in conformity with them, and the four results that are to be attained by them.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa ni bden pa bzhi dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs tsam dang / des thob par bya ba'i 'bras bu'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa ni bden pa bzhi dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs tsam dang / des thob par bya ba'i 'bras bu'i khyad par ro //
translated: The vehicle of the Solitary Buddhas is the four noble truths, the mere collection of merit and intuition, and the special result to be attained by them.

original: de'i stobs ni rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i ye shes thob pa'i phyir thams cad du thogs pa med par shes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i stobs ni rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i ye shes thob pa'i phyir thams cad du thogs pa med par shes pa'o //
translated: Its power is the knowledge that is unobstructed in every way, because it attains the intuition that is endowed with the most excellent of all aspects.

original: de'i phyir kun nas sgo yi zhes bya ba gsungs te gdul bya ji lta ba bzhin du rnam pa thams cad kyi khyad par lung ston pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i phyir kun nas sgo yi zhes bya ba gsungs te gdul bya ji lta ba bzhin du rnam pa thams cad kyi khyad par lung ston pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “from every side,” i.e., it is the prediction of all the special aspects in accordance with the disciples, i.e., the teachings.

original: kun du yon tan spyod pa'i stobs rnams dang // zhes bya ba la spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' kun du bzang po'i spyad pa spyod pa'o //
analyzed: kun du yon tan spyod pa'i stobs rnams dang // zhes bya ba la spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' kun du bzang po'i spyad pa spyod pa'o //
translated: Performance is the performance of the bodhisattva's conduct of universal goodness.

original: de'i stobs ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis mi non pa dang / des zil gyis gnon par nus pa'o //🔽de nyid kyi phyir zab cing rgya che ba shin tu yongs su dag pa grangs med pa /
analyzed: de'i stobs ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis mi non pa dang / des zil gyis gnon par nus pa'o // de nyid kyi phyir zab cing rgya che ba shin tu yongs su dag pa grangs med pa /
translated: Its power is that it cannot be overwhelmed by adverse elements, and that it can overwhelm those.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa rnams yongs su grub pa'i phyir kun du yon tan zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa rnams yongs su grub pa'i phyir kun du yon tan zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be the power of the virtues of universal performance, because it is the accomplishment of the profound and vast, the extremely pure, the innumerable, and the inconceivable.

original: kun du khyab pa byams pa dag gi stobs //
analyzed: kun du khyab pa byams pa dag gi stobs //
translated: The power of universal pervasion by love,

original: zhes bya ba la /🔽byams pa ni sems can thams cad la @222a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / byams pa ni sems can thams cad la @222a * //
translated: Here,

original: phan pa dang bde ba bsgrub pa'i bsam pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: phan pa dang bde ba bsgrub pa'i bsam pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: love is the characteristic of the intention to accomplish benefit and happiness for all sentient beings.

original: de'i stobs kyis khro ba la sogs pa sems can la rnam par 'tshe ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis zil gyis mi non pa'o //
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis khro ba la sogs pa sems can la rnam par 'tshe ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis zil gyis mi non pa'o //
translated: By its power, one cannot be overwhelmed by anger and so forth, which are characterized by harming sentient beings.

original: kun du khyab pa ni khams gsum du gtogs pa'i sems can sdug bsngal gsum dang ldan pa thams cad la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun du khyab pa ni khams gsum du gtogs pa'i sems can sdug bsngal gsum dang ldan pa thams cad la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is all-pervading because it focuses on all sentient beings in the three realms who are endowed with the three kinds of suffering.🔽The power of merit is all-virtuous.

original: kun du dge ba'i bsod nams stobs rnams dang // zhes bya ba la bsod nams ni sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa'i sems pa ste gtsang bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun du dge ba'i bsod nams stobs rnams dang // zhes bya ba la bsod nams ni sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa'i sems pa ste gtsang bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Merit is the volition of generosity, morality, etc., because it purifies.

original: de'i stobs ni chags pa la sogs bas zil gyis mi non pa dang / des zil gyis gnon nus pa'o //
analyzed: de'i stobs ni chags pa la sogs bas zil gyis mi non pa dang / des zil gyis gnon nus pa'o //
translated: Its power is the ability to overcome attachment, etc., and to be unoverpowered by them.

original: kun du dge ba zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba dang dngos gzhi dang mjug la sogs pa dang / chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i rnam pas kyang yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: kun du dge ba zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba dang dngos gzhi dang mjug la sogs pa dang / chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i rnam pas kyang yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: All-virtuous means that it is also purified by the aspects of small, middling, and great, such as the preparatory, the actual, and the subsequent.

original: chags pa med par gyur pa ye shes stobs //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chags pa med par gyur pa ye shes stobs // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The power of wisdom is non-attachment.

original: ye shes ni rnam bar rtog pa'i spros pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: ye shes ni rnam bar rtog pa'i spros pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: Wisdom has the characteristic of the pacification of all conceptual elaborations.

original: de yang chos bdag med pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de yang chos bdag med pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Moreover, it is the nature of the selflessness of phenomena.

original: de'i stobs ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma lus bar sel ba'o //
analyzed: de'i stobs ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma lus bar sel ba'o //
translated: Its strength is the complete removal of all adverse elements.

original: de yang 'jig rten 'ga' zhig la chags kyang srid snyam pa la /
analyzed: de yang 'jig rten 'ga' zhig la chags kyang srid snyam pa la /
translated: Moreover, it is possible that some in the world may be attached to it.

original: bye brag bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bye brag bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach its distinction, he says:

original: chags pa med par gyur pa'i zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: chags pa med par gyur pa'i zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: having become free from attachment.

original: thams cad du chags pa med cing thogs pa med pa skad cig gcig gis chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thams cad du chags pa med cing thogs pa med pa skad cig gcig gis chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is free from attachment and impediment everywhere, and has the characteristic of realizing the nature of all phenomena in a single moment.

original: shes rab thabs dang ting 'dzin stobs dag gis //
analyzed: shes rab thabs dang ting 'dzin stobs dag gis //
translated: By the power of wisdom, means, and samadhi,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: he says.

original: shes rab ni chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med ba la sogs pa'i bye brag chos rnams rab tu rnam par 'byed pas sems las byung ba'i chos gang gyi yongs su gcod pa de la shes rab ces bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med ba la sogs pa'i bye brag chos rnams rab tu rnam par 'byed pas sems las byung ba'i chos gang gyi yongs su gcod pa de la shes rab ces bya'o //
translated: Wisdom is the mental factor that thoroughly distinguishes phenomena, which thoroughly distinguishes phenomena with various distinctions such as being contaminated or uncontaminated. It is called wisdom because it thoroughly distinguishes.🔽Means is the mental factor that thoroughly distinguishes the methods for accomplishing one's own and others' goals. It is called means because it thoroughly distinguishes the methods for accomplishing one's own and others' goals.

original: de'i stobs kyis thams cad du thogs pa med par nus pa'o //
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis thams cad du thogs pa med par nus pa'o //
translated: By its power, one is able to do everything without obstruction.

original: thabs ni shes rab kyi bye brag nyid do //
analyzed: thabs ni shes rab kyi bye brag nyid do //
translated: Skill is the very same as wisdom.

original: 'dod pa'i don bsgrub par bya ba'i khyad par gyis mtshan nyid 'ga' zhig la thabs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don bsgrub par bya ba'i khyad par gyis mtshan nyid 'ga' zhig la thabs zhes bya'o //
translated: In some cases, it is called skill in regard to a certain characteristic, because of the special means for accomplishing the desired goal.

original: de'i stobs ni sgrub pa thams cad yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i stobs ni sgrub pa thams cad yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: Its power is the thorough knowledge of all the means of practice.

original: ting 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig pa ste /
analyzed: ting 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig pa ste /
translated: Concentration is the one-pointedness of mind.

original: 'dod pa la dmigs shing sems gzhan du mi 'pho'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa la dmigs shing sems gzhan du mi 'pho'o //
translated: It is the non-wandering of the mind to something else, while focused on the desired object.

original: de'i stobs ni dngos po mtha' yas pa yul du gyur pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i stobs ni dngos po mtha' yas pa yul du gyur pa nyid do //
translated: Its power is the very fact that infinite things become the object.

original: de lta bas na @222b ji skad smos pa'i yon tan mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis mi choms pa rnams kyi byang chub kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di ni stobs so //
analyzed: de lta bas na @222b ji skad smos pa'i yon tan mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis mi choms pa rnams kyi byang chub kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di ni stobs so //
translated: Therefore, the power is the completion of the stores of enlightenment of those whose qualities, as stated, cannot be overcome by adverse elements.

original: stobs bcu po mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis mi g-yo ba'i sa bstan to //
analyzed: stobs bcu po mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis mi g-yo ba'i sa bstan to //
translated: The ten powers have been taught in the stage that cannot be overcome by adverse elements.

original: don gyis na smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang bstan te /
analyzed: don gyis na smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang bstan te /
translated: By implication, the perfection of vows has also been taught.

original: smon lam gyi dbang gis de lta bu'i don 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smon lam gyi dbang gis de lta bu'i don 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because by the power of the vow, such an aim is accomplished.

original: de ltar stobs rnam pa bcu brjod nas mi mthun pa'i phyogs spang pa bstan pas 'grub pa bstan par bzhed nas /
analyzed: de ltar stobs rnam pa bcu brjod nas mi mthun pa'i phyogs spang pa bstan pas 'grub pa bstan par bzhed nas /
translated: Having thus described the ten powers, in order to demonstrate their accomplishment by teaching the abandonment of their resistances,

original: las kyi stobs rnams yongs su dag byed cing //
analyzed: las kyi stobs rnams yongs su dag byed cing //
translated: he says, Purifying the powers of karma,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and so on.

original: las kyi stobs ni las kyi stobs te chen po nyid kyi rnam par smin par nges pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi stobs ni las kyi stobs te chen po nyid kyi rnam par smin par nges pa'o //
translated: The power of karma is the power of karma, which is certain to evolve because of its greatness.

original: de yongs su dag par byed pa ni ngan song ba'i sdug bsngal las thams cad shin tu spang ba'o //
analyzed: de yongs su dag par byed pa ni ngan song ba'i sdug bsngal las thams cad shin tu spang ba'o //
translated: Purifying it is the complete abandonment of all the sufferings of the unfortunate realms.

original: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa ste /
translated: The afflictions are desire and so on,

original: lus dang sems kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus dang sems kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they afflict the body and mind.

original: de dag gi stobs ni chen po dang 'bring po'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag gi stobs ni chen po dang 'bring po'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Their power is of the nature of the great and middling.

original: de kun du 'joms par byed pa ni kun du mi spyod pa dang de'i bag chags kyang gcod pa'o //
analyzed: de kun du 'joms par byed pa ni kun du mi spyod pa dang de'i bag chags kyang gcod pa'o //
translated: Completely destroying them is the non-performance of them and the cutting off of their instincts.

original: bdud rnams ni phung po dang / 'chi bdag dang / lha'i bu rnams so //
analyzed: bdud rnams ni phung po dang / 'chi bdag dang / lha'i bu rnams so //
translated: The demons are the aggregates, death, and the sons of the gods.

original: de la phung po rnams kyis ni de la dmigs pa'i 'dod pa'i 'dod chags spangs pa'i phyir dang / ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin gnas pa'i phyir stobs med par byed pa ste yongs su sbyong ba'o //
analyzed: de la phung po rnams kyis ni de la dmigs pa'i 'dod pa'i 'dod chags spangs pa'i phyir dang / ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin gnas pa'i phyir stobs med par byed pa ste yongs su sbyong ba'o //
translated: With regard to them, the aggregates are rendered powerless, i.e., purified, because the bodhisattva has abandoned the passion of desire that has them as its object, and because he remains as he wishes.

original: 'chi bdag ni bsam gtan gyi stobs dang thabs kyis zin pas tshe btang nas kyang yang ji srid 'dod kyi bar du gnas pas byin gyis rlob pas stobs med par byed pa ste yongs su spyod ba'o //
analyzed: 'chi bdag ni bsam gtan gyi stobs dang thabs kyis zin pas tshe btang nas kyang yang ji srid 'dod kyi bar du gnas pas byin gyis rlob pas stobs med par byed pa ste yongs su spyod ba'o //
translated: Death is rendered powerless, i.e., purified, because the bodhisattva, by the power of his samadhi and skillful means, gives up his life and then lives again as long as he wishes.

original: lha'i bu'i bdud stobs dang bcas pa ni byams pa'i stobs kyis pham par byas te stobs med par byed pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i bu'i bdud stobs dang bcas pa ni byams pa'i stobs kyis pham par byas te stobs med par byed pa'o //
translated: The demon of the sons of the gods, together with his power, is rendered powerless, i.e., defeated, by the power of his love.

original: rnam pa'i 'dis byang chub sems dpa' chen po kun du bzang po spyod pas bsdus pa'i stobs rnam pa thams cad du yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba yin te //
analyzed: rnam pa'i 'dis byang chub sems dpa' chen po kun du bzang po spyod pas bsdus pa'i stobs rnam pa thams cad du yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba yin te //
translated: By this method, the bodhisattva should completely perfect the power included in the conduct of the Great Vehicle.

original: 'di ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong pa'i sgo nas gnyen po'i mtshan nyid kyi sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong pa'i sgo nas gnyen po'i mtshan nyid kyi sgrub pa yin no //
translated: This is the accomplishment of the definition of the counteragent through the abandonment of the adverse side.

original: 'dis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs mtha' dag zil gyis gnon pa dang kun du bzang po spyod pa'i stobs bla na med pa rnyed pa'i stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to /🔽de'i phyir 'di la bde bar gshegs pas blo gros legs pa'o zhes kun nas bsngags par 'os par yod pa'i @223a * //
analyzed: 'dis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs mtha' dag zil gyis gnon pa dang kun du bzang po spyod pa'i stobs bla na med pa rnyed pa'i stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to / de'i phyir 'di la bde bar gshegs pas blo gros legs pa'o zhes kun nas bsngags par 'os par yod pa'i @223a * //
translated: By this verse, the perfection of power is taught, since one obtains the power of the unexcelled strength of the practice of universal excellence through the subjugation of all the adverse side.

original: phyir sa legs pa'i blo gros kyang bstan to //
analyzed: phyir sa legs pa'i blo gros kyang bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is also taught that this stage is called Good Intellect, since it is worthy of universal praise, because of the presence of the good intellect of the Sugata.

original: da ni de ltar bsgrub pa dang ldan pa'i rang gi yon tan yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir /🔽zhing rnams rgya mtsho rnam par dag byed cing //
analyzed: da ni de ltar bsgrub pa dang ldan pa'i rang gi yon tan yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir / zhing rnams rgya mtsho rnam par dag byed cing //
translated: Now, in order to perfect one's own virtues through the possession of such accomplishment,🔽the two verses beginning with the line,🔽purifying the ocean of fields

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis las rnam pa brgyad gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis las rnam pa brgyad gsungs so //
translated: teach the eight kinds of actions.
