original: zhing gi khyad par snga ma gang dag rang gi mos pa'i shes pa mi gsal ba'i rnam pa can gyis rang gi sems kyi me long gi dkyil 'khor la gzugs brnyan gyi tshul du bkod pa de dag dang thogs pa med pa'i ye shes kyi stobs brnyes pa
analyzed: zhing gi khyad par snga ma gang dag rang gi mos pa'i shes pa mi gsal ba'i rnam pa can gyis rang gi sems kyi me long gi dkyil 'khor la gzugs brnyan gyi tshul du bkod pa de dag dang thogs pa med pa'i ye shes kyi stobs brnyes pa
translated: One attains the power of unobstructed gnosis in that very field.

original: de nyid la gsal bar byed pa ni rnam par dag par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid la gsal bar byed pa ni rnam par dag par byed pa ste /
translated: That which illuminates it is that which purifies it.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag la rang gi rgyud nyid kyi dbang gis ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag la rang gi rgyud nyid kyi dbang gis ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par dmigs pa yin no //
translated: It is the correct observation of one's own continuum and that of others.

original: zhing zhes bya ba ni gang las sems can gyi khams dpag tu med pa'i dge ba'i srog mi zad par byed pa sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i 'bru rnams 'khrungs pa ste /
analyzed: zhing zhes bya ba ni gang las sems can gyi khams dpag tu med pa'i dge ba'i srog mi zad par byed pa sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i 'bru rnams 'khrungs pa ste /
translated: The field is that from which the seeds of the buddhas and bodhisattvas are born, which make the life of virtue of the immeasurable realm of sentient beings inexhaustible.

original: de ni nga rgyal med pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyis 'byor pa /
analyzed: de ni nga rgyal med pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyis 'byor pa /
translated: It is endowed with the qualities of being without pride and so on.

original: snying rje dang byams pa'i zer gyis brlan pa /
analyzed: snying rje dang byams pa'i zer gyis brlan pa /
translated: It is moistened by the light rays of compassion and love.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sdong du ma dang / ba tsha la sogs pa'i nyes pa med pa dag go //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sdong du ma dang / ba tsha la sogs pa'i nyes pa med pa dag go //
translated: and the tree of the afflictions, and the faults of the salt-earth, etc.🔽

original: de ltar na bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi myu gu 'khrungs par nus pa'i phyir sems nyid sangs rgyas kyi zhing ste //
analyzed: de ltar na bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi myu gu 'khrungs par nus pa'i phyir sems nyid sangs rgyas kyi zhing ste //
translated: The mind is the field of the Buddha, because it is able to produce the sprout of unsurpassed Buddhahood.

original: 'bras bu la sogs pa'i zhing bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu la sogs pa'i zhing bzhin no //
translated: It is like the field of a fruit tree, etc.

original: rin po che la sogs pa'i yo byad kyi khyad par sna tshogs pa thun mong ma yin pa rgya che zhing rin che ba dang srid pa'i longs spyod kyi bye brag dang ldan pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa gnod pa thams cad bral ba rnams kyi tshogs ni
analyzed: rin po che la sogs pa'i yo byad kyi khyad par sna tshogs pa thun mong ma yin pa rgya che zhing rin che ba dang srid pa'i longs spyod kyi bye brag dang ldan pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa gnod pa thams cad bral ba rnams kyi tshogs ni
translated: The ocean is the collection of various uncommon, vast, and precious articles such as jewels, and of inconceivable varieties of worldly enjoyments, free from all harm.

original: rgya mtsho'o // gang na 'jig rten mtha' dag gi mig gcig tu gyur pa sangs rgyas kyi ye shes sna tshogs bsam gyis mi khyab cing rgya che ba ston pa'i sangs rgyas sras dang bcas pa khang pa brtsegs pa dang / skyed mos tshal dang /
analyzed: rgya mtsho'o // gang na 'jig rten mtha' dag gi mig gcig tu gyur pa sangs rgyas kyi ye shes sna tshogs bsam gyis mi khyab cing rgya che ba ston pa'i sangs rgyas sras dang bcas pa khang pa brtsegs pa dang / skyed mos tshal dang /
translated: The palace is the place where the inconceivable and vast wisdom of the Buddha, the eye of the entire world, and the Buddha and his Bodhisattva children, are revealed.

original: gzhal med khang dang rgyan dang / na bza' la sogs pa yo byad kyi khyad par rnam pa sna tshogs lha dang mi lam shin tu 'das pa rnams kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: gzhal med khang dang rgyan dang / na bza' la sogs pa yo byad kyi khyad par rnam pa sna tshogs lha dang mi lam shin tu 'das pa rnams kyis brgyan pa /
translated: They are adorned with various special articles, such as palaces, ornaments, clothing, and so forth, that are far beyond the human and divine realms.

original: 'jig rten mtha' dag las 'das pa'i skus 'dul ba'i mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du spyod lam gyis bzhugs pa rnams byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rnams na /
analyzed: 'jig rten mtha' dag las 'das pa'i skus 'dul ba'i mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du spyod lam gyis bzhugs pa rnams byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rnams na /
translated: They are seated in various postures, in accordance with the inclinations of those to be tamed, with bodies that transcend the entire world.

original: mdo sde zab cing rgya che ba ston pas longs spyod rdzogs par myong bar gyur pa dpag tu med pa rgya mtsho chen po'i chu'i rdul phra rab dang mnyam pa de dag @223b rang gi sems yongs su sbyong ba ste /
analyzed: mdo sde zab cing rgya che ba ston pas longs spyod rdzogs par myong bar gyur pa dpag tu med pa rgya mtsho chen po'i chu'i rdul phra rab dang mnyam pa de dag @223b rang gi sems yongs su sbyong ba ste /
translated: In the maṇḍalas of the retinue of great bodhisattvas, they teach the profound and vast sūtras, experiencing limitless saṃbhogakāya.

original: 'di ni zhing rgya mtsho rnam par dag byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhing rgya mtsho rnam par dag byed pa'o //
translated: This is the purification of the ocean of realms.

original: sems can rgya mtsho dag ni rnam par grol //🔽zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: sems can rgya mtsho dag ni rnam par grol // zhes bya ba la //
translated: The ocean of sentient beings is liberated.

original: 'khor ba la chags pa ni sems can te /
analyzed: 'khor ba la chags pa ni sems can te /
translated: In this verse, “sentient beings” refers to those attached to saṃsāra.

original: de dag bgrang ba las shin tu 'das pa ni rgya mtsho'o //
analyzed: de dag bgrang ba las shin tu 'das pa ni rgya mtsho'o //
translated: The oceans are beyond counting.

original: dus ji lta ba dang bskal pa ji lta ba bzhin du nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spong ba'i man nag gis nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba shin du mi bzad pa dam po gcod pa ni de dag rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: dus ji lta ba dang bskal pa ji lta ba bzhin du nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spong ba'i man nag gis nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba shin du mi bzad pa dam po gcod pa ni de dag rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: Liberation is the cutting of the extremely tight and unbearable fetters of afflictions by means of the wisdom that abandons the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience in accordance with time and in accordance with kalpas.

original: rang gi bdag nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir chos rnams te /
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir chos rnams te /
translated: Dharmas are so called because they hold their own natures.🔽The dharmakaya is the infinite, limitless, profound, vast, and extremely pure qualities of the buddhas and bodhisattvas, such as great compassion, the strengths, the fearlessnesses, and so on.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i rgyud la mnga' ba snying rje chen po dang stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa grangs med pa mtha' yas pa zab pa rgya che ba shin tu rnam par dag pa mthu che ba sems can gyi khams ma lus pa
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i rgyud la mnga' ba snying rje chen po dang stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa grangs med pa mtha' yas pa zab pa rgya che ba shin tu rnam par dag pa mthu che ba sems can gyi khams ma lus pa
translated: It benefits the entire realm of sentient beings,

original: la phan par byed pa sangs rgyas kyi byang chub thob par byed pa mchog tu mthar phyin pa ste /
analyzed: la phan par byed pa sangs rgyas kyi byang chub thob par byed pa mchog tu mthar phyin pa ste /
translated: it brings about the attainment of the enlightenment of the buddhas, and it is the supreme perfection.

original: rdul phra rab kyi grangs ji snyed pa de dag gi rgya mtsho ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' re re'i rgyud la mnga' ba'i tshogs so //
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi grangs ji snyed pa de dag gi rgya mtsho ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' re re'i rgyud la mnga' ba'i tshogs so //
translated: The ocean of particles of the accumulations of each Buddha and Bodhisattva is the ocean of particles of the accumulations of each Buddha and Bodhisattva.

original: de dag mthong bar byed pa ni rnam par mi rtogs pa'i ye shes kyi me mong gi dkyil 'khor la rab tu 'god pa'o //
analyzed: de dag mthong bar byed pa ni rnam par mi rtogs pa'i ye shes kyi me mong gi dkyil 'khor la rab tu 'god pa'o //
translated: The illumination of those is the placement of the mandala of the fire of nonconceptual wisdom.

original: ye shes ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bskal pa grangs med par bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: ye shes ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bskal pa grangs med par bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa dang ldan pa /
translated: The wisdom is the Bhagavan Buddhas who possess the accumulation of merit and wisdom gathered over countless eons.🔽The palace of the king of gods in Akanishtha, the excellent mansion, is the palace of the king of gods in Akanishtha, the excellent mansion.

original: 'og min pa rnams kyi nang na lha'i rgyal po'i gnas khang ba brtsegs pa shin tu bzang po na bzhugs pa rnams kyi bya dka' ba brgya stong gis rnam par sbyangs pa rnam pa bzhi po me long lta bu dang / mnyam pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'og min pa rnams kyi nang na lha'i rgyal po'i gnas khang ba brtsegs pa shin tu bzang po na bzhugs pa rnams kyi bya dka' ba brgya stong gis rnam par sbyangs pa rnam pa bzhi po me long lta bu dang / mnyam pa nyid dang /
translated: The four types of purification through hundreds of thousands of difficult deeds are the four types of purification through hundreds of thousands of difficult deeds.

original: so sor rtog pa dang / bya ba sgrub pa zhes bya ba 'khrul pa rnam pa sna tshogs dang bral ba dri ma med pa rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par gyi rtog pa'i dri ba ma lus pa zad par mdzad pa na skye ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa dang / bya ba sgrub pa zhes bya ba 'khrul pa rnam pa sna tshogs dang bral ba dri ma med pa rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par gyi rtog pa'i dri ba ma lus pa zad par mdzad pa na skye ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the birth of one who has eliminated all questions of conceptual thought, who is stainless, free from various errors, and who has the special vajra-like concentration.🔽It is realized through the power of a spiritual friend, by listening to the holy Dharma, by proper mental attention, and by the stages of meditation.

original: de ni sangs rgyas kyi rgyu tha dad pa dang / skad cig tha dad pas tha dad pa'i phyir rgya mtsho'i de rtogs par byed pa ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi stobs kyis dam pa'i chos mnyam pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang /🔽bsgom pa'i rim pas mngon sum du byed pa'o //
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas kyi rgyu tha dad pa dang / skad cig tha dad pas tha dad pa'i phyir rgya mtsho'i de rtogs par byed pa ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi stobs kyis dam pa'i chos mnyam pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang / bsgom pa'i rim pas mngon sum du byed pa'o //
translated: It is realized by the power of a spiritual friend, by listening to the holy Dharma, by proper mental attention, and by the stages of meditation.

original: spyod pa ni ma lus pa la mchod pa dang / phyag bya ba dang / sdig pa bshags pa dang / rjes su yi rang ba dang / bskul ba dang / gsol ba gdab pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba dang / sems can ma @224a * //
analyzed: spyod pa ni ma lus pa la mchod pa dang / phyag bya ba dang / sdig pa bshags pa dang / rjes su yi rang ba dang / bskul ba dang / gsol ba gdab pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba dang / sems can ma @224a * //
translated: The practice is the complete performance of the worship, obeisance, confession of evil, rejoicing, urging of the teachers, beseeching of the Buddhas not to pass into nirvāṇa, transference of merit, and the resolve for enlightenment.

original: lus pa la phan 'dogs pa dang / byang chub kyi sems la sogs pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sa yongs su rdzogs pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: lus pa la phan 'dogs pa dang / byang chub kyi sems la sogs pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sa yongs su rdzogs pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The remaining ones are the characteristics of benefiting others, the thought of enlightenment, etc., and the perfection, the complete fulfillment of the stages, etc.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / sa dang po la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis bsams pa tsam gyis skrag par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / sa dang po la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis bsams pa tsam gyis skrag par byed pa'o //
translated: It terrifies all the Sravakas, Pratyekabuddhas, and Bodhisattvas who are on the first stage, just by being thought of.

original: de rnam par dag par byed pa ni dngos po dang / dus dang / phyogs rnam par dbye ba dang / bsdu ba dang / rgyas par bya ba dang / gzhan la phan gdags pa dang / rang gi rgyud rnam par sbyang ba la sogs pa ji ltar bstan pa rnams snod dang /
analyzed: de rnam par dag par byed pa ni dngos po dang / dus dang / phyogs rnam par dbye ba dang / bsdu ba dang / rgyas par bya ba dang / gzhan la phan gdags pa dang / rang gi rgyud rnam par sbyang ba la sogs pa ji ltar bstan pa rnams snod dang /
translated: Its purification is the differentiation of things, time, and directions, the inclusion, the expansion, the benefitting of others, the purification of one's own stream of consciousness, etc., as they have been taught.

original: grangs kyi tshad dang / dus dang / yul rnam par dbye ba dang / yo byad rnam par dgod pa sprul pa la sogs pa'i bya ba'i khyad par mthar phyin pa rnams kyi mos pa'i stobs kyis sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: grangs kyi tshad dang / dus dang / yul rnam par dbye ba dang / yo byad rnam par dgod pa sprul pa la sogs pa'i bya ba'i khyad par mthar phyin pa rnams kyi mos pa'i stobs kyis sgrub pa'o //
translated: The power of aspiration is the accomplishment by the power of aspiration of the perfection of the various kinds of emanations, such as the measure of their number, the measure of their time, the measure of their place, and the measure of their articles.

original: smon lam ni shes rab kyi bye brag nyid do //
analyzed: smon lam ni shes rab kyi bye brag nyid do //
translated: Aspiration is a particular kind of wisdom.

original: bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs pa rnam pa du ma thabs dang bcas pa byang chub kyi mthar phyin par 'phro ba la sogs pa don du gnyer ba'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs pa rnam pa du ma thabs dang bcas pa byang chub kyi mthar phyin par 'phro ba la sogs pa don du gnyer ba'i rnam pa ste /
translated: It is the form of striving for the various kinds of benefit for self and others, together with the means, that extends to the end of enlightenment.

original: de yang byang chub sems dpa'i thams cad kyi so so'i khams dang / 'gro ba dang / skye gnas dang / rigs dang / rgyud dang / rus kyi bye brag gis tha dad pas mang ba'i phyir rgya mtsho zhes bya bar gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang byang chub sems dpa'i thams cad kyi so so'i khams dang / 'gro ba dang / skye gnas dang / rigs dang / rgyud dang / rus kyi bye brag gis tha dad pas mang ba'i phyir rgya mtsho zhes bya bar gyur ro //
translated: And since it is manifold because of the differences in the individual natures, migrations, birthplaces, castes, clans, and families of all bodhisattvas, it is called an ocean.

original: de ni dus mtha' yas par yongs su sbyang ba'i shes rab dang / thabs dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs dang / rnam par thar pa dang / bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi stobs kyis mthar byin pa ni yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de ni dus mtha' yas par yongs su sbyang ba'i shes rab dang / thabs dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs dang / rnam par thar pa dang / bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi stobs kyis mthar byin pa ni yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: It is perfected by the power of wisdom, means, samadhi, dharani, liberation, merit, and knowledge that are completely refined over limitless time.

original: sangs rgyas ni gang dag sems can gyi khams sdug bsngal ba la gzigs nas thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa'i thugs kyis phan ma btags pa la yang bye brag tu ma byas pa sems can gyi khams zad par sras kyi tshul du bdag gis mdzad nas de
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni gang dag sems can gyi khams sdug bsngal ba la gzigs nas thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa'i thugs kyis phan ma btags pa la yang bye brag tu ma byas pa sems can gyi khams zad par sras kyi tshul du bdag gis mdzad nas de
translated: The Buddha is the one who, seeing the suffering of the realm of sentient beings, with a mind of great compassion, without discriminating between those who have benefited him and those who have not, having taken the realm of sentient beings as his children,

original: bsgral ba'i phyir go cha chen po man bas te /
analyzed: bsgral ba'i phyir go cha chen po man bas te /
translated: puts on the great armor in order to liberate them.

original: 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho sdug bsngal nyam ba brgya stong du ma dang ldan pa brgal nas shes rab dang thabs kyi bye brag rnam pa sna tshogs kyis bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par mdzad de /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho sdug bsngal nyam ba brgya stong du ma dang ldan pa brgal nas shes rab dang thabs kyi bye brag rnam pa sna tshogs kyis bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par mdzad de /
translated: Having crossed over the ocean of cyclic existence, which is endowed with hundreds of thousands of sufferings, they have completed the accumulations of merit and wisdom through the various aspects of wisdom and method.

original: mi shes pa'i mun pa ma lus par bsal bas ye shes kyi nyi ma sa'i phug mtha' dag gi sgron ma gcig phur gyur pa shar bas ma rig pa'i gnyid dang bral te sangs pa'i phyir sangs rgyas nyid do //
analyzed: mi shes pa'i mun pa ma lus par bsal bas ye shes kyi nyi ma sa'i phug mtha' dag gi sgron ma gcig phur gyur pa shar bas ma rig pa'i gnyid dang bral te sangs pa'i phyir sangs rgyas nyid do //
translated: Because they have dispelled all the darkness of ignorance, the sun of wisdom has risen, the single lamp of the cave of the earth, and they are free from the sleep of ignorance and have awakened, and so they are buddhas.

original: de dag gi rgyud tha dad pa dang / dus tha @224b dad pas bgrang ba las 'das pa'i phyir rgya mtsho'o //
analyzed: de dag gi rgyud tha dad pa dang / dus tha @224b dad pas bgrang ba las 'das pa'i phyir rgya mtsho'o //
translated: Because their continua are different and because they are beyond enumeration in terms of time, they are an ocean.

original: mchod pa'i yo byad yul dang / dus dang dngos po dang / bkod pa khyad zhugs pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin grangs med pa'i mchod pa'i sprin rnams kyi nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor mtha' yas pa khyab par byas te /
analyzed: mchod pa'i yo byad yul dang / dus dang dngos po dang / bkod pa khyad zhugs pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin grangs med pa'i mchod pa'i sprin rnams kyi nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor mtha' yas pa khyab par byas te /
translated: The clouds of offerings, which have the nature of being endowed with all the special features of the objects of offering, the time, the things, and the arrangement, fill the entire realm of space.

original: de re re la yang dus mtha' yas pa shin tu brjod pa ni mchod pa'o //🔽bskal pa rgya mtshor mi skyo spyad par bgyi //
analyzed: de re re la yang dus mtha' yas pa shin tu brjod pa ni mchod pa'o // bskal pa rgya mtshor mi skyo spyad par bgyi //
translated: And each of them is offered for an infinite time.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should practice without discouragement for oceans of eons.

original: bskal pa zhes bya ba ni bar gyi bskal pa la sogs pa rnam pa mang ste /
analyzed: bskal pa zhes bya ba ni bar gyi bskal pa la sogs pa rnam pa mang ste /
translated: An eon has many types, such as an intermediate eon.

original: de la bskal pa dang po ba mi'i tshe dpag tu med pa nas bzung ste rim gyis mi'i tshe lo bcu'i bar du gyur pa de ni mar 'grib ba zhes bya ba bar gyi bskal pa gcig go //
analyzed: de la bskal pa dang po ba mi'i tshe dpag tu med pa nas bzung ste rim gyis mi'i tshe lo bcu'i bar du gyur pa de ni mar 'grib ba zhes bya ba bar gyi bskal pa gcig go //
translated: The first eon is from the time when the human life span was immeasurable until it has decreased to ten years; this is one intermediate eon of decrease.

original: de nas yang tshe lo brgyad khri bar gyur la 'grib pa'i rim gyis tshe lo bcu bar gyur pa'i bar 'di ni yar skye ba dang mar 'grib pa zhes bya ba bar gyi bskal pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de nas yang tshe lo brgyad khri bar gyur la 'grib pa'i rim gyis tshe lo bcu bar gyur pa'i bar 'di ni yar skye ba dang mar 'grib pa zhes bya ba bar gyi bskal pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: Then, the period when the life expectancy increases from ten years to eighty thousand years and decreases from eighty thousand years to ten years is the second intermediate eon of the world called increase and decrease.

original: de lta bu bco brgyad kyi tha mar yar skye ba zhes bya ba gcig dang / dang po mar 'grib pa zhes bya ba dang / bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur ni 'jig rten 'chags so //
analyzed: de lta bu bco brgyad kyi tha mar yar skye ba zhes bya ba gcig dang / dang po mar 'grib pa zhes bya ba dang / bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur ni 'jig rten 'chags so //
translated: At the end of these eighteen, there is one intermediate eon called increase, one called decrease, and twenty intermediate eons of creation.🔽For twenty intermediate eons, the world is in the process of creation.

original: bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur ni 'chags nas gnas so //🔽bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur ni 'jig rten 'jig go //
analyzed: bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur ni 'chags nas gnas so // bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur ni 'jig rten 'jig go //
translated: For twenty intermediate eons, the world stays created.🔽For twenty intermediate eons, the world is in the process of destruction.

original: bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur ni zhig nas 'dug go //
analyzed: bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur ni zhig nas 'dug go //
translated: For twenty intermediate eons, the world stays destroyed.

original: bar gyi bskal pa de lta bu brgyad cu la bskal pa chen po gcig go //
analyzed: bar gyi bskal pa de lta bu brgyad cu la bskal pa chen po gcig go //
translated: Eighty of these intermediate eons make one great eon.

original: 'di ni bskal pa chen po zhes bya ste de dag bgrang ba la las 'das pa ni rgya mtsho'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bskal pa chen po zhes bya ste de dag bgrang ba la las 'das pa ni rgya mtsho'o //
translated: The period of time that is beyond the calculation of the eons is called a great eon.

original: gzhan gyi don 'ba' zhig bsgrubs pa'i phyir der zhugs pa sems can gyi don sgrub par byed pa ro gcig pa gnyen po'i mchog thob pa rnams 'gro ba'i don spyad pa bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don 'ba' zhig bsgrubs pa'i phyir der zhugs pa sems can gyi don sgrub par byed pa ro gcig pa gnyen po'i mchog thob pa rnams 'gro ba'i don spyad pa bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: Those who have entered it for the sole purpose of accomplishing the aims of others, who are engaged in accomplishing the aims of sentient beings, who have attained the highest antidote, who are of one taste, who are engaged in accomplishing the aims of beings,

original: sdug bsngal du ma'i skye mched 'khor ba'i brtson ra na dus ring por yang gnas shing sems can dmyal ba la sogs par yang gnas pa ni spyad pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal du ma'i skye mched 'khor ba'i brtson ra na dus ring por yang gnas shing sems can dmyal ba la sogs par yang gnas pa ni spyad pa'o //
translated: who remain for a long time in the prison of cyclic existence, the source of many sufferings, who remain even in the hells and so on, are engaged in practice.

original: der yang de la phan gdags pa'i bsam pa la zhugs pa gnod pa ma byas pa'i dgra bo gzhan dag gis gtses pa rnams lag pa dang rkang pa dang rna ba dang sna la sogs pa gcod cing srog la 'bebs pa'i rang bzhin can rnams dang /
analyzed: der yang de la phan gdags pa'i bsam pa la zhugs pa gnod pa ma byas pa'i dgra bo gzhan dag gis gtses pa rnams lag pa dang rkang pa dang rna ba dang sna la sogs pa gcod cing srog la 'bebs pa'i rang bzhin can rnams dang /
translated: Even there, those who are engaged in the intention to benefit them, who are harmed by other enemies who do not do harm, who are of the nature of cutting off hands, feet, ears, noses, and so on, and who take life,

original: phyi rol gyi 'tshe ba rnam pa mtha' yas pa grang ba dang rlung dang tsha ba la sogs pas yun ring du rgyun mi 'chad par gnod pa dag gis kyang sgyid lug par mi 'gyur ba ni mi skyo ba'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi 'tshe ba rnam pa mtha' yas pa grang ba dang rlung dang tsha ba la sogs pas yun ring du rgyun mi 'chad par gnod pa dag gis kyang sgyid lug par mi 'gyur ba ni mi skyo ba'o //
translated: One does not become discouraged by the endless external harms, such as cold, wind, heat, etc., which last a long time and are uninterrupted.

original: 'di ni las rnam par brgyad de /🔽de ltar las rnam pa brgyad kyis bsod @225a * //
analyzed: 'di ni las rnam par brgyad de / de ltar las rnam pa brgyad kyis bsod @225a * //
translated: This is the eightfold activity.

original: nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su sbyangs nas /
analyzed: nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su sbyangs nas /
translated: Thus, having purified the accumulations of merit and knowledge by means of these eight activities,

original: da ni rgyu'i gnas skabs kyis bsdus pa'i yon tan thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /🔽gang yang dus gsum gshegs pa rgyal ba yi //
analyzed: da ni rgyu'i gnas skabs kyis bsdus pa'i yon tan thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba bstan pa'i phyir / gang yang dus gsum gshegs pa rgyal ba yi //
translated: now, in order to demonstrate the perfection of all the virtues included in the causal state,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, “Whatever the Victors of the three times have known as virtues,” and so on.

original: dus gsum ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba dag ces bya ste /
analyzed: dus gsum ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba dag ces bya ste /
translated: The three times are called past, future, and present.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po dag nyid mi rtag pas 'joms pa'i phyir dus yin gyis /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po dag nyid mi rtag pas 'joms pa'i phyir dus yin gyis /
translated: The aggregates of form, etc., are called time because they are destroyed by impermanence.

original: phyi rol pa rnams kyi ltar phung po la ma gtogs pa'i dus ni med do //🔽de dag las kyang 'das pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum du tha dad do //
analyzed: phyi rol pa rnams kyi ltar phung po la ma gtogs pa'i dus ni med do // de dag las kyang 'das pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum du tha dad do //
translated: Time does not exist apart from the aggregates, as the non-Buddhists believe.🔽It is differentiated as past, etc., from the point of view of the aggregates.

original: der gshegs pa ni de'i bdag nyid du bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: der gshegs pa ni de'i bdag nyid du bzhugs pa'o //
translated: The Buddhas have gone there, i.e., to the reality of the three times.

original: bdud bzhi las rgyal ba'i phyir rgyal ba ste dus gsum du gshegs pa'i rgyal ba de dag go //
analyzed: bdud bzhi las rgyal ba'i phyir rgyal ba ste dus gsum du gshegs pa'i rgyal ba de dag go //
translated: The Victors are the Buddhas, because they have conquered the four demons.

original: byang chub kyi phyir spyod pa ni byang chub spyod pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyir spyod pa ni byang chub spyod pa'o //
translated: The practice for enlightenment is the practice of enlightenment.

original: de la smon lam gyi bye brag ni yon tan thob pa bla na med pa dpag tu med pa grangs med pa gting dang pha rol mi dpog pa don du gnyer ba'i bye brag rnams te /
analyzed: de la smon lam gyi bye brag ni yon tan thob pa bla na med pa dpag tu med pa grangs med pa gting dang pha rol mi dpog pa don du gnyer ba'i bye brag rnams te /
translated: The various vows are the various aims of the unfathomable, immeasurable, innumerable, and limitless excellences of attainment.

original: de dag thams cad bdag gis bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs grangs med pa yongs su bzung ste /
analyzed: de dag thams cad bdag gis bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs grangs med pa yongs su bzung ste /
translated: I will take up all of them by means of the immeasurable collections of merit and knowledge.

original: kun du bzang po'i dkyil 'khor yongs su dag pas yongs su bskang zhing yongs su kun nas rdzogs par bsgrubs te /
analyzed: kun du bzang po'i dkyil 'khor yongs su dag pas yongs su bskang zhing yongs su kun nas rdzogs par bsgrubs te /
translated: I will fully accomplish and complete the pure mandala of Samantabhadra.

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnam par 'tshang rgya bar bya /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnam par 'tshang rgya bar bya /
translated: I will fully awaken to the omniscient wisdom of unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: rtogs par bya /
analyzed: rtogs par bya /
translated: I will realize it.🔽I will actualize it.

original: mngon sum du bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / de ltar rgyu'i gnas skabs kyis bsdus pa'i yon tan thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba brjod nas /
analyzed: mngon sum du bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / de ltar rgyu'i gnas skabs kyis bsdus pa'i yon tan thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba brjod nas /
translated: Having thus described the complete perfection of all the qualities included in the causal phase,🔽in order to take up the accumulations of merit and wisdom in a very extensive way,

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs ji ltar blangs pa shin tu rgyas par bya ba'i phyir da ni byang chub sems dpa'i rjes su slob par yongs su bsngo ba /🔽rgyal ba kun gyi sras kyi thub bo pa //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs ji ltar blangs pa shin tu rgyas par bya ba'i phyir da ni byang chub sems dpa'i rjes su slob par yongs su bsngo ba / rgyal ba kun gyi sras kyi thub bo pa //
translated: now, in order to dedicate the training in the bodhisattva deeds,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis ston to //
translated: the following three verses are taught, beginning with:🔽The son of all the conquerors, the most capable one,

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' ni bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo gzhan dag las 'dod chen pa dang / 'dod chen pa ma yin pa rnam pa gnyis bstan te /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' ni bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo gzhan dag las 'dod chen pa dang / 'dod chen pa ma yin pa rnam pa gnyis bstan te /
translated: The Bodhisattva is taught by the Lord in other sutras to be of two kinds: the one with great desire and the one without great desire.

original: 'dod chen pa ni gang dag byang chub tu sems bskyed nas mthar gyis tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byas te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya zhing mngon @225b par sangs rgyas nas kyang sems can gyi don du
analyzed: 'dod chen pa ni gang dag byang chub tu sems bskyed nas mthar gyis tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byas te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya zhing mngon @225b par sangs rgyas nas kyang sems can gyi don du
translated: The one with great desire is the one who, having generated the Thought of Enlightenment, perfects the collections in due order, and fully awakens to unsurpassed, right, complete enlightenment. Having fully awakened, he remains for the sake of sentient beings

original: sems can gyi khams ji srid du bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams ji srid du bzhugs pa'o //
translated: for as long as the realm of sentient beings exists.

original: 'dod chen pa ma yin pa ni gang dag sems can gcig 'khor ba las ma grol gyi bar du yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi bya'i /
analyzed: 'dod chen pa ma yin pa ni gang dag sems can gcig 'khor ba las ma grol gyi bar du yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi bya'i /
translated: The one without great desire is the one who, until a single sentient being is not liberated from cyclic existence, does not fully awaken to unsurpassed, right, complete enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas nyid na sems can gyi don byed cing 'dug go //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas nyid na sems can gyi don byed cing 'dug go //
translated: He remains in the state of a Bodhisattva, and works for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: zhes smon lam de skad btab pa ste /
analyzed: zhes smon lam de skad btab pa ste /
translated: Thus he made this aspiration.

original: de dag ni tshogs yongs su rdzogs kyang dam bcas pa yongs su ma rdzogs pas mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya mi rgya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni tshogs yongs su rdzogs kyang dam bcas pa yongs su ma rdzogs pas mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya mi rgya'o //
translated: Even though they have completed the accumulations, they do not fully awaken to highest genuine full Awakening, because their vows are not yet complete.

original: de dag gi nang na byang chub sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa kun du bzang po ni thu bo ste /
analyzed: de dag gi nang na byang chub sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa kun du bzang po ni thu bo ste /
translated: Among them, the bodhisattva great being Ārya Samantabhadra is the eldest,

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad pas sngar byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad pas sngar byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i phyir ro /
translated: because he generated the Awakening Mind earlier than all the other bodhisattvas.

original: snga ma rnams kyi nang na ni 'phags pa byams pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma rnams kyi nang na ni 'phags pa byams pa'o //
translated: Among the earlier ones, it is Ārya Maitreya.

original: de la chos kyi sku'i rgyu mthun pa las skyes pa'i phyir de ni rgyal ba thams cad kyi sras so //
analyzed: de la chos kyi sku'i rgyu mthun pa las skyes pa'i phyir de ni rgyal ba thams cad kyi sras so //
translated: Because he is born from the cause of the Dharma Body, he is the son of all the Victors.

original: gang gi ming ni kun du bzang zhes bya /
analyzed: gang gi ming ni kun du bzang zhes bya /
translated: His name is Samantabhadra,

original: zhes bya ba ni gang gi ming sangs rgyas kyi zhing tha dad pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rnams su rnam pa thams cad bzang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang gi ming sangs rgyas kyi zhing tha dad pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rnams su rnam pa thams cad bzang ba'i phyir /
translated: whose name is Samantabhadra, because in all the buddha-fields, in the circles of assemblies, he is good in every way.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis kun du bzang po kun du bzang po zhes bsgrags pa'o mkhas pa de dang zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis gsungs pa theg pa chen po bla na med pa dpag tu med pa rnam pa thams cad par nyan
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis kun du bzang po kun du bzang po zhes bsgrags pa'o mkhas pa de dang zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis gsungs pa theg pa chen po bla na med pa dpag tu med pa rnam pa thams cad par nyan
translated: All the buddhas proclaim him as Samantabhadra, Samantabhadra.

original: pa dang len pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / 'chad pa dang / rnam par 'byed pa'i phyir mkhas pas mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa dang len pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / 'chad pa dang / rnam par 'byed pa'i phyir mkhas pas mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The one who is wise is so called because he listens to, takes up, upholds, explains, and analyzes the unsurpassed, immeasurable, and complete Great Vehicle taught by all the tathagatas.

original: bdag gi lus dang ngag dang yid rnams kyi spyod pa'i khyad par mtha' yas mu med pa dag gis mthun pa'i yon tan grub pa byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i dkyil 'khor chen po yongs su sbyong ba 'di yang mkhas pa de'i spyod pa dang mthun par yongs
analyzed: bdag gi lus dang ngag dang yid rnams kyi spyod pa'i khyad par mtha' yas mu med pa dag gis mthun pa'i yon tan grub pa byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i dkyil 'khor chen po yongs su sbyong ba 'di yang mkhas pa de'i spyod pa dang mthun par yongs
translated: With the infinite and boundless distinctions in the conduct of his body, speech, and mind, he dedicates this purification of the great mandala of bodhisattva conduct, which is the accomplishment of the qualities that accord with it,

original: su bsngo zhing de'i 'bras bu thob par bya bar mngon sum du byas te /
analyzed: su bsngo zhing de'i 'bras bu thob par bya bar mngon sum du byas te /
translated: to the attainment of the result of that conduct.

original: ji ltar de'i bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ye shes kyi tshogs mtha' yas pa ltar bdag gi yang de bzhin du shog cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽de ltar bye brag med pa de'i spyod pa dang mthun par yongs sus bsngo ba brjod nas /
analyzed: ji ltar de'i bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ye shes kyi tshogs mtha' yas pa ltar bdag gi yang de bzhin du shog cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go // de ltar bye brag med pa de'i spyod pa dang mthun par yongs sus bsngo ba brjod nas /
translated: Thus he dedicates the merit in such a way that it is equal to the conduct of the Bodhisattvas.

original: da ni rnam par dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: da ni rnam par dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: Now, in order to teach the divisions of the perfection of generosity, he says:🔽The perfection of generosity is the dedication of the pure body,

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyang rnam dag cing //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽de la lus rnam par dag pa ni gang gdul bya'i skye bo @226a * //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyang rnam dag cing // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // de la lus rnam par dag pa ni gang gdul bya'i skye bo @226a * //
translated: speech, and mind.🔽Therein, the purity of body is that, in accordance with the beings to be trained, he manifests himself in such and such a form, and in each atom he manifests bodies as numerous as the atoms in all buddha-fields.

original: la ltos nas de dang der de lta de lta bu'i gzugs de ston pa dang / rdul phra rab kyi rdul re re la yang lus sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi rdul phra rab kyi rdul snyed kyi bye ba bgrang du med pa nye bar ston pa dang /
analyzed: la ltos nas de dang der de lta de lta bu'i gzugs de ston pa dang / rdul phra rab kyi rdul re re la yang lus sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi rdul phra rab kyi rdul snyed kyi bye ba bgrang du med pa nye bar ston pa dang /
translated: The purity of speech is that, in each of those bodies, he manifests as many tongues as there are atoms in all buddha-fields, and with each of those tongues he pronounces as many voices as there are atoms in all buddha-fields, and with each of those voices he preaches as many Dharmas as there are atoms in all buddha-fields.

original: lus gcig gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad rgyas par 'gengs par ston pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi zhabs drung nas ma g-yos par ston pa la sogs pa yon tan rin po che mtha' yas pas yongs su zin pa ni lus rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: lus gcig gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad rgyas par 'gengs par ston pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi zhabs drung nas ma g-yos par ston pa la sogs pa yon tan rin po che mtha' yas pas yongs su zin pa ni lus rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The purity of body is the possession of infinite precious qualities, such as the ability to display the filling of all buddha-fields with a single body, and the ability to display the presence at the feet of all buddhas without moving from any buddha-field.

original: ngag rnam par dag pa ni dbyangs kyi dkyil 'khor gcig la skad thams cad ston pa ste /
analyzed: ngag rnam par dag pa ni dbyangs kyi dkyil 'khor gcig la skad thams cad ston pa ste /
translated: The purity of speech is the ability to display all languages in a single circle of sound.🔽The purity of mind is the ability to display all objects of knowledge in a single instant of cognition.

original: sgra kun du ston pa la sogs pa yon tan grangs med pa'i tshogs dang ldan pa ni dag rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: sgra kun du ston pa la sogs pa yon tan grangs med pa'i tshogs dang ldan pa ni dag rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The purity of qualities is the possession of an infinite collection of qualities, such as the ability to display all sounds in a single sound.🔽The purity of activity is the ability to display all activities in a single activity.

original: yid rnam par dag pa ni skad cig skad cig la spyod pa'i 'khor ma lus pa mngon sum byed pa dang / phyogs bcu ma lus pa dang dus thams cad du bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad mngon sum du byed pa dang chos so so mtha' yas pa dpag tu med pa dag mngon sum du byed pa la sogs pa yon tan gyi tshogs dpag tu med pa dang ldan
analyzed: yid rnam par dag pa ni skad cig skad cig la spyod pa'i 'khor ma lus pa mngon sum byed pa dang / phyogs bcu ma lus pa dang dus thams cad du bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad mngon sum du byed pa dang chos so so mtha' yas pa dpag tu med pa dag mngon sum du byed pa la sogs pa yon tan gyi tshogs dpag tu med pa dang ldan
translated: The purity of mind is endowed with an immeasurable collection of good qualities, such as the direct perception of all the retinues of conduct in each instant, the direct perception of all the Buddhas who dwell in all the ten directions and all times, the direct perception of the immeasurable and infinite Dharmas, and so forth.

original: pa ni yid rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: pa ni yid rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: This is the purity of mind.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid rnam par dag pa 'dis spyod pa rnam par dag par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid rnam par dag pa 'dis spyod pa rnam par dag par 'gyur bas /
translated: Since conduct is purified by the purity of body, speech, and mind,

original: spyod pa rnam dag ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: spyod pa rnam dag ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: the purity of conduct is explained.

original: kun du bzang po'i spyod pa ji ltar brtsams pa pha rol tu phyin pa dang bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnam par dag pa ni spyod pa rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: kun du bzang po'i spyod pa ji ltar brtsams pa pha rol tu phyin pa dang bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnam par dag pa ni spyod pa rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The purity of conduct is the purity of the perfections, the concentrations, the meditative stabilizations, and the meditative absorptions, just as they are begun in the conduct of Samantabhadra.

original: de ltar lus dang ngag dang yid yongs su dag pas spyod pa yongs su dag pa 'ba' zhig tu zad dam zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar lus dang ngag dang yid yongs su dag pas spyod pa yongs su dag pa 'ba' zhig tu zad dam zhe na /
translated: Thus, is it that by means of the purity of body, speech, and mind, there is only the purity of conduct?

original: zhing rnam par dag par yang 'gyur bas /
analyzed: zhing rnam par dag par yang 'gyur bas /
translated: No, there is also the purity of the field.

original: zhing rnams yongs dag dang zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhing rnams yongs dag dang zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it says, “and the complete purity of the field.”🔽By means of the purity of body, in the buddha-fields, one displays the various, excellent, vast colors and shapes of the buddhas and bodhisattvas, and those that are beyond the gods and humans.

original: de la lus rnam par dag pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams su sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi kha dog dang dbyibs sna tshogs dam pa rgya che ba dang / lha dang mi las 'das pa dag ston pa dang / dag rnam par dag pas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rnams su man ngag phyin ci ma log pa zab cing rgya che ba mtha' med pa sgrogs pa dang /
analyzed: de la lus rnam par dag pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams su sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi kha dog dang dbyibs sna tshogs dam pa rgya che ba dang / lha dang mi las 'das pa dag ston pa dang / dag rnam par dag pas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rnams su man ngag phyin ci ma log pa zab cing rgya che ba mtha' med pa sgrogs pa dang /
translated: By means of the purity of speech, in the circles of the assemblies of the buddhas, bodhisattvas, etc., one proclaims the profound and vast, limitless, unerring instructions.

original: yid rnam par dag pas snod kyi 'jig rten tha gru che zhing dbyibs mnyam pa /
analyzed: yid rnam par dag pas snod kyi 'jig rten tha gru che zhing dbyibs mnyam pa /
translated: By means of the purity of mind, the world-receptacle is vast and of even shape.

original: rin po che'i dpag bsam gyi shing brgya stong du mas rnam par mdzes par byas pa /
analyzed: rin po che'i dpag bsam gyi shing brgya stong du mas rnam par mdzes par byas pa /
translated: It is adorned with hundreds of thousands of jeweled wish-fulfilling trees.

original: nags tshal dang skyed mos tshal dang khri @226b stan la sogs pa sna tshogs du mas khyab par ston pa ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: nags tshal dang skyed mos tshal dang khri @226b stan la sogs pa sna tshogs du mas khyab par ston pa ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: It is filled with various forests, parks, thrones, etc. This is the complete purification of the Buddha-land.

original: 'di ni yongs su dag pa rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: 'di ni yongs su dag pa rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: This is the fivefold complete purification.

original: de'i don du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bcom ldan 'das kun du bzang po mkhas pa gsal ba de'i yongs su bsngo ba ci 'dra bar gyur pa ltar bdag gi bsngo ba'ang rnam pa lnga yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir de 'dra bar gyur
analyzed: de'i don du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bcom ldan 'das kun du bzang po mkhas pa gsal ba de'i yongs su bsngo ba ci 'dra bar gyur pa ltar bdag gi bsngo ba'ang rnam pa lnga yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir de 'dra bar gyur
translated: For that purpose, just as the dedication of the Blessed One Samantabhadra, the great bodhisattva, the wise and clear one, is, may my dedication be like that, for the sake of the fivefold complete purification.

original: cig ces bdag kyang de dang mtshungs par shog ces bya ba 'dis ston to //
analyzed: cig ces bdag kyang de dang mtshungs par shog ces bya ba 'dis ston to //
translated: By this may I also be like that is shown.

original: bdag ces bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The I is from the point of view of oneself.

original: de dang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po kun du bzang po dang ngo //
analyzed: de dang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po kun du bzang po dang ngo //
translated: The that is the great bodhisattva Samantabhadra.

original: mtshungs par zhes bya ba ni bye brag med par ro //
analyzed: mtshungs par zhes bya ba ni bye brag med par ro //
translated: “Similarly” means without distinction.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun du bzang po'i spyod pa dang mthun pa dang / de'i bsngo ba dang mthun pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun du bzang po'i spyod pa dang mthun pa dang / de'i bsngo ba dang mthun pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the conduct that accords with the bodhisattva mahāsattva Samantabhadra and the dedication that accords with that,

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa 'jam dpal zab cing rgya che ba'i thugs dang ldan pa'i spyod yul yang yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /🔽kun nas dge ba bzang po spyad pa'i phyir //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa 'jam dpal zab cing rgya che ba'i thugs dang ldan pa'i spyod yul yang yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir / kun nas dge ba bzang po spyad pa'i phyir //
translated: in order to teach that one should also perfect the domain of the bodhisattva mahāsattva Ārya Mañjuśrī, who possesses a profound and vast mind,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said, “In order to practice completely virtuous goodness…” and so forth.

original: rnam pa thams cad du mdzes pa dang rang bzhin gyis rgyud rnam par dag pa'i phyir dge ba ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du mdzes pa dang rang bzhin gyis rgyud rnam par dag pa'i phyir dge ba ste /
translated: Virtuous means beautiful in every way and naturally pure.

original: kun du bzang po'i spyod pa kun du dge ba mchog tu yid 'phrog pa mchog tu mdzes pa des 'di'i sku 'jam zhing mdangs sdug pa bla na med pa'i phyir sangs rgyas thams cad kyis mtshan 'jam dpal zhes bya bar bstan to //
analyzed: kun du bzang po'i spyod pa kun du dge ba mchog tu yid 'phrog pa mchog tu mdzes pa des 'di'i sku 'jam zhing mdangs sdug pa bla na med pa'i phyir sangs rgyas thams cad kyis mtshan 'jam dpal zhes bya bar bstan to //
translated: Because of that, his body is soft and his radiance is supremely beautiful, and therefore he is called Mañjuśrī, “Gentle Splendor,” by all the buddhas.

original: de'i smon lam ni gang sems can gyi khams mtha' yas pa byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa dang / spyod pa rab 'byams yongs su spyod du gzhug pa dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la dgod pa don du gnyer ba ste smon lam bzang po de lta bu spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i smon lam ni gang sems can gyi khams mtha' yas pa byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa dang / spyod pa rab 'byams yongs su spyod du gzhug pa dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la dgod pa don du gnyer ba ste smon lam bzang po de lta bu spyad par bya'o //
translated: His aspiration is to strive for the benefit of the infinite realm of sentient beings, to cause them to generate the thought of awakening, to engage in the conduct of the bodhisattva, and to establish them in perfect awakening.

original: dus ji srid gcig gi bar du snyam pa la /🔽ma 'ongs bskal pa kun du zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: dus ji srid gcig gi bar du snyam pa la / ma 'ongs bskal pa kun du zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: For how long a period of time?🔽The text says, “throughout all future kalpas.”

original: ma 'ongs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i bskal pa mtha' yas pa kun du'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i bskal pa mtha' yas pa kun du'o //
translated: “Future” means that which will occur in the future, throughout all the infinite kalpas.

original: de yang skad cig re re la rab tu dga' ba'i bye brag khyad zhugs pa thob nas cung zad kyang mi skyo bar te lus dang sems mi skyo bar zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de yang skad cig re re la rab tu dga' ba'i bye brag khyad zhugs pa thob nas cung zad kyang mi skyo bar te lus dang sems mi skyo bar zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Moreover, in every moment, having attained a special distinction of the Joyful, one is not at all discouraged, i.e., one is not discouraged in body and mind, is what is meant.

original: pha rol mi dpog pa'i smon lam de lta bu brtsams na 'ga' zhig bar mdor ldog par 'gyur yang srid snyam pa la bye brag bstan pa'i phyir /🔽bya ba de kun ma lus rdzogs par bgyi //
analyzed: pha rol mi dpog pa'i smon lam de lta bu brtsams na 'ga' zhig bar mdor ldog par 'gyur yang srid snyam pa la bye brag bstan pa'i phyir / bya ba de kun ma lus rdzogs par bgyi //
translated: If one undertakes such a vow not to measure the other side, one might think that one might turn back in the middle. In order to teach the distinction,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te @227a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te @227a * //
translated: he says, I will complete all those actions without exception.

original: ji ltar 'dod pa'i smon lam gyi bya ba de rdzogs par bya bas 'grub par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa'i smon lam gyi bya ba de rdzogs par bya bas 'grub par bya'o //
translated: One should accomplish it by completing that action of the vow as one wishes.

original: kun zhes bya ba ni ji skad bstan pa rnams so //
analyzed: kun zhes bya ba ni ji skad bstan pa rnams so //
translated: All means as they are taught.

original: ma lus pa ni rdul phra rab tsam yang ma lus par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ma lus pa ni rdul phra rab tsam yang ma lus par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Without exception means not even an atom remains, is what is meant.

original: de ltar las rnam par dag pa de brgyad dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rjes su slob par yongs su bsngos pa 'dis ni ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan te /
analyzed: de ltar las rnam par dag pa de brgyad dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rjes su slob par yongs su bsngos pa 'dis ni ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan te /
translated: By these eight kinds of pure action and by the dedication to the training of the bodhisattvas, the perfection of wisdom is taught.

original: sa'i mtha'i ye shes khyad par du 'phags pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa'i mtha'i ye shes khyad par du 'phags pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the attainment of the special, ultimate wisdom of the stages.

original: nam mkha' ltar mtha' yas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams su 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor dag gi nang du ci rigs bar chos chen po'i chu'i rgyun gyi char cig car 'bebs bas chos kyi sprin kyang bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' ltar mtha' yas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams su 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor dag gi nang du ci rigs bar chos chen po'i chu'i rgyun gyi char cig car 'bebs bas chos kyi sprin kyang bstan pa yin no //
translated: And by the simultaneous rain of the great Dharma falling in the circles of the retinue in the buddha-fields which are infinite like space, the Cloud of Dharma is taught.

original: de ltar ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis sa bcu rnams su bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rgyas par byas nas rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin brnyes te sgrib pa'i rgyun ma lus pa yongs su zad nas sa bcu gcig pa sangs rgyas kyis kun du
analyzed: de ltar ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis sa bcu rnams su bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rgyas par byas nas rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin brnyes te sgrib pa'i rgyun ma lus pa yongs su zad nas sa bcu gcig pa sangs rgyas kyis kun du
translated: Thus, by the method as it has been explained, having expanded the accumulations of merit and wisdom in the ten stages, having attained the vajra-like concentration, having completely exhausted the stream of obscurations, on the eleventh stage, the stage of the Buddha, the knowledge of all modes is attained.

original: 'od la phyir zhing bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dpag tu med cing zad mi shes par mdzad pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis go rims bzhin du yongs su bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'od la phyir zhing bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dpag tu med cing zad mi shes par mdzad pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis go rims bzhin du yongs su bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Two verses on the light of the bodhisattvas' accumulation of merit and knowledge, which is immeasurable and inexhaustible.

original: spyod pa dag ni tshad yod ma gyur cig / ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yongs su bsngo ba rjes su bsgrub pas spyod pa'i rlabs ni 'di tsam zhig go //🔽dus ni 'di srid cig tu'o //🔽don rnams kyi rnam par dag pa ni 'di tsam zhig go //
analyzed: spyod pa dag ni tshad yod ma gyur cig / ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yongs su bsngo ba rjes su bsgrub pas spyod pa'i rlabs ni 'di tsam zhig go // dus ni 'di srid cig tu'o // don rnams kyi rnam par dag pa ni 'di tsam zhig go //
translated: May my practice never be limited.

original: yongs su sbyang ba byas pa'i khyad par ni 'di tsam dag go //
analyzed: yongs su sbyang ba byas pa'i khyad par ni 'di tsam dag go //
translated: The bodhisattvas' practice is a wave of evolution, with such and such a dedication, such and such a performance, such and such a time, such and such an objective, such and such a purification, such and such a special preparation, such and such a beginning.

original: brtsams pa ni 'di snyed do zhes spyod pa de tshad yod par ma gyur cig ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: brtsams pa ni 'di snyed do zhes spyod pa de tshad yod par ma gyur cig ces bya ba ste /

analyzed: de ltar na grangs med pa'i mthar thug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus it is that it reaches the end of the incalculable.

analyzed: ci spyod pa 'ba' zhig de ltar shin du rgyas sam 'on te gzhan yang snyam pa la /
translated: Is it only the conduct that is so extensive, or are there other things as well?🔽The verse says,

analyzed: yon tan dag kyang tshad gzung med par shog / ces bya ba gsungs so //
translated: May my good qualities also be immeasurable.

original: yon tan rnams ni stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs te /
analyzed: yon tan rnams ni stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs te /
translated: Good qualities are such things as the strengths and fearlessnesses.

original: yon tan ni 'di snyed cig go //
analyzed: yon tan ni 'di snyed cig go //
translated: There are this many good qualities.

original: dus ni 'di srid cig tu'o //
analyzed: dus ni 'di srid cig tu'o //
translated: For this long a time.

analyzed: 'bad pa'i bye brag ni 'di tsam zhig go //

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni 'di tsam zhig la bsnyen bkur byas so //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni 'di tsam zhig la bsnyen bkur byas so //
translated: I have served this many spiritual friends.🔽I have pleased this many tathagatas.

translated: The good qualities possessed by ordinary beings, sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, bodhisattvas and buddhas are common.

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' de dag dang gzhan yang phyogs kyi mthas klas pa thams cad na rnam par gnas pa dag gi rnam par 'phrul pa'i che ba nyid rnam pa tha dad pa du ma ston pa 'tshal bar bgyi'o zhes bya

translated: Thus, in order to make inexhaustible the dedication of the means of thoroughly dedicating the practice of the accumulations of merit and wisdom,🔽as far as space is

translated: extensive,

analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas pa'i mthar thug pa ji tsam par bdag gi smon lam gyi mtha' yang de tsam mo zhes bya ba yin no //
