translated: The extent is the infinite, that is the meaning.

original: 'di skad du nam mkha' mu med pa ji lta ba de bzhin du bdag gi smon lam yang mu med par gyur cig ces bshad pa yin no /
analyzed: 'di skad du nam mkha' mu med pa ji lta ba de bzhin du bdag gi smon lam yang mu med par gyur cig ces bshad pa yin no /
translated: This is what is said: “Just as space is limitless, so may my aspirations be limitless.”

original: de ltar nam mkha'i dpes smon lam re re'i tshad kyang mthar thug pa med par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar nam mkha'i dpes smon lam re re'i tshad kyang mthar thug pa med par bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught that the extent of each aspiration is limitless with the example of space,

original: sems can ma lus mtha' yang de bzhin te //
analyzed: sems can ma lus mtha' yang de bzhin te //
translated: The end of all sentient beings is also like that.

original: zhes bya bas sems can mthar thug pa med pa ston te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas sems can mthar thug pa med pa ston te /
translated: This shows that sentient beings are limitless.

original: sems can gyi khams ma lus pa gangs las shin tu 'das pas mtha' thug pa med pa gang yin pa /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams ma lus pa gangs las shin tu 'das pas mtha' thug pa med pa gang yin pa /
translated: The realm of sentient beings is without exception, beyond the snow mountains, limitless.

original: de dag gi smon lam dag gi mtha' thug pa med par gyur cig ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi smon lam dag gi mtha' thug pa med par gyur cig ces bya ba yin no //
translated: May the arising of their prayers be limitless.

original: de ltar sems can mtha' thug pa med par bstan nas ji tsam las dang zhes bya ba las 'byung ba mthar thug pa med par ston ste /
analyzed: de ltar sems can mtha' thug pa med par bstan nas ji tsam las dang zhes bya ba las 'byung ba mthar thug pa med par ston ste /
translated: Thus, having shown that sentient beings are limitless, it shows that the arising of karma is limitless.

original: 'di skad du ji ltar so so'i skye bo'i skye ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa rnams su las 'byung ba mtha' thug pa med pa de bzhin du bdag byang chub kyi spyad pa spyod pa'i smon lam 'byung ba yang mthar thug par ma gyur cig ces bya🔽ba bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du ji ltar so so'i skye bo'i skye ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa rnams su las 'byung ba mtha' thug pa med pa de bzhin du bdag byang chub kyi spyad pa spyod pa'i smon lam 'byung ba yang mthar thug par ma gyur cig ces bya ba bshad pa yin no //
translated: This explains: Just as the arising of karma in the continuum of births of individual sentient beings is limitless, likewise may the arising of my prayers for engaging in the conduct of enlightenment be limitless.

original: de ltar las 'byung ba mtha' thug pa med par bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar las 'byung ba mtha' thug pa med par bshad nas /
translated: Thus, having explained that the arising of karma is limitless,🔽it shows that the arising of the afflictions is limitless.

original: nyon mongs zhes bya ba la sogs pas mi @228a * //
analyzed: nyon mongs zhes bya ba la sogs pas mi @228a * //
translated: The afflictions and so on are the objects to be abandoned.🔽

original: mthun pa'i phyogs mtha' thug pa med par ston te /
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs mtha' thug pa med par ston te /
translated: With afflictions and so on, he shows the infinite adverse factors.

original: ji ltar sems can gyi khams ma lus pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa rnams 'phags pa'i lam med par mthar thug pa med par gyur pa de bzhin du de'i gnyen por gyur pa bdag gi smon lam gyi khyad par rnams kyang
analyzed: ji ltar sems can gyi khams ma lus pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa rnams 'phags pa'i lam med par mthar thug pa med par gyur pa de bzhin du de'i gnyen por gyur pa bdag gi smon lam gyi khyad par rnams kyang
translated: Just as the afflictions of all sentient beings, such as attachment, which are adverse factors, are infinite without the noble path, in the same way, the special prayers of the self, which are the antidotes to those,

original: sems can so so'i spyod pa'i don bya ba'i phyir mtha' thug par ma gyur cig ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sems can so so'i spyod pa'i don bya ba'i phyir mtha' thug par ma gyur cig ces bya ba yin no //
translated: are also infinite for the sake of acting for the benefit of the individual conduct of sentient beings.

original: skabs 'dis ni sangs rgyas kyis kun du 'od bstan to //
analyzed: skabs 'dis ni sangs rgyas kyis kun du 'od bstan to //
translated: In this section, the Buddha taught the all-illuminating.

original: de ltar 'phags pa kun du bzang po'i spyod pa'i dkyil 'khor thabs dang bcas pa mos pas spyod pa'i sas rab tu phye ba bsam pa dag pa'i sas bsdus pa ji skad smos pa'i yongs su bsngo bas mtha' yas par byas pa zad mi shes pa nyid du
analyzed: de ltar 'phags pa kun du bzang po'i spyod pa'i dkyil 'khor thabs dang bcas pa mos pas spyod pa'i sas rab tu phye ba bsam pa dag pa'i sas bsdus pa ji skad smos pa'i yongs su bsngo bas mtha' yas par byas pa zad mi shes pa nyid du
translated: Thus, the mandala of the conduct of the noble Samantabhadra, together with the methods, is distinguished by the stage of devoted conduct, included in the stage of pure intention, as described, made limitless by the dedication, and taught to be inexhaustible.

original: bstan to // de ltar ji skad smos pa'i smon lam gyi don yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
analyzed: bstan to // de ltar ji skad smos pa'i smon lam gyi don yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
translated: Having thus fulfilled the meaning of the aspirations as described,

original: da ni de la mos pa'i phan yon 'bras bur gyur pa shin tu che ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni de la mos pa'i phan yon 'bras bur gyur pa shin tu che ba'i phyir /
translated: now, since the benefit of devotion to that is the great result,🔽it is said:

original: gang yang phyogs bcu'i zhing rnams mtha' yas pa //
analyzed: gang yang phyogs bcu'i zhing rnams mtha' yas pa //
translated: And also the infinite fields in the ten directions,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and so on.

original: de la phyogs bcu'i zhing rnams mtha' yas pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni tha gru che ba bstan to //
analyzed: de la phyogs bcu'i zhing rnams mtha' yas pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni tha gru che ba bstan to //
translated: Here, the infinite fields in the ten directions shows their vast size.

original: rin chen smos pas ni rin chen rin thang che bas sbyin par bya ba'i khyad par bstan to //
analyzed: rin chen smos pas ni rin chen rin thang che bas sbyin par bya ba'i khyad par bstan to //
translated: Jewel shows the distinction of the gifts, as jewels are valuable.

original: brgyan ces bya ba smos pas ni kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa tha dad pa'i bkod pa sna tshogs bstan to ;
analyzed: brgyan ces bya ba smos pas ni kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa tha dad pa'i bkod pa sna tshogs bstan to ;
translated: The word “adorned” indicates the various arrays of different colors, shapes, and so on.

original: ; rgyal ba rnams la zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'bras bur gyur pa shin tu bla na med pa rab tu dag pa mtha' yas pa'i zhing khyad par can bstan te /
analyzed: ; rgyal ba rnams la zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'bras bur gyur pa shin tu bla na med pa rab tu dag pa mtha' yas pa'i zhing khyad par can bstan te /
translated: The phrase “to the Victorious Ones” indicates the result, which is the attainment of a special, utterly unexcelled, perfectly pure, and infinite buddha field.

original: lha dang mi yi bde ba mchog rnams kyang //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lha dang mi yi bde ba mchog rnams kyang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The line “the supreme bliss of gods and humans”

original: lha dang mi'i bde ba smos pas ni phan 'dogs pa'i bde ba'i khyad par bstan to //
analyzed: lha dang mi'i bde ba smos pas ni phan 'dogs pa'i bde ba'i khyad par bstan to //
translated: The phrase “the supreme bliss of gods and humans” indicates the special bliss that is conferred.

original: zhing gi rdul snyed bskal bar phul ba bas //
analyzed: zhing gi rdul snyed bskal bar phul ba bas //
translated: The line “even if offered for eons equal to the number of atoms in the world”

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni dus khyad par can bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni dus khyad par can bstan to //
translated: indicates the special duration of the offering.

original: de ltar rnam pa khyad par can de dag gi khyad par du 'phags pa'i sbyin pa yang smon lam khyad par can 'di lan cig thos nas dad pa bskyed pa'i sems kyi mos pas bsags pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po dang 'dra bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa khyad par can de dag gi khyad par du 'phags pa'i sbyin pa yang smon lam khyad par can 'di lan cig thos nas dad pa bskyed pa'i sems kyi mos pas bsags pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po dang 'dra bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In this way, the special qualities of the generosity of the bodhisattvas are shown to be equal to the mass of merit that is accumulated by the faith and interest generated by hearing this special aspiration prayer just once.

original: gang gi bsngo ba'i rgyal po 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gi bsngo ba'i rgyal po 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The verse beginning Whoever, having heard this king of prayers... and so on was taught.

original: dad pa dang mos pa phun tshogs pa 'ga' zhig gis yongs su bsngo ba thams cad kyi mchog bde bar gshegs pa mtha' yas pas bsngags pa ji skad bstan pa 'di thos nas /🔽thos pa dang bsam pa la sogs pa'i rim @228b gyis lan cig ste /
analyzed: dad pa dang mos pa phun tshogs pa 'ga' zhig gis yongs su bsngo ba thams cad kyi mchog bde bar gshegs pa mtha' yas pas bsngags pa ji skad bstan pa 'di thos nas / thos pa dang bsam pa la sogs pa'i rim @228b gyis lan cig ste /
translated: Someone who is endowed with faith and interest hears this king of prayers, which is the best of all dedications, praised by infinite Sugatas, as it has been taught.🔽Having heard it, through the stages of hearing, contemplating, and so on, he places it in his mind once,

original: lan 'ga' zhig sems la bzhag nas 'ga' zhig mos shing dad pa bskyed nas te /
analyzed: lan 'ga' zhig sems la bzhag nas 'ga' zhig mos shing dad pa bskyed nas te /
translated: and having generated interest and faith in it,

original: mos pa'i shes pas mngon sum du byed na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mos pa'i shes pas mngon sum du byed na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: he makes it directly manifest with the knowledge of interest. This is what it means.

original: ci'i phyir de ltar bsod nams kyi tshogs phul du byung bar bstan snyam pa la /🔽byang chub mchog gi rjes su rab mos shing //
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar bsod nams kyi tshogs phul du byung bar bstan snyam pa la / byang chub mchog gi rjes su rab mos shing //
translated: Why is it taught that the accumulation of merit is supreme in this way?

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The verse beginning With supreme interest in supreme enlightenment... was taught.

original: byang chub mchog ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ste /
analyzed: byang chub mchog ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ste /
translated: Supreme enlightenment is unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub pas shin tu khyad zhugs pas mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub pas shin tu khyad zhugs pas mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is superior to the enlightenment of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: rab tu mos pas ni mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu mos pas ni mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: By “deeply devoted” is meant “with strong desire.”

original: cir 'gyur snyam pa la /
analyzed: cir 'gyur snyam pa la /
translated: What happens?

original: bsod nams dam pa'i mchog tu 'di 'gyur ro //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: bsod nams dam pa'i mchog tu 'di 'gyur ro // zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: This becomes the supreme, highest merit.

original: dam pa ni gong du smos pa'i sbyin pa pas so //
analyzed: dam pa ni gong du smos pa'i sbyin pa pas so //
translated: The “highest” is the one mentioned above, the giver.

original: mchog ni de las gzhan pa'i bsod nams kyi khyad par thams cad thob pa'o //
analyzed: mchog ni de las gzhan pa'i bsod nams kyi khyad par thams cad thob pa'o //
translated: The “supreme” is the attainment of all other special merits.

original: de ltar bsod nams kyi tshogs yongs su sdud pa'i khyad par gyi phan yon brjod nas /
analyzed: de ltar bsod nams kyi tshogs yongs su sdud pa'i khyad par gyi phan yon brjod nas /
translated: Having thus described the benefit of the distinction in the collection of merit,

original: sdig pa dang grogs po ngan pa bsal bas myur ba nyid du sangs rgyas mthong ba'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir /🔽des ni ngan song rnams kyang spangs bar 'gyur //
analyzed: sdig pa dang grogs po ngan pa bsal bas myur ba nyid du sangs rgyas mthong ba'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir / des ni ngan song rnams kyang spangs bar 'gyur //
translated: in order to demonstrate the benefit of quickly seeing the Buddha by removing evil and bad friends,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, “He will avoid the lower realms,” and so on.

original: des ni zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi mchog skyes bu khyad par can gyis so //
analyzed: des ni zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi mchog skyes bu khyad par can gyis so //
translated: The he refers to the supreme being, the Bodhisattva.

original: spangs pa ni thag bsrings te yongs su btang ba'o //
analyzed: spangs pa ni thag bsrings te yongs su btang ba'o //
translated: Abandonment means to keep away and to give up.

original: de dag gang zhig snyam pa la ngan song zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de dag gang zhig snyam pa la ngan song zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: What are they? He says the lower realms.

original: ngan song ngan 'gro rnams te /
analyzed: ngan song ngan 'gro rnams te /
translated: The lower realms are the miserable realms.

original: las kyi dbang gis yang der mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las kyi dbang gis yang der mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the power of karma, one is not reborn there again.

original: rtag tu lha dang mi'i nang du skye ba rab tu rnyed pas ngan song 'ba' zhig spangs pa ma yin gyis ngan song gi rgyur gyur pa grogs po ngan pa rnams kyang spangs so //
analyzed: rtag tu lha dang mi'i nang du skye ba rab tu rnyed pas ngan song 'ba' zhig spangs pa ma yin gyis ngan song gi rgyur gyur pa grogs po ngan pa rnams kyang spangs so //
translated: It is not that he only abandons the lower realms, but also the bad friends who are the cause of the lower realms.

original: smad pa'i grogs po rnams ni grogs po ngan pa rnams te /
analyzed: smad pa'i grogs po rnams ni grogs po ngan pa rnams te /
translated: Bad friends are those who are despised as friends.

original: gang dag tshe 'di nyi tshe la bde bar bya ba'i phyir khyim gyi gnas la sogs pa la 'dzud pa dang / theg pa de'i snod du gyur pa rnams myur du mya ngan las 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir theg pa chen po dang phral te nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la 'dzud pa yin no //
analyzed: gang dag tshe 'di nyi tshe la bde bar bya ba'i phyir khyim gyi gnas la sogs pa la 'dzud pa dang / theg pa de'i snod du gyur pa rnams myur du mya ngan las 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir theg pa chen po dang phral te nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la 'dzud pa yin no //
translated: Those who, for the sake of happiness in this life alone, introduce them to the householder’s life, etc., and those who, in order to quickly attain nirvana, separate those who are vessels of the Great Vehicle from the Great Vehicle and introduce them to the Disciple and Solitary Realizer Vehicles.

original: de dag kyang dge ba'i bshes gnyen la yang dag pa ji lta ba bsnyen bkur bya ba dang / de'i man ngag spyad pa la nan tan byas pas yongs su spangs pa yin no //🔽de ltar smon lam bsgoms pa'i dbang gis ngan song rgyang bsrings pa dang grogs po ngan pa yongs su spangs pas des myur du bcom ldan @229a * //
analyzed: de dag kyang dge ba'i bshes gnyen la yang dag pa ji lta ba bsnyen bkur bya ba dang / de'i man ngag spyad pa la nan tan byas pas yongs su spangs pa yin no // de ltar smon lam bsgoms pa'i dbang gis ngan song rgyang bsrings pa dang grogs po ngan pa yongs su spangs pas des myur du bcom ldan @229a * //
translated: They are abandoned by attending properly to spiritual friends and by practicing their instructions.

original: 'das 'od dpag med de yang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'das 'od dpag med de yang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, by the power of cultivating the vow, having avoided bad rebirths and abandoned bad friends, they will quickly see the Bhagavat Amitabha.

original: 'di la 'od dpag tu med pa nam mkha'i dkyil mtha' dag khyab par byed pas ngan song gi sdug bsngal sna tshogs zhi bar byed pa dang // lha dang mi'i bde ba sna tshogs shin tu skyed pas sems can thams cad la phan 'dogs par zhugs pa'i 'od tshad med pa yod pas 'od dpag med do //
analyzed: 'di la 'od dpag tu med pa nam mkha'i dkyil mtha' dag khyab par byed pas ngan song gi sdug bsngal sna tshogs zhi bar byed pa dang // lha dang mi'i bde ba sna tshogs shin tu skyed pas sems can thams cad la phan 'dogs par zhugs pa'i 'od tshad med pa yod pas 'od dpag med do //
translated: Here, Amitabha is so called because he has immeasurable light, which pervades the whole sky, and so he is engaged in benefiting all sentient beings by pacifying the various sufferings of the lower realms and by producing the various joys of gods and humans.

original: bcom ldan 'das de mthong bsu yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de mthong bsu yin snyam pa la /
translated: Thinking I will see the Bhagavat,

original: gang gis bzang spyod smon lam 'di btab pa /🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gis bzang spyod smon lam 'di btab pa / zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he who has made this prayer of good conduct,

original: gang gis bzang po spyod pa zhes bya ba'i smon lam gyi rgyal po 'di btab pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis bzang po spyod pa zhes bya ba'i smon lam gyi rgyal po 'di btab pa'o //
translated: he who has made this king of prayers called Good Conduct.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas mthong ba'i phan yon bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas mthong ba'i phan yon bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the benefits of seeing the Buddha,

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang mtshungs pa nyid thob pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phan yon bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang mtshungs pa nyid thob pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phan yon bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the benefit of the characteristic of attaining equality with the bodhisattvas,

original: de gang rnyed pa legs rnyed ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de gang rnyed pa legs rnyed ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says he who has attained the good attainment, and so on.

original: 'dod pa'i don sngon ma thob pa rnyed pa de nyid legs par rnyed pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don sngon ma thob pa rnyed pa de nyid legs par rnyed pa ste /
translated: They have well obtained that which was not previously obtained, the goal.

original: don yangs shing rgya che ba rnyed pa'i phyir legs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: don yangs shing rgya che ba rnyed pa'i phyir legs par gyur pa'o //
translated: They have well obtained the vast and extensive goal.

original: de dag ni legs par rnyed pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi skyes bu chen po'i byin gyi rlabs kyis legs par 'tsho ba yang yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni legs par rnyed pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi skyes bu chen po'i byin gyi rlabs kyis legs par 'tsho ba yang yin te /
translated: Not only have they well obtained it, but they live well through the blessing of the great man.

original: gang dag srog la 'bab pa'i sdug bsngal dag gis kyang gzhan gyi don nyid sgrub pa de dag legs par 'tsho ba yin gyi gzhan dag ni shi ba dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: gang dag srog la 'bab pa'i sdug bsngal dag gis kyang gzhan gyi don nyid sgrub pa de dag legs par 'tsho ba yin gyi gzhan dag ni shi ba dang mtshungs so //
translated: Those who accomplish the aims of others even at the cost of their own lives live well, while others are as if dead.

original: de nyid kyi phyir legs par 'ongs pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir legs par 'ongs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, they have well come,

original: skyes bu'i don sgrub par bzod pa'i phyir mi'i srid pa 'dir legs par 'ongs pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu'i don sgrub par bzod pa'i phyir mi'i srid pa 'dir legs par 'ongs pa'o //
translated: because they have well come to this human existence, which is the means to accomplish the aims of beings.🔽Therefore, they are the best of men,

original: de nyid kyi phyir gang dag sems can gyi don gzhal du med pa byed cing mchog tu dga' ba'i shes che bar gyur pa /🔽de dag kha cig skyes bu mchog ces bya'i /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gang dag sems can gyi don gzhal du med pa byed cing mchog tu dga' ba'i shes che bar gyur pa /🔽de dag kha cig skyes bu mchog ces bya'i /
translated: because they are the best of men who perform immeasurable benefits for sentient beings and have the greatest joy.

original: de las gzhan pa dag ni rtsa rul ba dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dag ni rtsa rul ba dang mtshungs so //
translated: The others are like rotten roots.

original: de dag ring por mi thogs de bzhin 'gyur //
analyzed: de dag ring por mi thogs de bzhin 'gyur //
translated: They will become like that before long.🔽By the cause mentioned, the bodhisattvas will become like the🔽Blessed One, the universal good, and those who accomplish his

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ji skad smos pa'i rgyus byang chub sems dpa' chen po bcom ldan 'das kun du bzang po de ci 'dra bar gang dag de'i smon lam rjes su sgrub pa de dag kyang ring por mi thogs bar de bzhin du 'gyur te /
translated: aspirations will become like that before long.

original: myur ba kho nar de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: myur ba kho nar de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They will become like that quickly, is what it means.🔽Having thus described the benefits of gathering merit, seeing the

analyzed: de ltar bsod nams yongs su sdud pa dang / sangs rgyas mthong ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang mtshungs pa nyid thob pa'i phan yon brjod nas / da ni / mtshams med lnga po dag gi sdig pa rnams //
translated: buddhas, and attaining equality with the bodhisattvas,🔽now, in order to describe the benefits of purifying obscurations,
