analyzed: zhes bya ba la @229b sogs pas sgrib pa sbyang ba'i phan yon gsungs te /
translated: he says, “The sins of the five heinous crimes, etc.”

original: mtshams med ces bya ba ni shi ma thag tu gdon mi za bar sems can dmyal bar 'gro ba'i bar bcad pa mi nus pa'i phyir mtshams med pa'o //
analyzed: mtshams med ces bya ba ni shi ma thag tu gdon mi za bar sems can dmyal bar 'gro ba'i bar bcad pa mi nus pa'i phyir mtshams med pa'o //
translated: The term “immediate” means that one is immediately reborn in hell without delay.

original: lnga ni / pha dang ma dang dgra bcom pa bsad pa dang / dge 'dun gyi dbyen byas pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag phyung ba zhes bya ba rnams so //
analyzed: lnga ni / pha dang ma dang dgra bcom pa bsad pa dang / dge 'dun gyi dbyen byas pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag phyung ba zhes bya ba rnams so //
translated: The five are: killing one’s father, killing one’s mother, killing an arhat, maliciously drawing blood from a tathāgata, and causing a schism in the saṅgha.

original: sdig pa ni ngan song du ltung bar byed pas rnam par smin pa smad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdig pa ni ngan song du ltung bar byed pas rnam par smin pa smad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Evil” means that the maturation is despicable because it causes one to fall into the lower realms.

original: gang gis mi shes dbang gis zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba'i grogs po dang bsten pas gang gis las kyi rnam par smin pa chen po ma shes nas ci zhig ltar byas te bsgrubs pa rnams so ;
analyzed: gang gis mi shes dbang gis zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba'i grogs po dang bsten pas gang gis las kyi rnam par smin pa chen po ma shes nas ci zhig ltar byas te bsgrubs pa rnams so ;
translated: “Through the power of ignorance” means that one does not know the great maturation of karma, and one acts and accumulates through association with nonvirtuous friends.

original: ; de yi bzang po spyod pa 'di brjod na //
analyzed: ; de yi bzang po spyod pa 'di brjod na //
translated: Having described this good conduct,

original: zhes bya ba ni sus bzang po spyod pa zhes bya ba smon lam gyi rgyal po 'di brjod na ste dad pas 'don cing mos pas mos na'o //🔽myur du ma lus yongs su byang bar 'gyur //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sus bzang po spyod pa zhes bya ba smon lam gyi rgyal po 'di brjod na ste dad pas 'don cing mos pas mos na'o // myur du ma lus yongs su byang bar 'gyur //
translated: Whoever recites this king of vows called the Good Practice, who recites it with faith and believes it with devotion,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: will quickly and completely purify all his evil deeds.

original: myur ba ni ring por mi thogs pa'o //
analyzed: myur ba ni ring por mi thogs pa'o //
translated: Quickly means not after a long time.

original: yongs su byang ba ni yongs su zad pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su byang ba ni yongs su zad pa'o //
translated: Completely means totally.

original: 'gyur ba ni byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba ni byed pa'o //
translated: Purify means to make.

original: ma lus pa zhes bya ba ni lhag ma med pa ste cung zad tsam yang mi gnas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ma lus pa zhes bya ba ni lhag ma med pa ste cung zad tsam yang mi gnas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: All means without remainder. It means not even a little remains.

original: de ltar tshe 'di'i phan yon rnam pa bzhi'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de ltar tshe 'di'i phan yon rnam pa bzhi'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: Thus, in order to teach the special four benefits in this life,

original: ye shes dang ni gzugs dang mtshan rnams dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshe rabs gzhan gyi phan yon gsungs so //
analyzed: ye shes dang ni gzugs dang mtshan rnams dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshe rabs gzhan gyi phan yon gsungs so //
translated: he says, “Knowledge, form, marks, and so on,” and so on, teaching the benefits in other lives.

original: de la re zhig rgyur gyur pa'i phan yon ston te /
analyzed: de la re zhig rgyur gyur pa'i phan yon ston te /
translated: Among them, he first teaches the benefit that is the cause.

original: ye shes ni mi shes pa thams cad sel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes ni mi shes pa thams cad sel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Knowledge is because it removes all ignorance.

original: gzugs ni lus kyi kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bye brag go /
analyzed: gzugs ni lus kyi kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bye brag go /
translated: Form is the particular color and shape of the body.

original: mtshan rnams ni dbu gdugs lta bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan rnams ni dbu gdugs lta bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: The major marks are the protuberance on the head, the spiral hair, etc.

original: kha dog ni pags pa'i mdog gser gyi kha dog lta bu'o //
analyzed: kha dog ni pags pa'i mdog gser gyi kha dog lta bu'o //
translated: Color is the golden color of the skin.

original: rigs ni rigs gnyi ga yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: rigs ni rigs gnyi ga yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: Lineage is the purity of both lineages.

original: de bas na thams cad pas khyad par du 'phags pa de dag dang ldan zhing yang dag par ldan par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na thams cad pas khyad par du 'phags pa de dag dang ldan zhing yang dag par ldan par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Thus, he is endowed with and possesses all of these, which are superior to all others.

original: de nyid kyi phyir yon tan thams cad yongs su rdzogs pas /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir yon tan thams cad yongs su rdzogs pas /
translated: Therefore, he is endowed with all good qualities.

original: bdud dang mu stegs mang pos de mi thub //🔽ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdud dang mu stegs mang pos de mi thub // ces bya ba'o //
translated: He cannot be overcome by many demons and tirthikas.

original: mu stegs can dag ni gang dag 'di las phyi rol ba dag ste lam ngan par zhugs pa rnams so //
analyzed: mu stegs can dag ni gang dag 'di las phyi rol ba dag ste lam ngan par zhugs pa rnams so //
translated: Tirthikas are those outside of this, who have entered bad paths.

original: bdud rnams ni dge ba'i tshogs kyi bar chad byed pa dag go //
analyzed: bdud rnams ni dge ba'i tshogs kyi bar chad byed pa dag go //
translated: Demons are those who create obstacles to the accumulation of virtue.

original: de dag gi tshogs ni mang po'o //
analyzed: de dag gi tshogs ni mang po'o //
translated: Their hosts are many.

original: mu stegs can dang bdud kyi tshogs de dag gis mi thub pa ni zil gyis non par mi @230a * //
analyzed: mu stegs can dang bdud kyi tshogs de dag gis mi thub pa ni zil gyis non par mi @230a * //
translated: He cannot be overcome by those hosts of tirthikas and demons. He cannot be overcome by their hosts.

original: 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Change.

original: de zil gyis mi non par nus pa ni tshig 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de zil gyis mi non par nus pa ni tshig 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: The ability to not be overcome by that is connected with the words that will come later.

original: de'i phyir yon tan de lta bu dang ldan pas de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi nyes pa dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir yon tan de lta bu dang ldan pas de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi nyes pa dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because he possesses such qualities, he is free from the faults that are their opposites.

original: 'jig rten gsum po kun na 'ang mchod par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum po kun na 'ang mchod par 'gyur //
translated: He is worshipped in all three worlds.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: And so on.

original: 'jig rten gsum po kun ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad de /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum po kun ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad de /
translated: All three worlds are all world systems.

original: smon lam gyi dbang gis sems can gyi don bsgrub pa'i phyir gang du skyes pa der mchod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: smon lam gyi dbang gis sems can gyi don bsgrub pa'i phyir gang du skyes pa der mchod par 'gyur te /
translated: Wherever he is born by the power of his prayers in order to accomplish the welfare of sentient beings, he is worshipped there.

original: lha dang mi rnams kyis bsti stang du byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyis bsti stang du byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: He is honored by gods and humans.

original: zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This is how it is connected.

original: de ltar tshe rabs gzhan gyi rgyur gyur pa'i phan yon brjod nas /🔽da ni / byang chub shing dbang drung du de myur 'gro //
analyzed: de ltar tshe rabs gzhan gyi rgyur gyur pa'i phan yon brjod nas / da ni / byang chub shing dbang drung du de myur 'gro //
translated: Having described the benefits that are the causes for other lives,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'bras bur gyur pa'i phan yon gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'bras bur gyur pa'i phan yon gsungs te /
translated: now, the benefits that are the results are described beginning with “he quickly goes to the foot of the tree of awakening.”

original: myur zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dag pas myur ba ste /
analyzed: myur zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dag pas myur ba ste /
translated: Swiftly means more quickly than other bodhisattvas.

original: des rtag tu byas pa dang gus par byas te goms pas smon lam gyi rgyal po 'di'i mthus 'gro'o //
analyzed: des rtag tu byas pa dang gus par byas te goms pas smon lam gyi rgyal po 'di'i mthus 'gro'o //
translated: By always practicing and cultivating this king of prayers with devotion, one will go.

original: byang chub shing dbang zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi shing gi rgyal po'o //
analyzed: byang chub shing dbang zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi shing gi rgyal po'o //
translated: The lord of the tree of enlightenment means the king of the tree of enlightenment.

original: byang chub ni bla na med pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: byang chub ni bla na med pa'i ye shes te /
translated: Enlightenment is unsurpassed knowledge.

original: de shing gi rgyal po gang gi drung du bzhugs nas brnyes pa de ni shing thams cad kyi nang na lha dang mi'i mchod par bya ba nyid kyi mchog tu byung ba'i phyir dbang po'o //
analyzed: de shing gi rgyal po gang gi drung du bzhugs nas brnyes pa de ni shing thams cad kyi nang na lha dang mi'i mchod par bya ba nyid kyi mchog tu byung ba'i phyir dbang po'o //
translated: Since it is the best of all trees, worshipped by gods and humans, it is the lord.

original: 'gro zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi shing gi rgyal po'i drung der ro //
analyzed: 'gro zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi shing gi rgyal po'i drung der ro //
translated: To go means to go to the foot of that king of the tree of enlightenment.

original: song nas sems can phan phyir der 'dug ste //
analyzed: song nas sems can phan phyir der 'dug ste //
translated: Having gone, one sits there for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: zhes bya ba la 'dug ces bya ba ni skyil mo krung bcas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la 'dug ces bya ba ni skyil mo krung bcas pa'o //
translated: To sit means to sit cross-legged.

original: ci'i phyir snyam pa la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir snyam pa la /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems can phan phyir zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: sems can phan phyir zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The phrase “for the sake of sentient beings” is stated.

original: lha dang mir bcas pa'i 'gro bdag mtho ris dang byang grol thob par bya ba'i phyir de ltar 'dug nas byams pa'i stobs kyis bdud dpung dang bcas pa pham par byas te'o //🔽byang chub sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon sum du byas nas so //
analyzed: lha dang mir bcas pa'i 'gro bdag mtho ris dang byang grol thob par bya ba'i phyir de ltar 'dug nas byams pa'i stobs kyis bdud dpung dang bcas pa pham par byas te'o // byang chub sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon sum du byas nas so //
translated: For the sake of sentient beings, he sat there and, by the power of his loving kindness, defeated the army of Mara together with its forces.

original: 'khor lo rab tu bskor zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo chen po ston zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: 'khor lo rab tu bskor zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo chen po ston zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Having actualized enlightenment, Buddhahood, he turned the wheel, i.e., he taught the great, unsurpassed Dharma wheel.

original: 'dis ni tshe 'di dang tshe rabs gzhan gyi 'bras bu'i phan yon rgyas par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni tshe 'di dang tshe rabs gzhan gyi 'bras bu'i phan yon rgyas par bshad pa yin no //
translated: This explains in detail the benefits of the result in this life and in other lives.🔽Now, in order to teach the special benefits in general in brief, he says:

original: de ni / gang yang bzang po spyod pa'i smon lam 'di /
analyzed: de ni / gang yang bzang po spyod pa'i smon lam 'di /
translated: Whatever is this prayer of good conduct,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas phan yon gyi khyad par spyir mdor bsdus te ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas phan yon gyi khyad par spyir mdor bsdus te ston to //
translated: etc.

original: @230b gang zhes bya ba ni la la zhig go //
analyzed: @230b gang zhes bya ba ni la la zhig go //
translated: Whoever is someone.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni bzang po spyod pa'i smon lam gyi rgyal po'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni bzang po spyod pa'i smon lam gyi rgyal po'o //
translated: This refers to the king of prayers, the Excellent Golden Light. )

original: 'dzin pa ni phyi ci ma log par tshig dang don sgrub pa'i sgo nas mi brjed pa'i tshul du'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni phyi ci ma log par tshig dang don sgrub pa'i sgo nas mi brjed pa'i tshul du'o //
translated: To uphold means to hold it in mind without error, by way of the words and their meanings, without forgetting. )

original: klog pa ni glegs bam la bris pa klog pa'i tshul du'o //
analyzed: klog pa ni glegs bam la bris pa klog pa'i tshul du'o //
translated: To read means to read it as it is written in a book. )

original: ston pa ni gzhan dag la tshig dang don gyi tshul du ston pa'o //
analyzed: ston pa ni gzhan dag la tshig dang don gyi tshul du ston pa'o //
translated: To teach means to teach it to others, by way of the words and their meanings. )

original: de yi rnam par smin pa sangs rgyas mkhyen //
analyzed: de yi rnam par smin pa sangs rgyas mkhyen //
translated: The Buddha alone knows the full extent of its maturation.

original: ces bya ba la /🔽bzang po spyod pa 'dzin pa dang / klog pa dang / ston pa de'i rnam par smin pa ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba la / bzang po spyod pa 'dzin pa dang / klog pa dang / ston pa de'i rnam par smin pa ste /
translated: As it says,🔽The Buddha alone knows the full extent of the maturation of upholding, reading, and teaching the Excellent Golden Light. )

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kho nas rnam par mkhyen cing bye brag tu thugs su chud kyi /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kho nas rnam par mkhyen cing bye brag tu thugs su chud kyi /
translated: The Buddha Bhagavan alone knows the full extent of the maturation of upholding, reading, and teaching the Excellent Golden Light.

original: gzhan gyis ni de'i rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin yongs su shes par mi nus zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ni de'i rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin yongs su shes par mi nus zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The others are not able to fully understand the nature of its maturation. This is what it means. )🔽The Buddha alone knows the full extent of its maturation means that the Buddha alone knows the full extent of the maturation of upholding, reading, and teaching the Excellent Golden Light. )

original: rgyu dang mi 'dra bar smin pa ni rnam par smin pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang mi 'dra bar smin pa ni rnam par smin pa ste /
translated: The result that is dissimilar to its cause is the fully-ripened result.

original: lha dang mi rnams kyi nang na lus dang / longs spyod dang / rigs dang / gzugs dang / nad med pa dang / yid gzhungs pa dang / yid rno ba la sogs pa phyi rol mi dpog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyi nang na lus dang / longs spyod dang / rigs dang / gzugs dang / nad med pa dang / yid gzhungs pa dang / yid rno ba la sogs pa phyi rol mi dpog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the body, resources, family, physical appearance, health, intelligence, and sharpness of mind, etc. of gods and humans, which are not subject to external measurement.

original: de ltar rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu brjod nas /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu brjod nas /
translated: Having thus described the fully-ripened result,

original: byang chub mchog la som nyi ma byed cig / ces bya bas rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'i bye brag mchog tu gyur pa ston to //
analyzed: byang chub mchog la som nyi ma byed cig / ces bya bas rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'i bye brag mchog tu gyur pa ston to //
translated: the verse states, “Do not doubt supreme enlightenment.” This shows the most excellent specific result that is a natural outflow.

original: byang chub mchog ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa thams cad kyi rtse mor phyin pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub mchog ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa thams cad kyi rtse mor phyin pa ste /
translated: Supreme enlightenment is the culmination of all that is conditioned and unconditioned.

original: de spyod pa mtha' dag gi 'bras bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de spyod pa mtha' dag gi 'bras bur 'gyur ro //
translated: It is the result of all the bodhisattva deeds.

original: som nyi ma byed cig ces bya ba ni 'di la som nyi mi bya'i /
analyzed: som nyi ma byed cig ces bya ba ni 'di la som nyi mi bya'i /
translated: “Do not doubt” means do not doubt this.

original: nges par de'i 'bras bu sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro zhes de ltar nges par gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: nges par de'i 'bras bu sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro zhes de ltar nges par gzung bar bya'o //
translated: One should be certain that the result of that is buddhahood.

original: de ltar bsgoms pa'i phan yon ji skad ston cing ji skad bshad pa rab tu bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar bsgoms pa'i phan yon ji skad ston cing ji skad bshad pa rab tu bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught, demonstrated, and explained the benefits of such meditation,

original: da ni / 'jam dpal dpa' bos ji ltar mkhyen pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa tsam gyis bsags pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngo ba ston te /
analyzed: da ni / 'jam dpal dpa' bos ji ltar mkhyen pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa tsam gyis bsags pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngo ba ston te /
translated: now, the dedication of the roots of virtue accumulated by merely teaching what is shown by the words “Just as the hero Manjushri knows” and so forth is taught.

original: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyis dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs yongs su bsngo ba mkhyen pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyis dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs yongs su bsngo ba mkhyen pa bzhin du'o //
translated: Just as the Blessed One, the noble Manjushri, knows how to dedicate the accumulation of roots of virtue,

original: ci 'dra ba zhig snyam pa la /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhig snyam pa la /
translated: one may wonder what it is like.

original: dpa' bo zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dpa' bo zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is said “the hero,”

original: dpa' bo ni shes rab kyi ral gyi ngad can dri ma med pa bla na med pa bdar bas dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i dgra'i tshogs thams cad bcom pa'i phyir ro //🔽kun du bzang po de yang de bzhin te //
analyzed: dpa' bo ni shes rab kyi ral gyi ngad can dri ma med pa bla na med pa bdar bas dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i dgra'i tshogs thams cad bcom pa'i phyir ro // kun du bzang po de yang de bzhin te //
translated: because the hero, with the unsheathed sword of wisdom, the stainless, unsurpassed weapon, has conquered the entire army of enemies that are the attachments to entities.🔽Samantabhadra is also like that.

original: zhes bya @231a * //
analyzed: zhes bya @231a * //
translated: It is said “just so.”

original: ba ni bcom ldan 'das 'phags pa kun du bzang po de yang ji ltar yongs su bsngo ba'i cho ga'i tshul mkhyen pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: ba ni bcom ldan 'das 'phags pa kun du bzang po de yang ji ltar yongs su bsngo ba'i cho ga'i tshul mkhyen pa bzhin du'o //
translated: The Blessed One, the noble Samantabhadra, also in accordance with the way he knows the ritual of dedication.

original: de dag gi ni rjes su bdag slob cing //
analyzed: de dag gi ni rjes su bdag slob cing //
translated: I train in their footsteps,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni de la sogs pa gzhan yang theg pa chen po'i chos zab cing rgya che ba rgya mtsho'i pha rol du son pa bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams te de dag kyang de bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni de la sogs pa gzhan yang theg pa chen po'i chos zab cing rgya che ba rgya mtsho'i pha rol du son pa bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams te de dag kyang de bzhin pa'o //
translated: There, those refers to others like them, the Blessed Ones, the great bodhisattvas who have gone to the far shore of the ocean of the profound and vast Dharma of the Great Vehicle. They too are like that.

original: rjes su slob cing zhes bya ba ni slob pa'i rjes su byed cing ngo //
analyzed: rjes su slob cing zhes bya ba ni slob pa'i rjes su byed cing ngo //
translated: Train in their footsteps means to follow their training.

original: dge ba 'di dag thams cad rab tu bsngo //
analyzed: dge ba 'di dag thams cad rab tu bsngo //
translated: I fully dedicate all these virtues

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /

original: 'di dag thams cad ces bya ba ni smon lam gyis kun nas bslang ba 'di dag thams cad ma lus par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad ces bya ba ni smon lam gyis kun nas bslang ba 'di dag thams cad ma lus par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: There, all these means all of these without exception, that is, what is motivated by the aspiration.

original: bsngo zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsngo zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par byed pa'o //
translated: The word “dedicate” means to determine for unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: ci zhig bsngo zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig bsngo zhe na /
translated: What is dedicated?

original: dge ba zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: dge ba zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The word “virtue” is stated.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po 'di gnyis kyi rjes su slob pas yongs su bsngo bar ma zad kyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po 'di gnyis kyi rjes su slob pas yongs su bsngo bar ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is it dedicated by training in the example and suchness dedication of these two great bodhisattvas,🔽but it is also dedicated by a dedication that is ever more exalted.

original: gzhan yang de'i gong nas gong du khyad par 'phags pa'i yongs su bsngo bas yongs su bsngo'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang de'i gong nas gong du khyad par 'phags pa'i yongs su bsngo bas yongs su bsngo'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach this, it is said:

original: dus gsum gshegs pa'i rgyal ba thams cad kyis //
analyzed: dus gsum gshegs pa'i rgyal ba thams cad kyis //
translated: All the Victorious Ones of the three times

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: and so forth.

original: dus gsum gshegs pa ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad kyis so //
analyzed: dus gsum gshegs pa ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad kyis so //
translated: “All the Victorious Ones of the three times” refers to all the Bhagavān Buddhas of the past, present, and future.

original: bsngo ba gang la bsngags pa zhes bya ba ni bstod pa'o //
analyzed: bsngo ba gang la bsngags pa zhes bya ba ni bstod pa'o //
translated: “What is praised in the dedications” means what is praised and what is praised is what is praised by all the Victorious Ones of the three times.

original: mchog ces bya ba ni yongs su bsngo ba thams cad pas rab tu bsngags pa nyid kyis mchog tu gyur pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa las /
analyzed: mchog ces bya ba ni yongs su bsngo ba thams cad pas rab tu bsngags pa nyid kyis mchog tu gyur pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa las /
translated: The word “supreme” means that it is the best because it is praised by all dedications. That is the perfection of wisdom, as taught in the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mi dmigs pa'i rnam pas yongs su bsngo ba gsungs pa yang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mi dmigs pa'i rnam pas yongs su bsngo ba gsungs pa yang yin pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One also taught the dedication without reference points.

original: des bdag gi dge ba'i zhes bya ba la des zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mi dmigs par yongs su bsngo ba /
analyzed: des bdag gi dge ba'i zhes bya ba la des zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mi dmigs par yongs su bsngo ba /
translated: “By that, my virtue” and so on. “By that” and so on refers to the dedication without reference points.

original: bde bar gshegs pa dang de'i sras mtha' dag gis bsngags shing bstod pas so //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa dang de'i sras mtha' dag gis bsngags shing bstod pas so //
translated: It is praised and extolled by all the Sugatas and their children.

original: 'di kun kyang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di kun kyang zhes bya ba la /
translated: “All of this” and so on.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni dge ba'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni dge ba'o //
translated: “This” refers to the virtue.

original: kun zhes bya ba ni bzang po spyod pa bsgoms pas bsdus pa yang ngo //
analyzed: kun zhes bya ba ni bzang po spyod pa bsgoms pas bsdus pa yang ngo //
translated: “All” refers to what is included in the cultivation of the conduct of the excellent ones.

original: mchog tu bzang po spyod pa spyad phyir bsngo bar bgyi //
analyzed: mchog tu bzang po spyod pa spyad phyir bsngo bar bgyi //
translated: I dedicate it all to the supreme practice of the excellent conduct.

original: zhes bya ba la mchog tu bzang po spyad phyir zhes bya ba ni mchog tu bzang po @231b bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la mchog tu bzang po spyad phyir zhes bya ba ni mchog tu bzang po @231b bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase because of the practice of supreme goodness means because of the accomplishment of supreme goodness.

original: bsngo ba ni yongs su bsngo ba'o //
analyzed: bsngo ba ni yongs su bsngo ba'o //
translated: Dedication is the act of turning over.

original: 'di skad du bzang po spyod pa bton pa las byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba gang yin pa 'di dang / gang yang bzang po spyod pa bsgoms pa las bsdus pa snga ma de dang de gnyis gang yang bzang po spyod pa'i smon lam bsgrub pa'i phyir sbyar bar bya'o zhes bshad pa yin no /
analyzed: 'di skad du bzang po spyod pa bton pa las byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba gang yin pa 'di dang / gang yang bzang po spyod pa bsgoms pa las bsdus pa snga ma de dang de gnyis gang yang bzang po spyod pa'i smon lam bsgrub pa'i phyir sbyar bar bya'o zhes bshad pa yin no /
translated: This is what is being said: Whatever roots of virtue have arisen from the recitation of the Bhadracari, and whatever has been collected from the cultivation of the Bhadracari, I turn both of those over, I apply them both, in order to accomplish the prayer of the Bhadracari.

original: de ni de ltar ston pa tsam gyis rjes su slob pa'i yongs su bsngo ba bstan nas /
analyzed: de ni de ltar ston pa tsam gyis rjes su slob pa'i yongs su bsngo ba bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the dedication of the kind that is practiced by following the mere words of the teacher,🔽now, in order to teach the dedication that is practiced by following the meaning of the teacher, he says,

original: da ni / bdag ni 'chi ba'i dus byed gyur pa na //
analyzed: da ni / bdag ni 'chi ba'i dus byed gyur pa na //
translated: When I am at the point of death,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ma 'ongs pa na pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang mthun pa'i lus yongs su bzung bar yongs su bsngo bar ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ma 'ongs pa na pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang mthun pa'i lus yongs su bzung bar yongs su bsngo bar ston to //
translated: and so on.

original: bdag ces bya ba ni bdag nyid du ston to //
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba ni bdag nyid du ston to //
translated: The so-called self is the one who is shown to be the self.🔽Time is the enumeration of months, etc. and of seconds, minutes, etc.🔽It is the one who causes the body projected by former karma to remain in a similar class of existence.

original: dus zhes bya ba ni zla ba la sogs pa dang skad cig thang cig la sogs par bgrang ba ste de yang sngon gyi 'du byed kyis 'phangs pa'i lus rigs mthun par gzhan dag na gnas pa'i don de byed pa ni yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ste
analyzed: dus zhes bya ba ni zla ba la sogs pa dang skad cig thang cig la sogs par bgrang ba ste de yang sngon gyi 'du byed kyis 'phangs pa'i lus rigs mthun par gzhan dag na gnas pa'i don de byed pa ni yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ste
translated: It is the one who causes the completion of that.

original: / de na gnas pa yongs su rdzogs par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: / de na gnas pa yongs su rdzogs par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the one who causes the completion of the one who remains there.

original: sgrib pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sems kyi rgyun la sgrib cing khebs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: sgrib pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sems kyi rgyun la sgrib cing khebs par byed pa ste /
translated: The so-called obscurations are the obscurations and coverings of the continuum of consciousness.

original: dge ba'i chos skye ba la sgrib pa rnams so //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos skye ba la sgrib pa rnams so //
translated: They are the obscurations to the arising of virtuous dharmas.

original: de dag kyang las dang nyon mongs pa dang rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa'i rang bzhin dag ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang las dang nyon mongs pa dang rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa'i rang bzhin dag ste /
translated: They are also the obscurations of karma, affliction, and ripening.🔽The karmas of the heinous actions,🔽the afflictions that are not exhausted, the bad migrations,

original: mtshams med pa yi las rnams dang // nyon mongs mi zad ngan 'gro dang // sgra mi snyan dang 'du shes med //
analyzed: mtshams med pa yi las rnams dang // nyon mongs mi zad ngan 'gro dang // sgra mi snyan dang 'du shes med //
translated: and Uttarakuru, and the non-perception

original: sems can sgrib pa gsum du 'dod //
analyzed: sems can sgrib pa gsum du 'dod //
translated: are asserted to be the three obscurations of sentient beings.

original: ces gang bshad pa ste /
analyzed: ces gang bshad pa ste /
translated: This is what is explained.

original: sgrib pa de lta bu dag go //
analyzed: sgrib pa de lta bu dag go //
translated: Such obscurations.

original: thams cad ni yongs su ma lus pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad ni yongs su ma lus pa'o //
translated: All means without exception.

original: phyir zhes bya ba de ni bye brag tu'am rgyang bsrings pa'o //
analyzed: phyir zhes bya ba de ni bye brag tu'am rgyang bsrings pa'o //
translated: The word “away” means specifically or at a distance.

original: bsal te zhes bya ba ni bdag gi rgyud la yang mi skye ba'i chos nyid du byas te'o //
analyzed: bsal te zhes bya ba ni bdag gi rgyud la yang mi skye ba'i chos nyid du byas te'o //
translated: “Having removed” means having made it a fact that they will not arise in one’s own continuum.

original: 'od dpag med pa de ni mngon sum blta //
analyzed: 'od dpag med pa de ni mngon sum blta //
translated: Look directly at that Amitābha.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: And so forth.

original: mngon sum ni mngon du'o //
analyzed: mngon sum ni mngon du'o //
translated: Directly means in actuality.

original: 'od dpag med pa zhes bya ba de ni bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa 'od dpag med do //
analyzed: 'od dpag med pa zhes bya ba de ni bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa 'od dpag med do //
translated: Amitābha means the Blessed One, the Tathāgata Amitābha.

original: blta zhes bya ba ni blta bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: blta zhes bya ba ni blta bar bya ba'o //
translated: Look means should be seen.

original: bde ba can gyi zhing der mchi bar bgyi //
analyzed: bde ba can gyi zhing der mchi bar bgyi //
translated: I will go to that realm of Sukhāvatī.

original: zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das 'od dpag med de nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing bde ba can yon tan 'od dpag tu med pa dang ldan pa mchog tu bde zhing yid @232a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das 'od dpag med de nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing bde ba can yon tan 'od dpag tu med pa dang ldan pa mchog tu bde zhing yid @232a * //
translated: The Blessed One Amitābha himself has the buddha realm of Sukhāvatī, endowed with immeasurable good qualities, supremely blissful and delightful,

original: bde ba'i gnas gcig tu gyur pa bde bar gshegs pa'i sras dpag tu med pas yongs su gang bder mchi'o zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: bde ba'i gnas gcig tu gyur pa bde bar gshegs pa'i sras dpag tu med pas yongs su gang bder mchi'o zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: It is a single place of happiness, filled with countless sons of the Sugata.

original: bdag der skye bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag der skye bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: I will be born there.

original: de ltar sems can la phan 'dogs pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar sems can la phan 'dogs pa bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the benefit to sentient beings,

original: spyod pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / sems can gyi don gyi mtha' gtugs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: spyod pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / sems can gyi don gyi mtha' gtugs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the completion of the practice and the end of the benefit of sentient beings,

original: der song nas ni smon lam 'di dag kyang //
analyzed: der song nas ni smon lam 'di dag kyang //
translated: Having gone there, may these aspirations

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and so on are stated.

original: der zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das 'od dpag med de'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du'o //
analyzed: der zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das 'od dpag med de'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du'o //
translated: There means in the Buddha-field of the Bhagavat Amitabha.

original: song nas / zhes bya ba ni skyes nas so //
analyzed: song nas / zhes bya ba ni skyes nas so //
translated: Having gone means having been born.

original: smon lam 'di dag ces bya ba ni smon lam ji skad bstan pa rnams so //
analyzed: smon lam 'di dag ces bya ba ni smon lam ji skad bstan pa rnams so //
translated: These aspirations means the aspirations as they have been taught.

original: thams cad ma lus mngon du 'gyur bar shog //
analyzed: thams cad ma lus mngon du 'gyur bar shog //
translated: May all without exception be actualized.

original: ces bya ba ni thams cad gcig tu bsdus nas mngon sum du gyur cing mngon du 'gyur bar shog shig ces bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni thams cad gcig tu bsdus nas mngon sum du gyur cing mngon du 'gyur bar shog shig ces bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is to be connected with may they all be gathered into one and become manifest and evident.

original: de dag ma lus bdag gis yongs su bskang //
analyzed: de dag ma lus bdag gis yongs su bskang //
translated: I will satisfy them all without exception.

original: zhes bya ba ni de dag ma lus par yongs su bskang ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de dag ma lus par yongs su bskang ba'o //
translated: This is to satisfy them all without exception.

original: yongs su bskangs nas ci zhig bya snyam pa la /
analyzed: yongs su bskangs nas ci zhig bya snyam pa la /
translated: What will be done after satisfying them?

original: 'jig rten ji srid sems can phan par bgyi //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jig rten ji srid sems can phan par bgyi // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is stated, I will benefit sentient beings for as long as the world exists.

original: bdag gis sems can rnams la phan par bgyi zhes bya ba ni sgrub par bgyi zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bdag gis sems can rnams la phan par bgyi zhes bya ba ni sgrub par bgyi zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The phrase I will benefit sentient beings means I will accomplish.

original: dus ji srid cig gi bar du snyam pa la /
analyzed: dus ji srid cig gi bar du snyam pa la /
translated: For how long a time?

original: 'jig rten ji srid ces bya ba zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jig rten ji srid ces bya ba zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is stated, for as long as the world exists.

original: sems can gyi 'jig rten ji srid kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi 'jig rten ji srid kyi bar du'o //
translated: For as long as the world of sentient beings exists.

original: 'di skad du ji ltar 'jig rten thams cad kyi mthar thug pa med pa de bzhin du snying rje chen po'i gzhan gyi dbang can 'gro ba'i don 'grub pa'i phyir ci la yang ma rag par chas pa bdag gi yang mtha' thug par ma gyur cig ces bshad
analyzed: 'di skad du ji ltar 'jig rten thams cad kyi mthar thug pa med pa de bzhin du snying rje chen po'i gzhan gyi dbang can 'gro ba'i don 'grub pa'i phyir ci la yang ma rag par chas pa bdag gi yang mtha' thug par ma gyur cig ces bshad
translated: It is explained that just as the world is endless, so too, in order to accomplish the welfare of beings, the bodhisattva who is under the power of great compassion is never satisfied with his efforts and never reaches an end.

original: pa yin no //
analyzed: pa yin no //
translated: This is what is being said: Just as the world has no end, so too, in order to accomplish the aims of beings, who are under the power of others, may I, who am not attached to anything, have no end.

original: rgyal ba'i dkyil 'khor bzang zhing dga' ba der //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i dkyil 'khor bzang zhing dga' ba der //
translated: In that excellent, delightful maṇḍala of the Victorious One,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: rgyal ba'i dkyil 'khor ni bcom ldan 'das 'od dpag med de'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor de'o //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i dkyil 'khor ni bcom ldan 'das 'od dpag med de'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor de'o //
translated: The maṇḍala of the Victorious One is the maṇḍala of the retinue of the Bhagavān Amitābha.

original: gang la bcom ldan 'das 'od dpag med de byang chub sems dpa' dag pa rnams dang thabs cig tu bla na med pa'i 'byor pas chos kyi longs spyod bla na med pa 'byor pa'o //
analyzed: gang la bcom ldan 'das 'od dpag med de byang chub sems dpa' dag pa rnams dang thabs cig tu bla na med pa'i 'byor pas chos kyi longs spyod bla na med pa 'byor pa'o //
translated: In that, the Bhagavān Amitābha, together with the pure bodhisattvas, enjoys the unsurpassed enjoyment of Dharma through unsurpassed wealth.

original: rgyal ba'i dkyil 'khor de ci 'dra snyam pa la /
analyzed: rgyal ba'i dkyil 'khor de ci 'dra snyam pa la /
translated: What is that maṇḍala of the Victorious One like?

original: bzang zhing dga' ba zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: bzang zhing dga' ba zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: It is said to be excellent and delightful.

original: de la bzang ba ni kha dog dang @232b dbyibs sna tshogs pa phun sum tshogs pa'i khyad par la sogs pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de la bzang ba ni kha dog dang @232b dbyibs sna tshogs pa phun sum tshogs pa'i khyad par la sogs pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The good is endowed with the excellence of various colors and shapes, etc.

original: dga' ba ni las bzang po sna tshogs kyi bye brag gis spras pa dang / lha dang mi'i las shin tu 'das pa'i yon tan gyis nyams dga' ba dang / sems dga' ba'i phyir dga' ba'o //
analyzed: dga' ba ni las bzang po sna tshogs kyi bye brag gis spras pa dang / lha dang mi'i las shin tu 'das pa'i yon tan gyis nyams dga' ba dang / sems dga' ba'i phyir dga' ba'o //
translated: The delight is the delight of the mind, because it is adorned with the various specific good actions, and because it is delightful due to the excellences that transcend the actions of gods and men.

original: der zhes bya ba ni der te ;
analyzed: der zhes bya ba ni der te ;
translated: There means there.

original: rgyal ba'i dkyil 'khor bzang zhing dga' ba der //🔽zhes bya bar sbyar ro //🔽padma dam pa shin tu mdzes las skyes //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i dkyil 'khor bzang zhing dga' ba der // zhes bya bar sbyar ro // padma dam pa shin tu mdzes las skyes //
translated: In that good, delightful mandala of the Victor,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: one is born from a sublime lotus, very beautiful.

original: padma smos pas ni skye ba'i gnas kyi khyad par ston te /
analyzed: padma smos pas ni skye ba'i gnas kyi khyad par ston te /
translated: By mentioning the lotus, the excellence of the place of birth is shown.

original: mngal la sogs pa nas mi skye ba'o //
analyzed: mngal la sogs pa nas mi skye ba'o //
translated: One is not born from a womb, etc.

original: dam pa zhes bya ba ni mchog ste rin po che la sogs pa'i rgyu las gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa zhes bya ba ni mchog ste rin po che la sogs pa'i rgyu las gyur pa'o //
translated: The sublime is the best, made of precious substances, etc.

original: mdzes pa zhes bya ba ni mdangs sdug pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: mdzes pa zhes bya ba ni mdangs sdug pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The beautiful is endowed with a lovely luster.

original: mchog tu yid 'phrog cing lta na sdug pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mchog tu yid 'phrog cing lta na sdug pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is a synonym for “extremely captivating and beautiful to behold.🔽” “

original: skyes zhes bya ba ni byung ba'o //
analyzed: skyes zhes bya ba ni byung ba'o //
translated: Born” means “arisen.🔽” “

original: lung bstan pa yang bdag gis der thob shog //🔽ces bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽lung bstan pa ni ma 'ongs pa na sangs rgyas su 'gyur bar ji ltar 'dod pa'i zhing dang 'khor la sogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan par 'gyur bar 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bka' stsal pa 'am /
analyzed: lung bstan pa yang bdag gis der thob shog // ces bya ba la sogs pa la / lung bstan pa ni ma 'ongs pa na sangs rgyas su 'gyur bar ji ltar 'dod pa'i zhing dang 'khor la sogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan par 'gyur bar 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bka' stsal pa 'am /
translated: May I attain the prophecy there.”

original: sems la gzugs brnyan du mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: sems la gzugs brnyan du mdzad pa'o //
translated: Regarding this, the prophecy is the statement made to the bodhisattvas in the circle of the assembly or the mental image that is made that in the future one will become a buddha endowed with the particularities of a field, retinue, and so on, as one desires.🔽“

original: thob ces bya ba ni thos pa'o //
analyzed: thob ces bya ba ni thos pa'o //
translated: Attain” means “hear.🔽”

original: su las she na /
analyzed: su las she na /
translated: From whom?🔽“

original: rgyal ba 'od dpag med las mngon sum du zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rgyal ba 'od dpag med las mngon sum du zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: From the Victor Amitābha directly.”

original: bcom ldan 'das 'od dpag med de las mngon sum du zhal nas mngon du 'thob kyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'od dpag med de las mngon sum du zhal nas mngon du 'thob kyi /
translated: From the Bhagavat Amitābha directly, face to face, one attains the prophecy.

original: lkog nas ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lkog nas ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not secretly, is what is meant.🔽“

original: lung bstan pa yang der ni rab thob nas //
analyzed: lung bstan pa yang der ni rab thob nas //
translated: Having attained the prophecy there,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor der bcom ldan 'das las mngon sum du lung bstan pa thob nas so //🔽sprul pa bye ba phrag brgya du ma yis //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor der bcom ldan 'das las mngon sum du lung bstan pa thob nas so // sprul pa bye ba phrag brgya du ma yis //
translated: Thus, etc. is the direct prediction from the Lord that they received in the Lord's circle of followers.🔽With many hundreds of thousands of emanations

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /

original: sprul pa ni bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis bskyed pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams so ;
analyzed: sprul pa ni bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis bskyed pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams so ;
translated: Emanations are Buddhas and Bodhisattvas generated by the power of meditation and concentration.

original: ; de dag bye ba phrag brgya ni sprul pa bye ba phrag brgya'o //
analyzed: ; de dag bye ba phrag brgya ni sprul pa bye ba phrag brgya'o //
translated: Hundreds of thousands of them are many hundreds of thousands of emanations.

original: du ma zhes bya ba ni kun du grangs med pa'o //
analyzed: du ma zhes bya ba ni kun du grangs med pa'o //
translated: Many means innumerable.

original: phyogs bcu rnams su zhes bya ba ni phyogs bcu thams cad du'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu rnams su zhes bya ba ni phyogs bcu thams cad du'o //
translated: In the ten directions means in all ten directions.

original: blo yi stobs kyis zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi stobs te /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mchog dang ldan @233a * //
analyzed: blo yi stobs kyis zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi stobs te / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mchog dang ldan @233a * //
translated: By the power of mind means by the power of wisdom.

original: pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that they are endowed with the highest perfection of wisdom.

original: rtogs par 'dod pa'i don thams cad de la 'god pas blo'o //
analyzed: rtogs par 'dod pa'i don thams cad de la 'god pas blo'o //
translated: Mind is that which places all objects of knowledge in it.

original: de ltar sems can rnams la ban pa zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams la mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar sems can rnams la ban pa zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams la mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'o //
translated: Thus, for the sake of sentient beings means for the sake of sentient beings, that is, for the sake of generating the roots of virtue that cause sentient beings to attain nirvana.

original: mang po zhes bya ba ni mtha' yas pa rnams so //
analyzed: mang po zhes bya ba ni mtha' yas pa rnams so //
translated: Many means infinite.

original: bgyi zhes bya ba ni bsgrub bo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bgyi zhes bya ba ni bsgrub bo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Do means accomplish.

original: de ltar bsags pa'i bsod nams yongs su bsngo ba bstan nas /🔽da ni bzang po spyod pa'i smon lam bton pa yis //
analyzed: de ltar bsags pa'i bsod nams yongs su bsngo ba bstan nas / da ni bzang po spyod pa'i smon lam bton pa yis //
translated: Thus, having taught the dedication of the merit that has been accumulated,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis bstan pa'i yongs su bsngo ba mdor bsdus te ston to //🔽bzang po spyod pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' kun du bzang po'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis bstan pa'i yongs su bsngo ba mdor bsdus te ston to // bzang po spyod pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' kun du bzang po'o //
translated: now, in one verse, he teaches the brief teaching of the dedication that was taught in the noble Akṣayamatisūtra with the words,🔽By reciting the prayer of the noble Akṣayamatisūtra,🔽The noble Akṣayamatisūtra is the prayer of the noble Samantabhadra.

original: de'i spyod pa ni bzang po spyod pa ste yon tan sna tshogs rgya che ba du ma dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i spyod pa ni bzang po spyod pa ste yon tan sna tshogs rgya che ba du ma dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The conduct of that one is the good conduct, which is endowed with many kinds of vast qualities.

original: de nyid kyi smon pa'i bye brag gi rang bzhin yin pas smon lam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi smon pa'i bye brag gi rang bzhin yin pas smon lam zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called prayer because it is the nature of a particular aspiration of that one.

original: de bzhin du de ston pa'i sgra'i rang bzhin la yang smon lam zhes brjod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du de ston pa'i sgra'i rang bzhin la yang smon lam zhes brjod par 'gyur te /
translated: Likewise, the nature of the sound that teaches it is called a vow.

original: 'dul ba bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dul ba bzhin no //
translated: Like the Vinaya.

original: de bton pa zhes bya ba ni glegs bam du byas pa la sogs pa bton pa'o //🔽dge ba cung zad bdag gis bsags pa gang //
analyzed: de bton pa zhes bya ba ni glegs bam du byas pa la sogs pa bton pa'o // dge ba cung zad bdag gis bsags pa gang //
translated: The recitation is the recitation of the scriptures, etc.🔽Whatever little virtue I have accumulated

original: zhes bya ba ni bdag gis dge ba bsod nams bsags pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bdag gis dge ba bsod nams bsags pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: is whatever virtue and merit I have accumulated.

original: kun du bsags shing tshogs su byas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: kun du bsags shing tshogs su byas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is accumulated and gathered together.

original: des ni zhes bya ba dge bas zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: des ni zhes bya ba dge bas zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: By that means by the virtue.

original: 'gro ba'i zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi tshogs zad par bgyi'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi tshogs zad par bgyi'o //
translated: The world means the mass of sentient beings.

original: smon lam zhes bya ba ni smon pa'i khyad par te /
analyzed: smon lam zhes bya ba ni smon pa'i khyad par te /
translated: The vow is a special aspiration,

original: bzang po spyod pa zhes bya ba 'di nyid do //
analyzed: bzang po spyod pa zhes bya ba 'di nyid do //
translated: namely this very one called The Vows of Good Conduct.

original: dge ba zhes bya ba ni dkar po ste de kha na ma tho ba med pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dge ba zhes bya ba ni dkar po ste de kha na ma tho ba med pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The virtue is the wholesome, and the meaning is that it is without fault.

original: skad cig tu yang thams cad 'byor par shog / ces bya ba ni sems can re re'i skad cig skad cig la 'byor pa grub par gyur cig ces bya ba yin te /
analyzed: skad cig tu yang thams cad 'byor par shog / ces bya ba ni sems can re re'i skad cig skad cig la 'byor pa grub par gyur cig ces bya ba yin te /
translated: This means that may they be endowed with everything in every instant of every sentient being.

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni ma lus pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni ma lus pa'o //
translated: Everything means without exception.

original: bzang spyod yongs su bsngos pa'i bsod nams ni //
analyzed: bzang spyod yongs su bsngos pa'i bsod nams ni //
translated: The merit of dedicating the Good Practice

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di man chad kyis ni bton pa dang / bsgom pas bsdus pa'i smon lam bye brag med par yongs su bsngo ba bston te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di man chad kyis ni bton pa dang / bsgom pas bsdus pa'i smon lam bye brag med par yongs su bsngo ba bston te /
translated: From here onward, up to “the merit of dedicating the Good Practice,” it teaches the dedication without distinction of the aspirations included in the recitation and meditation.

original: kun du bzang po'i spyod pa thog ma dang tha ma med pa zab cing rgya @233b che ba'i rang bzhin /
analyzed: kun du bzang po'i spyod pa thog ma dang tha ma med pa zab cing rgya @233b che ba'i rang bzhin /
translated: The conduct of Samantabhadra is without beginning or end, and has the nature of being profound and vast.

original: bskal pa mi nyung bar bsags pa byang chub sems dpa' kun du bzang po'i spyod pa bsngos pa'i ste //
analyzed: bskal pa mi nyung bar bsags pa byang chub sems dpa' kun du bzang po'i spyod pa bsngos pa'i ste //
translated: It is accumulated over many eons, and is the conduct of the bodhisattva Samantabhadra.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi khyad par bla na med par yongs su kun du bsngos pa'i 'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi khyad par bla na med par yongs su kun du bsngos pa'i 'o //
translated: It is dedicated to the unsurpassed, distinctive wisdom of omniscience.

original: mtha' yas shin du khyad par 'phags thob gang //
analyzed: mtha' yas shin du khyad par 'phags thob gang //
translated: It is dedicated to the infinite, most exalted attainment.

original: zhes bya ba ni bsod nams dge ba mtha' yas shing dpag tu med pa thob pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsod nams dge ba mtha' yas shing dpag tu med pa thob pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: This is the attainment of infinite, immeasurable merit.

original: sems can la phan pa dang bde ba bskyed pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir dang / thabs kyi khyad par dpag tu med pa dag bsgrub pa'i phyir dang dus dpag tu med par bsgrub pa'i phyir bsod nams mtha' yas so //🔽shin du khyad par 'phags zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems can la phan pa dang bde ba bskyed pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir dang / thabs kyi khyad par dpag tu med pa dag bsgrub pa'i phyir dang dus dpag tu med par bsgrub pa'i phyir bsod nams mtha' yas so // shin du khyad par 'phags zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is infinite merit because it is the basis for generating benefit and happiness for sentient beings, because it accomplishes immeasurable special methods, and because it accomplishes them for an immeasurable time.🔽It is most exalted means

original: mchog tu khyad par 'phags pa gtso bor gyur pa ste /
analyzed: mchog tu khyad par 'phags pa gtso bor gyur pa ste /
translated: it is preeminent, most exalted.

original: de yang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rgyur gyur pa'i phyir dang / mi dmigs pa'i rnam pa'i ye shes kyis yongs su zin pa'i phyir bsod nams shin du khyad par du 'phags par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rgyur gyur pa'i phyir dang / mi dmigs pa'i rnam pa'i ye shes kyis yongs su zin pa'i phyir bsod nams shin du khyad par du 'phags par rig par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, it should be understood that merit is most exalted because it becomes the cause of the wisdom of omniscience and because it is embraced by the wisdom of the aspect of nonapprehending.

original: 'dis ni bsod nams 'di'i don che ba nyid dang mthu che ba nyid ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni bsod nams 'di'i don che ba nyid dang mthu che ba nyid ston to //
translated: This shows the greatness of purpose and the great power of this merit.

original: de yis zhes bya ba ni bsod nams rnam pa 'di lta bu des so //
analyzed: de yis zhes bya ba ni bsod nams rnam pa 'di lta bu des so //
translated: By it means by this kind of merit.

original: 'gro ba sdug bsngal chu bor byid pa rnams //
analyzed: 'gro ba sdug bsngal chu bor byid pa rnams //
translated: Those beings who are drowning in the river of suffering.

original: zhes bya ba ni skyes shing skyes pa 'gro ba'i phyir 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni skyes shing skyes pa 'gro ba'i phyir 'gro ba'o //
translated: Those who are born again and again are beings, because they go.

original: sdug bsngal chu bor bying ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal chu bor bying ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are drowning in the river of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal rnams ni skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mi sdug pa dang phrad pa dang / sdug pa dang bral ba la sogs rnam pa du ma ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnams ni skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mi sdug pa dang phrad pa dang / sdug pa dang bral ba la sogs rnam pa du ma ste /
translated: Suffering is of many kinds: birth, old age, disease, death, association with the unpleasant, separation from the pleasant, etc.

original: de dag dang ldan pa dang / de dag gis bsdams sam /🔽bde ba la bye brag gam /
analyzed: de dag dang ldan pa dang / de dag gis bsdams sam / bde ba la bye brag gam /
translated: They are possessed by suffering, or they are bound by suffering,🔽or they are separated from happiness,

original: thag ring por 'bral zhing 'gyes par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thag ring por 'bral zhing 'gyes par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or they are far removed from happiness.

original: de nyid du chu bo ste /
analyzed: de nyid du chu bo ste /
translated: The river of suffering is just that.

original: yun ring po nas 'phel ba'i rgyun 'jug pa dang mi zlog par 'jug pa dang / de'i rgyun las byung ba'i mi dge ba'i las du ma byung ba'i rang bzhin gyis ngan song du son cing ltung ba'i phyir chu'i chu bo dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yun ring po nas 'phel ba'i rgyun 'jug pa dang mi zlog par 'jug pa dang / de'i rgyun las byung ba'i mi dge ba'i las du ma byung ba'i rang bzhin gyis ngan song du son cing ltung ba'i phyir chu'i chu bo dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is like a river of water, because it flows on for a long time, because it flows on without turning back, and because it carries along with its current the many kinds of nonvirtuous actions that arise from it, and it carries beings off to the miserable states of existence and makes them fall.

original: chu bor bying ba ni nges par de'i bdag nyid dang ldan par gnas par ste /
analyzed: chu bor bying ba ni nges par de'i bdag nyid dang ldan par gnas par ste /
translated: Those who are submerged in the river of cyclic existence are definitely abiding in the nature of that.

original: de'i dbang du gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i dbang du gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That is to say, they are under its power.🔽May I go to the realm of Amitabha.

original: 'od dpag med pa'i gnas rab 'gro bar shog / ces bya ba la bcom ldan 'das 'od dpag med kyi gnas ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing ngo //
analyzed: 'od dpag med pa'i gnas rab 'gro bar shog / ces bya ba la bcom ldan 'das 'od dpag med kyi gnas ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing ngo //
translated: The realm of the Bhagavat Amitabha is the buddhaverse.

original: ci 'dra snyam pa la /
analyzed: ci 'dra snyam pa la /
translated: What is it like?🔽It is said to be

original: rab ces bya ba @234a * //🔽gsungs te / yon tan sna tshogs bsam gyis mi khyab pa dpag tu med pa /
analyzed: rab ces bya ba @234a * // gsungs te / yon tan sna tshogs bsam gyis mi khyab pa dpag tu med pa /
translated: excellent,🔽adorned with hundreds of inconceivable, immeasurable, various qualities,

original: rgya che ba brgya phrag gis rab tu brgyan pa /
analyzed: rgya che ba brgya phrag gis rab tu brgyan pa /
translated: vast,

original: mchog tu bde ba dang yid bde ba'i gnas su gyur pa /
analyzed: mchog tu bde ba dang yid bde ba'i gnas su gyur pa /
translated: the abode of supreme bliss and mental satisfaction,

original: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas lta bur skye bo mtha' dag la phan pa bskyed par gyur pa'o ;
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas lta bur skye bo mtha' dag la phan pa bskyed par gyur pa'o ;
translated: the source of benefit for all beings, like the abode of nonabiding nirvana.🔽May I go to that realm.

original: ;'gro bar shog ces bya ba la ni 'gro ba 'am 'jug par shog shig ces bya bar bsgyur te /
analyzed: ;'gro bar shog ces bya ba la ni 'gro ba 'am 'jug par shog shig ces bya bar bsgyur te /
translated: The word go should be translated as to go or to enter.

original: 'gro ba thams cad 'jug par shog shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad 'jug par shog shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: May all beings enter it.

original: kun du bzang po'i mtshan don mthun pa yi //
analyzed: kun du bzang po'i mtshan don mthun pa yi //
translated: The name Samantabhadra is meaningful,

original: kun du bzang po'i spyod pa rnams phye ba'i //
analyzed: kun du bzang po'i spyod pa rnams phye ba'i //
translated: And the conduct of Samantabhadra is revealed.

original: dge ba kun du bzang po de yis ni //
analyzed: dge ba kun du bzang po de yis ni //
translated: By that wholesome Samantabhadra,🔽May the world become like Samantabhadra.

original: 'jig rten kun du bzang po 'dra bar shog / sh'akya'i bshes gnyen blo ldan gyis //
analyzed: 'jig rten kun du bzang po 'dra bar shog / sh'akya'i bshes gnyen blo ldan gyis //
translated: The wise friend of the Shakya clan,

original: sh'akya'i gdung rgyud 'phel bya'i phyir //🔽kun du bzang po'i spyod pa yi //
analyzed: sh'akya'i gdung rgyud 'phel bya'i phyir // kun du bzang po'i spyod pa yi //
translated: In order to increase the Shakya lineage,🔽Has composed this excellent commentary

original: rgya cher 'grel pa rab bzang byas //
analyzed: rgya cher 'grel pa rab bzang byas //
translated: On the conduct of Samantabhadra.

original: 'phags pa bzang po spyod pa'i smon lam gyi rgyal po'i rgya cher 'grel pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa bzang po spyod pa'i smon lam gyi rgyal po'i rgya cher 'grel pa /
translated: The commentary on the noble King of Prayers, the Sutra of the White Lotus of Compassion,

original: slob dpon sh'akya'i bshes gnyen gyis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: slob dpon sh'akya'i bshes gnyen gyis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: is completed.

original: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po sh'akya seng ha dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba ban de dpal brtsegs kyis zhus te gtan la phab pa'o /
analyzed: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po sh'akya seng ha dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba ban de dpal brtsegs kyis zhus te gtan la phab pa'o /
translated: The Indian abbot Shakya Senge and the great editor and translator Bandhe Pal Tseg translated and finalized it.
